job_category: Real Estate / Property Management, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a market leader in the Real Estate Industry. They are looking for a Retail Operation Manager to assist their team for the next phase of their business. They are located in the Central - easily accessible.
Responsibilities:
Guiding the Operations team in the strategic planning and implementation of initiatives to improve and protect asset values.
Deploying suitable programs to ensure the uninterrupted functioning of critical services, including utilities, air conditioning, fire protection, and security.
Ensuring staff members receive comprehensive training in fire and life safety systems maintenance and operations.
Overseeing the execution of all services and preventive maintenance programs on a consistent and effective basis.
Promptly and efficiently addressing service calls and work orders.
Compiling annual reviews of the Asset Plan for each asset within the portfolio and executing approved plans.
Administering leases with tenants, managing the handover and takeover of leased units, and overseeing tenant renovation processes and tenant relations.
Requirements:
A bachelor's degree in Real Estate or Property Management.
A minimum of 6 years of applicable experience in property, retail, and/or tenant management.
Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please click APPLY NOW or email an updated copy of your resume/cv.
We regret that only shortlisted candidate will be notified.

title: Operations Executive (Facilities Management) - 2 Months
company_info: Savills Property Management, became a subsidiary after Savills Singapore acquired a stake in CKH Strata Management and merged their property management business. The founding Director, Mr Chan Kok Hong’s vision was to provide his clients with the very best strata management advice and service, on par with international standards but with local knowledge and expertise. This vision can now be taken to the next level by tapping into Savills Global network and expertise where Savills has over 1 billion sq ft of properties under management. Savills Property Management Pte Ltd has set itself apart from its competition through professionalism, service excellence, efficiency, integrity, strategic application of information technology and concern for the welfare of the residents. Today, it has become the largest privately held strata management company with a staff strength of over 500 and services over 160 clients, including landmark buildings such as DUO, Shopping/Office/Hotel Complex, orchardgateway, orchardgateway@emrald, 20 Collyer Quay, Sim Lim Square and Singapore larger condominiums such as The Interlace, Parc Oasis, Signature Park and Costal Del Sol. At Savills Property Management, we are committed to developing, supporting and empowering our employees. We are currently seeking suitable candidates with the passion for strata management to join us.

company: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. is a subsidiary of the VDL Group, an international industrial company with its headquarters in Eindhoven, The Netherlands. The company started its operations in 1970 as a manufacturer of machine parts used in factory automation and assemblies for its then-parent company. Over the years, we haveaccumulated valued competencies that has enabled us to grow as an equipment manufacturer. Today, we are a world-class capital equipment contract manufacturing company operating worldwide, employing committed people to provide our customers in the semiconductor and LED equipment industries with innovative and unique technological solutions and logistical services. With our rapid expansion and new facility, we seek dynamic and like-minded individuals to join us. Advance the world of engineering possibilities, realize your potential and succeed with us here at VDL Enabling Technologies Group.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose: This is a senior role in the organization and will have the resources and full operational responsibility to:
Lead and develop the parts production and fabrication department to visualize and realize our the company’s vision to become the role model for smart manufacturing
Lead and develop the department to meet our customers’ expectations (present and future) in product quality, performance, lead-time and cost – supporting the company’s goal in highest customer satisfaction and profitability.
Key areas of responsibilities:
Define the operational strategies of the department to support the long and short-term objectives of the company.
To define clear responsibilities and accountability of direct reports and ensure effective deployment of goals to the different levels of the department.
To continuously improve the operational performance of the department (quality, lead-time, delivery performance, costs and safety).
To identify and develop the core competencies of staff.
Define short and long-term manpower plans and resources required to support the business goals.
To define the technology roadmap and recommend the investment of new technology and machines to stay ahead of the competition.
Qualification & Experiences:
Degree in mechanical, manufacturing, Engineering, or other equivalent
Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience
Knowledge of Parts Manufacturing production management
Knowledge of risk management and safety regulations
Leadership skills
Strong project management skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with in-depth knowledge of quality approaches
Knowledgeable of lean/six sigma methodology.

title: F&B Operations Manager (Delifrance)
company_info: We are a dynamic, new division under OUE Limited (SGX-ST: “OUE”), on a mission to create genuine dining experiences guests love. We are gearing to grow a stable of innovative restaurants in Singapore and abroad, and are now seeking highly motivated and passionate individuals to embark on this exciting journey with us.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Operations Manager will provide the leadership, management and foresight required to ensure that the business productivity is at its optimal level, through implementation and maintenance of the most efficient and effective operational controls, administration, and reporting procedures.
Provide Assistant Operations Manager with strategic direction to accomplish business objectives, some of the job functions includes:

1. Leadership and responsibility in People Person Management and Development – P&L, Code of Conduct, compliance management, induction, training and development program for various levels, recruitment, retention, stability, and turnover.
2. To act as a trainer and coach to develop succession plan program, understand and support the Company’s strategy, direction, and long-term vision; and ensure that communication to the Assistant Operations Manager and Area Managers are easy to understand for successful implementation.
3. Operations Excellence – RQA/Mystery Shopper programs, product quality, service excellence, setting and ambience, administration systems, performance evaluation, performance tracking (balance scorecard), compensation and benefits, reward schemes.

Roles & Responsibilities
• To enforce the structural plan set in place by the management and support the business plan for growth. This will include manpower planning at Retail Operations level, Operations Support, Training and Development, Maintenance and Quality Assurance requirements. Work closely with the General Manager, Assistant Operations Manager, Area Managers and Outlet Managers to achieve the structural plan through recruitment of the right personnel for these positions.
• Ensure Assistant Operations Manager has appropriately allocated manpower and resources within the operations and support structures. To review progress and make mid-course corrections if necessary.
• Work closely with Assistant Operations Manager to ensure adequate labour manning and at the same time keeping labour cost within AOP limits. This is achieved with weekly labour planning of hours by outlet with some flexibility to adjust for sales upsides and downsides. Monitor the labour budget for salary, benefits, and incentives to prevent over-runs.
• Establish a collaborative operation approach to interdepartmental communication and process implementation. E.g., Coordinate with IT Department for technical and information services processes.
• Manage new outlets openings by coordinating with relevant departments and vendors on logistics, deliveries, internet, phone line, POS setup, etc.
• Provides accurate monthly reports on the operating condition of the Company to Management in a timely manner.
• Monitor performance of Assistant Operations Manager and ensure recognition is provided when OKRs are met, or else propose corrective measures in case of performance deterioration.
• Work closely with Assistant Operations Manager and Human Resource Department in the regular and annual performance review of Operations personnel to ensure recognition and rewards given to deserving Operations personnel.
• Work with Assistant Operations Manager to ensure compliance of controls and procedures based on the Operating Manuals and Policies.
• Work with Assistant Operations Manager to ensure compliance by Operations team to the Company’s Human Resource Policy and Procedures and Code of Conduct.
• Work closely with Assistant Operations Manager to enforce compliance and implement disciplinary procedures whenever necessary to maintain standards of performance and integrity amongst staff.
• Ensure compliance of Operations team to statutory regulations through clear communication to Operations personnel and ensure understanding of these regulations by Operations personnel.
• To continuously look for ways to improve productivity, increase operations efficiency, and simplicity.
• Assist in developing and implementing Outlet’s Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) to enable Operations’ teams to understand and operate within the Company’s established operating control standards and assist in improvising changes whenever necessary to align with industry standards and practices.
• Assist in driving Operations team towards achieving Targets set by management.
• Assist in ensuring product, service and store excellence achieved through various programs such as monthly RQA/ Mystery Shopper, KPI tracking through balance scorecard, P&L target setting and Retail Incentive Scheme rewards.
• Work with Area Managers to ensure regular maintenance of outlet assets and facilities to ensure equipment and décor at outlets are in good operating condition. Implement preventive measures on repairs and maintenance to minimize disruption to operations due to breakdowns.
• Ensure that all Company funds, assets, and property located at outlets are properly administered, handled, and safeguarded. Work with Operation Manager and Area Managers to enforce compliance to Cash Handling Policy and other Company Policies to safeguard these resources and take prompt action to rectify should theft or loss happens.
• Follow up on all consumer feedback, compliments and complaints and work with Operational Manager and Area Managers to ensure that these are handled promptly and timely with guest recovery plans.
• Plan and work on budgets to maximise profits and achieve sales targets set by Management.

Qualifications and Education Requirements
• Must have experience in F&B chains, managing at least 15 outlets.
• Candidate must possess at least a Diploma with at least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the food & beverage industry.
• Prior knowledge in running operations and shift work.
• Self-motivated and able to manage multiple and complex tasks in a fast-paced environment.
• Evaluate current operational strategies and recommend improvements.
• A good team player and able to work independently.
• Excellent leadership skills with good initiatives, able to analyse and think flexibly.
• Experience in manpower requirements, work assignments and schedules for new projects.
• Evaluate current operational strategies and recommend improvements.

title: Operations Manager
company_info: TRANSPEED CARGO (S) PTE LTD was established in 1985 as one of the leading local forwarders in Singapore, and is an accredited member of IATA since 1991. We are conveniently located in the Free Trade Zone airport cargo complex, and are fully equipped with a warehouse and various facilities. With our strategically location we are able to provide fast and efficient services to cater to our clients' and associated agents' requirement. In November 1992, we expanded our activities to Phnom Penh, Kingdom of Cambodia. Thus we are able to provide 'Door-to-Door' and 'Freight Collect' service to Cambodia. Transpeed Cargo opened new office at Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam, in October 2008 namely TSP Cargo Co Ltd. The following year December 2009 our Shanghai, China office is in operations, namely TSP Logistics (China) Co Ltd. Transpeed opened a new office at Yangon, Myanmar, in January 2014, namely Transpeed Logistics (Myanmar) Ltd. Years of experience, coupled with a thorough knowledge of the freight-forwarding market, and the use of proven and reliable carriers, allows our air and sea-freight departments to ship all types of commodities anywhere in the world. quickly and cost efficiently. By working closely with each customer, we aim to develop tailor-made solutions based on each client's specific time and cost requirements.

Manage teams in the workplace

title: Operations Manager
company: FOUR SEASONS FOOD SOLUTION PTE. LTD.
company_info: Four Seasons Food Solution was established in 2016, borne out of the need to address issues faced by many in the food industry. By consolidating food preparation operations, consistency in the quality of food and an efficient manpower management was achieved. Initially providing ready-to-eat and ready-to-cook products to Group’s own catering brands, the company is now poised to expand its services to the foodservice industry in Singapore.
address: FOUR SEASONS FOOD BUILDING, 39 MACTAGGART ROAD 368084
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
We're searching for an individual who embodies the belief that exceptional service leads to increased sales. This person should excel at team management, inspiring and guiding their colleagues towards success. They'll be adept at establishing standard operating procedures (SOPs) that empower the team to consistently deliver outstanding results. Moreover, this candidate will possess the creativity to envision setups tailored to each customer's unique needs. While a background in catering is beneficial, it's not a strict requirement. What truly matters is a proven track record in operations management and team leadership.
If you're ready to be part of a dedicated team committed to making dreams a reality, we can't wait to hear from you.

Responsibilities

Event Planning and Coordination:
Collaborate with the sales team to plan and customize events according to their specific requirements.
Coordinate with various departments to ensure all aspects of an event are organized, including menu selection, staffing, equipment rental, and transportation.
Food Quality Control:
Work closely with the culinary team to align with client preferences Monitor food to ensure high-quality presentation.
Staff Management and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) Development:
Hire, train, and supervise catering staff, including servers, captains (delivery and set up team)
Schedule and allocate resources efficiently based on event requirements.
Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) for the catering team to ensure consistency, efficiency, and high-quality service delivery.
Document and communicate established procedures to all team members and conduct regular training sessions for adherence.
Vendor Management:
Establish and maintain relationships with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely and cost-effective procurement of necessary supplies and equipment.
Budgeting and Financial Management:
Develop and manage budgets for individual events and the overall catering operation.
Monitor expenses, control costs, and ensure profitability.
Compliance and Safety, Quality Assurance, and Continuous Improvement:
Ensure compliance with all relevant health, safety, and sanitation standards.
Address any issues related to health inspections, permits, and licenses.
Conduct regular audits of catering processes to ensure compliance with SOPs and maintain high standards of service.
Analyze event outcomes and client feedback to identify areas for improvement and implement necessary changes.
Customer Service and Client Relations:
Provide excellent customer service and maintain strong relationships with clients to ensure satisfaction and repeat business.
Handle client inquiries, concerns, and special requests in a professional manner.
Problem Solving and Crisis Management:
Address any issues or emergencies that arise during events, ensuring swift resolution and minimal disruption.
Post-Event Evaluation:
Conduct post-event evaluations to gather feedback from clients and guests, and use this information to make improvements for future events.
Set-Up Conceptualization:
Creatively conceptualize event set-ups, including table arrangements, decorations, and overall ambiance, in line with client preferences and event themes.
Collaborate with clients and design teams to bring their vision to life while ensuring logistical feasibility.
Team Leadership and Development:
Provide strong leadership and mentorship to the catering team, fostering a positive and productive work environment.
Conduct performance evaluations, provide feedback, and facilitate professional development opportunities for team members.
Technology and Systems Management:
Utilize catering management software to streamline operations, track event details, manage client information, and generate reports for analysis and improvement.
Skills and Experience
Ideally, a background of at least 3 years in a similar setting would be greatly advantageous.
Possession of a valid Singapore Class 3 driving license for a Van or Lorry would be a valuable asset.
Demonstrates exceptional leadership acumen, inspiring and energizing team members toward shared success.
Exhibits superb communication and presentation abilities, ensuring effective interaction with colleagues
Displays a knack for creative and strategic thinking, enriching problem-solving capabilities.
Familiarity with or prior involvement in the F&B industry is highly valued.
Flexibility to work varying shifts, weekends, and even on Public Holidays showcases your dedication.
Capable of handling relatively heavy loads, a quality pivotal to this role.

title: Commercial Operations Manager
company_info: CAVASIA PTE. LTD. cavAsia is as system and solution provider, we have good engineering know-how to design technically complex systems, have experience project execution team on site to execute and meet fast-track project schedules without compromising quality, as well as assertive safety personnel to ensure all aspect of safety are complied with. Our Singapore and Malaysia team has the technical capabilities to design and build all kinds of Cleanroom Systems, HVAC, Process, Exhaust, Electrical, Control and Instrumentation systems and focus primarily in the electronic, solar renewable energy, hospital, pharmaceutical and other high tech industries. Other than being a turn-key or specialist trade contractor, we also provide facility management services, design consultation, construction management and EPCM services to assist our clients to control and manage projects on site.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What you will do:
As a Commercial Operations Manager, you will Supervises the execution of small projects. Serves as primary on-site project leader, following standardized project management procedures. Uses standard tracking tools to report project progress. Evaluates project costs and progress against budget and plan.

How you will do it:
Driving Commercial Excellence/Results:
Work with the management to develop/oversee a smooth & effective sales forecasting process to enable the growth of cavAsia in both SG and MY.
Track and analyze key metrics including pipeline generation/growth, forecast accuracy, win/loss rates, sales productivity and quota attainment.

Internal Process Improvements & Monitoring - Ownership and in-depth review of current business/operation processes to identify gaps and provide related recommendations /enhancements.

Drive P&L and Commercial Operations – Work closely with the project teams and Project Cost Controller to regular monitoring and tracking P&L related items such as:
Project Cost forecast and execution – monthly cadence by working with respective PMs to get the COGS forecast for the month. Review and formulate mitigation plan if fail to meet Revenue/GM target.
Manage project cashflow, AR and Unbilled Revenue figures to meet target. Support AR by talking to client where necessary to chase payments for overdue invoices. Payment Requisition Form issuance against PO issue. Monitor and follow up with Procurement for timely PO issuance, especially for urgent PO.
Co-ordinate with finance and AP team to ensure on time payment to Vendors. Monitor IBC reports to ensure issues are resolved on time.
Weekly meeting with Project Admin to track MIGO status and outstanding issues in FS2 & IBC reports. Subcon/Vendor due invoices must be paid on time as per JCI payment cycle.

Project Admin – Lead, Monitor & manage the Project Admin team to ensure SAP MIGO, PRF and GPR are completed on time.

CIS Booking – Major Project VOs. In charge of CIS for major project VO booking and work with Sales Admin to book into SAP.

Integration – Lead & ensure smooth and timely integration into JCI system. Co-ordination with other departments/stake holders to improve and ensure effective workflow.

Business Development and Strategy – Partner with in-country leaders to assist developing company/region go to market business strategies in order to drive profitable growth (both short & long term). Prepare and implement comprehensive business plans to facilitate achievement by planning cost-effective operations and market/business development activities.

Special Projects - Ad-hoc projects based on management needs.
What we look for:
Bachelor’s degree in in Business, Technology, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 8 to 10 years of relevant experience in Construction sector with increasing level of responsibilities within an MNC. Prior experience with SAP a plus.
Strong business partnering/interpersonal skills and the ability to lead and work within a multi-discipline team with shared purposes. Prior experience in leading individuals to work as an effective team a plus.
Possess advanced analytical and objective critical thinking skills with the ability to effectively balance financial and operational needs in order to deliver timely and appropriate solutions to complex business issues.

Position Overview:The Sales Operations Management Coordinator is a vital role within our organization, responsible for driving sales, overseeing inventory management, building strong relationships with suppliers and customers, and ensuring smooth operational processes. Sales:Drive sales initiatives to meet and exceed monthly and annual targets.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure streamlined operations.
Participate in team meetings, trainings, and continuous professional development opportunities.
Any other tasks and responsibilities as assigned by the supervisor or management.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The job scope of a Beauty Salon Center Manager involves overseeing the daily operations of a beauty salon or spa, ensuring it runs smoothly and efficiently. Here are the key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with this role:
Staff Management:Hiring, training, and supervising salon staff, including hairstylists, estheticians, nail technicians, and receptionists.
Creating work schedules and managing employee performance.
Addressing staff issues and resolving conflicts when they arise.
Customer Service:Ensuring exceptional customer service and satisfaction.
Handling customer inquiries, complaints, and feedback.
Monitoring customer reviews and taking steps to improve service quality.
Inventory and Supplies:Managing salon inventory, including beauty products, hair care products, and equipment.
Ordering supplies and maintaining stock levels.
Negotiating with suppliers to secure favorable terms and pricing.
Financial Management:Creating and managing the salon's budget.
Tracking revenue, expenses, and profitability.
Setting pricing for salon services and retail products.
Handling cash flow and daily financial transactions.
Marketing and Promotion:Developing marketing strategies to attract and retain customers.
Implementing advertising campaigns, promotions, and special offers.
Using social media and online platforms to promote the salon's services.
Salon Maintenance:Ensuring the salon is clean, organized, and well-maintained.
Overseeing equipment maintenance and repairs.
Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.
Business Development:Identifying opportunities for business growth and expansion.
Analyzing market trends and competition.
Developing and implementing business strategies to increase revenue.
Administrative Tasks:Managing appointment scheduling and booking systems.
Handling payroll and other administrative duties.
Keeping accurate records of sales, expenses, and employee hours.
Compliance and Licensing:Ensuring the salon complies with all relevant licenses and permits.
Staying updated on industry regulations and standards.
Client Relations:Building and maintaining strong relationships with regular clients.
Soliciting feedback from clients to improve services.
Training and Education:Staying up-to-date with the latest beauty trends, techniques, and products.
Providing training opportunities for staff to enhance their skills.
Conflict Resolution:Addressing any conflicts or disputes that may arise among staff or clients.

Expected salary: $2,500-4,500 + commission
Please send your resume to waltzaesthectics@gmail.com

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Perform technical validation (TEV) to ensure Customers’ network and site readiness is in line with the services ordering.
Performance monitoring of telecommunications networks.
Preparing a diagram based on idea and plans for installation.
Address order automation fallout including verification & approve correct design, ASR and/or other subtending orders.
Validate all wiring connections & schedule dispatches with field operations.
Activate circuit ensuring Client configuration matches with Customer during scheduled activations/ hot-cuts, as appropriate.
Ensure any change requests are deployed and completed.
Close order post scheduled activation/hot-cut.
Document results of test & acceptance.
Diagnosis and repair of faults, and the selection and installation of equipment.
Track, manage, and resolve all Third-Party Access Provider related activities, milestones, & escalations.
Essential Requirements (Skills Requirements)
Bachelor's Degree/Master’s Degree in Telecommunications, Computer Science or Electronics.
8 years to 10 Years of experience.
Strong understanding of IP addressing/Subnetting/CIDR.
Transport: Ethernet, TDM.
CPE: Cisco, Juniper, Fortinet, Viptela, Versa, Aruba etc.
Protocols: TCP/IP, Private IP, Ethernet, GRE / IPSEC, MLPPP.
Routing Protocols: BGP, EIGRP, OSPF, RIP and Static Routing.
Configuration of QoS, CoS, DNS, VRRP, HSRP, Load Sharing, GLBP, Zone Based Firewall, Policy Based Routing, Access Control Lists, VLAN, WLAN, NAT, PPPoE.
Strong understanding in Standard and Extended Access Lists and IP prefix lists.
GOOD TO HAVE
CCNA or JNCIA certification.
Experience with IPv6.
Transport/ Access: Strong ability to troubleshoot layers 1, 2, and 3.
Network Operations (Managed Services for WLAN, LAN, WAN, IP PBX, Automation/Orchestration).
Wireless technologies (IoT).
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in fast-paced, dynamic environment while multitasking.
Demonstrated interpersonal communication, organization and project management skills.
Highly organized with an ability to manage competing priorities.
Technical / Professional Skills
Preferred CCNA/P or JNCIA certification.
IT based certifications (ex., Intel, Networking, ITIL, etc.).

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
• Lead and supervise the supply chain and order processing team, providing daily guidance and management to enhance supply chain flexibility and reduce costs.
• Manage inventory effectively, ensuring continuous supply and stock availability through efficient procurement and inventory management.
• Maintain the company's stock levels in accordance with recommended standards.
• Oversee the annual stock take and reconciliation of company inventory.
• Periodically assess stock obsolescence and implement action plans.
• Review and provide monthly stock provisions.
• Achieve regional Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for inventory management.
• Generate monthly inventory reports and other regional-required reports.
• Ensure proper workflow in Purchase Order Processing, Goods Received Processing, and handling non-conforming items.
• Collaborate with vendors on purchase and receipt issues, stock shortages, and urgent stock requests.
• Manage insurance claims for damaged or lost goods and cargoes.
• Negotiate contract renewals with third-party logistics service providers.

• Resolve complex billing issues and implement high-quality billing practices and procedures, potentially outsourcing functions while meeting customer expectations.
• Ensure compliance in the billing and supply chain management process.
• Lead monthly sales forecast meetings to support product supply and demand.
• Generate reports comparing actual sales quantities to forecasted quantities and maintain forecast accuracy.
• Serve as an intermediary among stakeholders, including 3PL vendors, accounts receivables, sales, and service counterparts.

• Hold a minimum of a Diploma or Degree in Supply Chain or Logistics.

As a diverse tech-led security organisation, team members enjoy job rotations within the wide Certis Group, with opportunities for continuous learning and the strengthening of skill-sets. Certis offers you a platform to shine in the operations realm and the chance to build meaningful relationships working together with like-minded colleagues. Certis is headquartered in Singapore, with an international presence that extends to Australia, Hong Kong, Macau, China and Qatar.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Certis
We are a leading security services organisation. We put technology to work in making the world a safer place. Our mission is that as trusted partners, we protect lives and assets, and deliver integrated critical services. By empowering our people, our goal is to enable our communities to stay safe and thrive.
We offer a broad range of opportunities and career pathways for our people to grow and explore their potential. We believe that people, equipped with innovative thinking and technological capabilities will make our world safer, smarter and better.
Life at Certis
If you are a passionate individual looking for opportunities to expand your skills, and purposeful work instead of just a ‘job’, we would love to hear from you.
At Certis, no two days look alike. Our work calendars are filled with chances to collaborate with others, and bring new initiatives to life. Whether you’re looking to improve a process, or have an innovative idea awaiting a technology solution, we want you to bring your ideas to the table.
We are a close-knit team that looks out for each other, works hard to get the job done, and encourages each other to grow – the perfect place for you to grow your career!
Position Overview:
You will supervise Quality Learning Centre Operators and Quality Service Supervisors, ensuring the standards of the Quality Management & Training Office are upheld, and oversee the creation of training programs, quality assurance efforts, and continuous improvement initiatives.
Key Responsibilities:
Training & Development:
Ensure the highest standards and consistently deliver top-quality service to our clients.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to create training materials, manuals, and multimedia resources.
Develop quality control measures to the best practices and regulatory requirements.
Conduct training sessions for security personnel, covering topics such as security protocols, emergency response, customer service, and use of matterssecurity equipment.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training sessions, making adjustments as necessary.
Provide feedback and coaching to security personnel to enhance their performance.
Quality Assurance:
Establish and maintain quality assurance processes to assess the current processes
Ensure the highest standards and consistently deliver top-quality service to our clients.
Conduct regular audits and inspections to ensure compliance with security protocols and procedures.
Identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions.
Coordinate all operations matter with stakeholders
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain accurate records of all administrative, IT-related matters and all red teaming records
Generate reports on training effectiveness, compliance, and quality assurance findings.
Communicate findings and recommendations to senior management.
Continuous Improvement:
Stay updated on industry trends, emerging security technologies, and regulatory changes.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and training enhancements.
Lead initiatives to enhance the overall quality and efficiency of department operations.
Skills & Requirements
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., security management, criminal justice, or education) preferred.
At least 3 years of Lean Six Sigma experience with hands-on experience in implementations, coaching and mentoring.
Possesses functional knowledge and management experience with quality, customer satisfaction systems and processes
Experience with developing and implementing quality data collection and reporting procedures
Possesses abilities to influence, negotiate, and resolve conflicts to reach a consensus around common goals
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Excellent organizational and project management abilities.
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
Recognition & Award
What you can expect from us:
Work on world-class security projects renowned for their safety, reliability and efficiency
Commitment to your ongoing development, including on-the-job opportunities, formal programs and assistance with further education
Community volunteering opportunities
A competitive remuneration package, featuring performance-based incentives and a medical insurance and dental allowance.
Certis is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce culture, which is supported by our values. Our aim is to attract, develop and retain a truly diverse and high-performing workforce.

title: Assistant Customer Service Operations Manager
company_info: Dematic is a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 7,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, Dematic is a member of KION Group, a global leader in industrial trucks, related services and supply chain solutions. Across more than 100 countries worldwide, the KION Group designs, builds and supports logistics solutions that optimize material and information flow within factories, warehouses and distribution centers. The company is the largest manufacturer of industrial trucks in Europe, the second-largest producer of forklifts globally and a leading provider of warehouse automation. As a company we take pride in offering our employees a safe and rewarding work environment in which to develop their careers.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This is What You Will do in This Role:
Assist the CS manager to provide the direction, leadership, and coaching for the CS teams in Singapore to achieve and exceed service objectives
Assist the CS manager to champion safe work culture and ensure safety measures are adhered to by the service team.
Assist the CS manager to advance the technical proficiencies/development, professional conduct, and service quality of the CS team.
Assist the CS manager to drive service performance to meet customers’ expectations within budget
Assist the CS manager to ensure a seamless handover from the Project team for new projects going live
Assist the CS manager to identify opportunities for Modernisation and Upgrade (MU) to increase support to existing customers and new business leads
Assist the CS manager to review, proposal, costing, plan and execute Modernisation and Upgrade (MU) projects, to be within schedule and within budget.
Assist the CS manager to review and implement appropriate system modifications according to customers’ requirements
Assist in preparing quotations and estimates for maintenance contracts, spare parts, installation, repair, upgrades and customer support.
Assist the CS manager on Service contract renewals with customers and external providers are completed on time.
Assist the CS manager to plan staff rosters, manage leave applications and work with HR to enable forward planning of resources
Ensure all service personnel are inducted have appropriate safety training and adhere to all safework standards of Dematic and Dematic Customers
Manage and coordinate the appropriate use of third party contractors / subcontractors to achieve customer service objectives
Act with a sense of urgency to manage response to customer breakdowns within the response time
Escalate service and breakdowns to CS manager where support is required and to manage Customer expectations
Ensure the CS teams adopts current technology and maintenance related to Dematic best service practices
Actively contribute to service improvement and efficient/effective maintenance on existing Dematic system
Build relationships with key customers for direct feedback on service standards and improvement opportunities, and develop market contacts
Liaise with product centers and key suppliers to provide technical clarifications
What We are Looking For:
Recognised Engineering degree (Electrical/Mechanical/Computer/Software)
10 years of professional work experience within a regional Customer Service environment leading teams
Experience in project management within the automation space
Work experience in a system integration environment with MHE equipment is preferred
Proven track record of building trust and credible relationships with customers
Strong commercial and business acumen, drive to deliver customer requirements and deadlines
Strong understanding of financial outcomes and ability to meet critical deadlines.
Strong communication and leadership skills, including ability to liaise with all levels of staff.
Ability to be flexible and resourceful in the face of challenging situations.

company_info: Tangspac Consulting is an award-winning professional staffing firm with a 20-year footprint in Asia and headquarters in Singapore dating back to 1993. It offers bespoke contingency search and professional services across various Finance & Technology sectors. Our team of consultants has unparalleled expertise and track-record in serving both buy-side and sell-side firms, including the largest names on Wall Street. We have successfully placed thousands of banking professionals across various business & technology verticals. Clients range from Corporate & Investment Banks, Asset Managers, Custodians, Trusts, Private Banks, to other Publicly Traded Companies. company: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.
company_info: Resorts World Sentosa (RWS), Asia’s premium lifestyle destination resort, is located on Singapore’s resort island of Sentosa. Spanning 49 hectares, RWS is home to world-class attractions including Universal Studios Singapore, S.E.A. Aquarium, the Maritime Experiential Museum, Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark. Complementing the adventure and adrenaline of its theme parks and attractions are six unique luxury hotels, the world-class Resorts World Convention Centre, a casino and the Asian flagship of a world-renowned destination spa. RWS offers award-winning dining experiences and exciting cuisines from around the world across its many renowned celebrity chef restaurants, establishing itself as a key player in Singapore’s vibrant and diverse dining scene and a leading gourmet destination in Asia for epicureans. The integrated resort also offers world-class entertainment, from original resident productions to concerts and public shows such as Crane Dance and Lake of Dreams. RWS has been named “Best Integrated Resort” since 2011 for nine consecutive years at the TTG Travel Awards which recognises the best of Asia-Pacific’s travel industry. RWS is wholly owned by Genting Singapore, a company of the Genting Group. For more information, please visit www.rwsentosa.com.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
Perform operational planning for day-to-day limousine deployments and major events in/around the Resort.
Manage and carry out operational activities, include attending to guest requests, handling of guest feedback/complaints, compliance with all safety regulations and other related matters.
Liaise and manage vendors on routine, disposal and adhoc limousine/shuttle activation for special events and public holidays.
Develop and maintain effective communications and coordination with internal and external stakeholders.
Drive strategies for utilization of fleets, implement continuous improvements to support productivity and service performance.
Manage in-house and out-source drivers to deliver excellent guest services according to established corporate service standards.
Job Requirements
Degree in Hospitality or Hotel Management with minimum 3 years of relevant experience
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Meticulous and impeccable follow-through on all limousine related matters.
Possess good cross-cultural awareness/sensitivity and strong interpersonal skills to facilitate effective working across diverse cultures.
A team player with strong business acumen, resourceful and adaptable to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Able to perform shift duties and work on weekends/public holidays.

Our wide portfolio of products and solutions is built on 100+ years of destination management experience. Our solutions include series tours, technical visits, educational tours, Japan specialist travel consulting, as well as meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions. Our product portfolio includes MyBus excursions at destinations as well as guaranteed departure tours devised and delivered by our Seat-in-Coach specialists, Europamundo (EMV) and MyBus Landcruise. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description

About Kuoni Tumlare
At Kuoni Tumlare, we deliver truly inspiring and innovative solutions and experiences that create value both for our Partners and Society at large. Our wide portfolio of products and solutions is built on 100+ years of destination management experience.
Our solutions include series tours, technical visits, educational tours, Japanspecialist travel consulting, as well as meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions. Our product portfolio includes MyBus excursions at destinations as well as guaranteed departure tours devised and delivered by our Seat-in-Coach specialists, Europamundo (EMV) and MyBus Landcruise.
We cater to a wide range of customer needs in close collaboration with our trusted suppliers and powered by our team of destinations experts - enabling us to make a real difference to the world.

About the Business
Our Sales Office services take care of all kinds of tour solutions, includes series, mice, event, MyBus excursions,
virtual tour and virtual/hybrid events across our destinations.

About the Role
This role is in charge of making quotations, following up offers, daily operation works and completing assignment and reports to supervisor/operation manager.
Quotations – Work with sales team closely to make sure quotations to be done correctly and properly
Follow-up of offers – Work with sales team closely to get feedback of offers and push for real bookings in return
Daily operation works – Ensure all daily operations to be done properly
Complete assignment and reports to supervisor/operation manager
Job Requirements
Key Responsibilities
Quotations
a. Gather as much group information as possible (including flight details, group purpose and possible competitions)
b. Review itinerary as well as requested services
c. Make proper quotation from system by following all the information and requests.
d. Prepare quote sheets as well as sales sheet
e. Get selling prices from sales team and then send offer letter to agent
Follow up offers with calls
a. Make sure agents get our offers properly
b. Get feedback of offers and pass related information to sales team for further action
Daily operation works
a. New group bookings, including series and ad hoc
b. Push confirmation of services, including hotels and ground services
c. Deadline control
d. Revenue/budget control
e. Regular update of sign up pax
d. Communicate with agents, LPICs and HRD people whenever it needs
f. Cancel groups when required and follow up cancellation fee if any
g. Materialize groups when approved by agents and make sure all services to be confirmed properly by due time
h. Change services and follow up confirmation by due time
i. Finalize groups and send out final document to agents
j. Check BIS reports and create invoices
k. Trouble shooting while groups are in the trip
l. Join weekly operation team meeting for information sharing and case study
Complete assignment and reports to supervisor/operation manager
Internal Communication
a. Clear, open and effective communication with Destination Management Office Operations
b. Collaboration with Sales teams
c. Price and condition negotiations with clients and Destination Management Office
To Succeed in the Role, You Should:
Be a fast learner, self-motivated and passionate about delivering quality customer service to our clients.
Take ownership of own area of responsibility.
Be Highly detail orientated, able to keep deadlines and work under pressure.
Be a Team-player, must have good interpersonal and communication skills.
Be Flexible and Solution driven, adaptable in uncertain conditions.
Be Data-driven.
Be Revenue focused and driven to achieve targets.
We Are Looking for a Person With:
Working Experience
0~1 years working experience, experience of operating group tours for Europe destinations is a plus
Language skills
English: good for both in writing and speaking
Mandarin: good for both in speaking and reading
What We Offer:
Interesting and variable full time office job .
Fun and supportive international team across countries.
Different training and self-development activities.
Career development possibilities.

You thrive in a fast-paced environment and when navigating ambiguity

title: Regional Strategy and Operations Lead - Singapore
company_info: GOOGLE ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PRODUCT AREA
The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.
JOB DESCRIPTION
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
As the Regional Strategy & Operations Lead, you will work to execute a strategy for consistent and meaningful engagement, build cross-functional partnerships across executive teams within Google, and plan strategic engagements between Google leaders and a broad range of external stakeholders. You will support cross-functional teams including Country Sales Leads, regional Government Affairs and Public Policy, Marketing, Legal and Comms leads, as well as other PA leads to drive a holistic engagement strategy, planning, and reporting across the region.

Qualifications
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Coordinate development of annual regional plan. Define strategic priorities or key risks and develop plans against them, ensuring cross-functional alignment to the policy brief objectives
Drive operations for regional priorities (including QBRs, monthly progress updates)
Manage governance and measurement of regional outcomes. Drive coordination and accountability for progress against our plans across the main APAC clusters, as well as regional initiatives
Provide regional coordination to proactively identify operational risks across the region and bring together functional teams to develop risk mitigation plans against them
Support the focus and alignment for Country Operations Managers across markets, and facilitate scaling of insights and learnings
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
7 years of experience in management consulting, corporate strategy, or sales operations involving executive stakeholder management
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in government or public policy
Solid understanding of APAC markets and the technology ecosystem
Ability to build relationships and drive alignment and progress in collaborating with an extensive set of cross-PA and cross-functional stakeholders across the region
Strong program management will be critical along with a get-things-done attitude and ability to navigate ambiguity
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Bar managers keep their bars running smoothly by handling day-to-day operations, managing resources, and employees, and creating a safe, fun environment for staff and patrons.

Decisiveness.

title: Regional Aftersales Assistant Manager / Manager
company_info: MOTOR IMAGE ENTERPRISES PTE LTD Tan Chong International Limited (TCIL) has since its inception in 1957 (more than half a century), grown its assets substantially with solid business footprints in major regions of Asia. TCIL's success hinges on it ability to continuously expand its existing diversified business activities in manufacturing, distribution and retail. Despite our outreach and history, we are comfortable in seeking new opportunities even in unchartered territories.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Regional Aftersales Assistant Manager/ Manager will be responsible for overseeing the aftersales operations. This role involves leading a team of Aftersales Managers from different markets and ensuring the efficient delivery of high-quality service and support to customers. The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience in the automotive field, strong leadership skills, and a proven track record of achieving targets.

Key Responsibilities:
Aftersales Operations Management:
· Oversee the day-to-day operations of the aftersales department to ensure smooth functioning.
· Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify areas for improvement and implement necessary changes.
· Develop and implement strategies to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty.
Budgeting and Financial Management:
· Develop and manage the annual budget for the aftersales department.
· Monitor expenses and ensure cost-effectiveness while maintaining high-quality service standards.
· Analyze financial reports and make recommendations for improving profitability.
· Monitor all markets goodwill cases and consolidate reports for internal stakeholder.
Service Quality Assurance:
· Establish and enforce standard operating procedures (SOPs) to maintain consistent service quality.
· Conduct regular audits and inspections to ensure compliance with company and industry standards.
· Address customer concerns and implement corrective actions as necessary.
Vendor and Supplier Management:
· Identify and evaluate potential vendors and service providers for spare parts and accessories.
· Negotiate contracts, establish partnerships, and monitor performance to ensure timely and cost-effective procurement.
Market Analysis and Strategy Development:
· Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences.
· Develop and execute regional aftersales strategies or warranty programs to capitalize on market opportunities and achieve revenue targets by working closely with Marketing Team, Parts Team as well as vendors.
Regulatory Compliance:
· Ensure compliance with all relevant legal and regulatory requirements pertaining to the aftersales operations.
· Keep abreast of changes in local and regional automotive laws and regulations.

Qualifications:
· Studies in Business Administration, Automotive Engineering, or a related field
· Minimum 5 years of experience in the automotive field, with a minimum of 2 years in a supervisory or managerial role.
· Strong understanding of aftersales processes, customer service, and automotive industry trends.
· Proven track record of achieving targets and driving operational excellence.

title: Library Manager
company_info: HWA CHONG INSTITUTION (HCI) is Singapore’s premier Independent School. Our mission is to nurture leaders for the nation. Underlying the school’s mission is the desire to have all our staff and students pursue their passion, and to dare to innovate, while upholding the values of integrity, empathy and responsibility.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Position Overview:
The Library Manager plays a crucial role in ensuring the effective management and operation of two libraries within the school – one for the secondary school section and another for the junior college section. The Library Manager is responsible for developing, maintaining, and promoting library resources, services, and programs that support the educational and recreational needs of students, teachers, and staff. This role involves both administrative and educational components to foster an environment conducive to learning and research.

Key Responsibilities:
1. Library Operations Management:
● Oversee the day-to-day operations of both the secondary school and junior college libraries.
● Fine-tune and enforce library policies, procedures, and guidelines to ensure consistent and efficient library usage.
● Oversee the main functions of the library – Finance, Acquisition, Cataloguing, Reporting, Weeding and Circulation.
● Manage library staff, including hiring, training, scheduling, performance evaluations and welfare of staff.
● Monitor library budgets, expenditures, and resource allocations.

2. Collection Development:
● Collaborate with teachers, curriculum coordinators, and school administrators to curate library collections that align with the academic needs of both sections.
● Evaluate and select appropriate print and digital resources, including books, journals, databases, and multimedia materials.
● Regularly assess the relevance and currency of the collections and make informed decisions about acquisitions and deselection.

3. User Services:
● Provide exceptional customer service to library users, assisting with research, information retrieval, technical inquiries and book recommendations.
● Foster a welcoming and inclusive environment in the libraries to encourage learning and collaboration.
● Support CCA teacher-in-charge in training and supervising student librarians.

4. Library Technology and Systems:
● Oversee the implementation and maintenance of library management systems, databases, and digital platforms.
● Ensure user-friendly access to electronic resources and digital collections, troubleshoot technical issues, and facilitate training for library patrons.

5. Promotion and Outreach:
● Develop and implement strategies to promote library resources and services to students, teachers, and parents.
● Organize and participate in events, book displays, and reading initiatives to encourage reading culture and engagement within the school community.

6. Collaboration and Partnerships:
● Collaborate with subject teachers and faculty to integrate library resources into the curriculum.
● Support Library Head in all matters pertaining to the library as a resource center.

7. Professional Development:
● Stay updated with current trends and developments in library science and education through continuous learning and participation in relevant workshops, seminars, and conferences.

REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Library and Information Science or related field.
Previous experience in library management, preferably in an educational setting.
Strong organizational, communication, and leadership skills.
Proficiency in library management systems, technology, and digital resources.
Knowledge of educational trends and curriculum needs.
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders.

title: Junior Restaurant Manager

To this day, Da Paolo Group remains a family-run business committed to offering honest Italian food. With over 30 years of experience, Da Paolo Group provides diverse professional solutions from reliable contract manufacturing to customised consultation for the food & beverage industry.

description:

Outline
Work in tandem with Operations Manager and be the link between all departments; Food, Beverage, Guest Relations and Events. Liaising with Managing Director, Senior Managers, Middle Management and Juniors with clear and open communication and set tasks for all staff.

Build and sustain a close relations with all our guests, VIPS and shareholders, understand their needs and preferences to always overdeliver on expectations.

Follow and monitor all ethos and work culture practices as per staff handbook. At all times lead by example and be across all practices in the outlet.

Assist with all administration and operational requirements.

Assist with the development CRM and guest- personalised database

Manage Wastage and Voids tab and personally check that this is accurate and there is no illegal transactions.

Manage the Marketing account and ensure it is being maximised and not abused, monthly tab must be capped at $5000 per month.

Monitor ENT accounts and highlight to Managers and Directors when individual tabs are reaching their monthly limit.

Assist in Kitchen Meetings and update WIP every week, prioritising and following up on all tasks set and the team.

Assist in Ops Meetings and update WIP every week, prioritising and following up on all tasks set by and the team.

Manage guest complaints and attempt in all instances to turn the experience around by engaging in service recovery.

Collate all customer feedback, both positive and negative and achieve 5 x 5 star Google/ Seven Rooms reviews per month personally.

Manage monthly trainings ensuring all Managers are equally contributing to training; there must be a balanced mix of Food, Beverage, SOPs, SOS. Always ensuring the calendar is organised a month in advance.

Understand House Intoxication Policy, enforce it personally and train all staff on best practices.

Assist and Manage all security and actively be monitoring their movement and work performance; in particular observing and enforcing intoxication policy and intermingling.
At all times ensure the safety of our staff and guests.

A complete understanding of all in- house Marketing; Free Flow, The Lawn, Wine To Go, The Bakery, Delivery options etc..

Be across rostering and manage all staffs breaks and keeping middle management hours within 44 hours. Senior Management hours capped at 55 per week and updating all hours according to bookings all week.

Manage all scheduled leave, MC, PH, Days in lieu and assist in monthly payroll.
Operational positioning working in the outlet 55 hours a week. Working in tandem to ensure the smooth running of the entire outlet.

Understand thoroughly all table numbers and sections; Asador, Bar, Golf/ Par, Verandah and The Lawn area.

Drive sales through a thorough understanding of Food and Drinks menu, making sure the venue is always looking immaculate, approachable and surpassing guest’s expectations.
Understand and be across all SOS and SOPS for FOH.

Assist in Recruitment; hiring of all frontline restaurant staff ie. Assistant Managers, Chefs, Supervisors, and Trainees.

Maintain an eye and attention to detail to all operational matters and highlight any issues instantly to colleagues.

Identify and highlight any repairs and maintenance that need to be scheduled through Maintenance Chat. Wherever possible suggest any contractors or vendors that can assist.
Possess a positive and can- do attitude initiating solutions to problems before they arise, at all times be present and approachable to the entire team to manage any issues/ problems.
Motivate our team to be passionate and energetic at all times, foster a fun working environment where all staff are treated equally and are clear of responsibilities and duties.
Understand all cashing up and Daily Nightly Report procedures, carry out whenever necessary.
Lead all reconciliation of monthly Petty Cash for FOH and BOH.

On-boarding; manage and lead in the induction and development of all FOH Staff; orientation, on the job training, career mapping and upholding the team culture .

Meet the following KPI’s- Food COGS; 28%, 1% wastage, wages 32%, Beverage COGS 23%, stocktake variance 1%, wastage 1%.

Initiate internaltraining programs for the outlet and highlight suitable external training courses for all Management and their individual progression.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
General Profile
As a team leader, helps Applied achieve its medium to long-term strategic objectives for enhancing operations performance. Utilizes highly specialized skills in areas of advanced analytics, information systems, operations management, executive-level communication, and cross functional leadership to scale projects in support of Applied’ s business objectives. This role will be focused on bringing together key SMEs across the organizations and lead the team to scope, develop detailed plan, and execute to the “Operations-Leadership Framework” that comes out of the JOLT Organization. The individual will set up an organization, market, train, institutionalize, and track impact to take the “JOLT Objectives” forward in a sustainable manner
Key responsibilities
The candidate will drive Applied’ s strategic initiatives in following areas:
Be core team member of the Smart Initiative team. Define and develop digital platform for internal operations and suppliers. Leverage advanced analytics and Artificial intelligence to enhance WW manufacturing effectiveness.
Predictive Early Warning system
Adaptive iOMS for shortage mitigation
Self-Healing to avoid part failures
Ai Enhanced SPC Chamber Matching
AR/AI QC & Defect Disposition
AI controlled swarmed AMRs in Warehouse
Virtual Manufacturing Assistant and AI based Skill Augmentation to reduce DMRs and NCs
Work with suppliers to strengthen the S&OP process and the process of sharing demand information. Enable Build & Supply Alignment
Develop Enterprise-wide aligned supply planning process
Integrate it with Supply Chain ecosystem (Suppliers, CMs & OSPs)
Strengthen link between Supply Planning & Build Planning
Establish process to align plans with Supply Chain. Align terminology & training. Heat Map Automation
Process Automation: Automate material supply heatmap analysis and constrained parts allocation across BUs
Deploy BIC SP processes, constraint allocation & align with AGS S&OP
Support Operations Capacity planning team
Develop agile capacity planning capability using advanced analytics
Integrate demand forecast with operations capacity planning process
Achieve Factory linearity objective for improved customer trust. Develop strategy and roadmap for changes in factory planning processes and systems to enable a “linear” factory output, while allowing prioritization for critical upside opportunities
Churn Policy Implementation
Slotting Zones: Align zone slotting policy across enterprise
Exception Process: Define approval process for exception activities and align R&R across organizations
Hot Lots and Upsides: Align hot lot and upside definitions
Deploy IT Tools for new milestones & change control
Operational efficiency – Develop improvement roadmap for key business processes to cost-effectively scale to production targets of up to year 2028
Improve productivity of resources and continuously deliver sustainable reduction in Cost Per Tool (CPT)
Efficiency improvement for direct labor, indirect, WH labor, freight
Process efficiency improvement through SmartFactory / SmartOperations
Redesign build process steps (Virtual Build/Feeder Modules/Kaizen), WH storage densification; WH Process Automation using robotics
Lead demand forecasting and planning for SPG
Support senior executives in managing product demand planning objectives by developing demand forecasting models, data analytics infrastructure and executive reports across all business units
Work cross-functionally, gather and analyze industry trends data, historic sales data, and key market share metrics
Integrate industry benchmarks, customer-technology roadmaps, and develop demand plans. Analyze potential bottlenecks and recommend mitigation strategies based on data analysis and insights
Build strong cross-functional engagements across multiple business units with Chief Operating Officers, Field Group, Manufacturing, and Supply Chain Organizations
Analyze data, build demand forecasting models, build analytical frameworks, evaluate trends, and compare with industry benchmarks
Identify and integrate software toolsets for automation, standardization of data collection and analytics, data security, etc. partnering with IT team
Build dashboards for effective executive-level communication across businesses and functions
Core team member for developing Scenario management capability
Collaborate with Operations leadership Team for developing scenario-based decision making for S&OP trade-off. Deploy advanced analytics to scale company’s existing demand forecasting capabilities to incorporate macroeconomic, technology, and customer scenarios
Cyclicality playbook – Manage downturn / upturn
Functional Knowledge
Demonstrates a broad and comprehensive understanding of enterprise information systems, e.g., SAP, Salesforce, Hadoop, etc.
Possesses hands-on expertise of big-data management using advanced analytics tools, e.g., Alteryx, Python, Tableau, and MS Excel.
Is adept with advanced decision and data science techniques of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Possesses cross-functional expertise in strategy, marketing, manufacturing, logistics functions
Business Expertise
Has knowledge of Applied’ s technology footprint, vast product portfolio, and customer base that will enable in developing roadmaps to scale strategic initiatives across the enterprise
Demonstrates a comprehensive knowledge of the Wafer Fab Equipment industry and Applied’ s organization structure in order to contribute to the commercial objectives of the business. This includes enabling the business unit to differentiate itself from the competition
Leadership
Leads key cross-functional project teams and initiatives
Acts as a mentor and role model to others within the organization
Has experience with coaching and mentoring direct reports. Should have created training and development roadmaps for direct reports, carried out periodic performance appraisals, and provided developmental feedback
Interpersonal Skills
Demonstrates sound communication skills to be able to modify the beliefs and opinions of other peers in the business unit.
Creates strong business relationships with key stakeholders to enlist their active support
Education
Bachelor's Degree in mechanical or production engineering. Master’s degree in Business Administration preferred
Experience
15+ Years of multi-national experience with track record of growth and high business impact
Cross-functional experience in management consulting, operations strategy and management, strategic marketing preferred

title: Restaurant General Manager - Japanese Fine Dining
company_info: FK Dunamis Group Pte Ltd and its subsidiaries manage the Hachi Group of restaurants in Singapore comprising of Hachi Restaurant at the iconic National Gallary Singapore, The Public Izakaya at 100AM Shopping Mall, The Public Izakaya 2 at Altez and Hoppy Bar @ Altez. Our restaurants, which are all located in the CBD area, deliver a range of Japanese cuisines from omakase fine dining to casual izakaya operations in the most authentic and true to concept Japanese approach. We are progressive employers, channeling much resources back to the business and our employees. Many of our employees have travelled to japan and other overseas destinations for study, research, training & recreational trips. Some of our employees are granted subsidies in holiday travels, and upgrading courses. We believe that the success of our organization can only come from our people and we promote the belief that company success translates to individual success. In addition to the operating restaurant business, the Group has diversified interests in developments in Japan and Indonesia.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
SUMMARY
Reporting to the Managing Director, the Restaurant General Manager is responsible for managing the daily operations of the operating restaurant units assigned. Being the head of a dining establishment/s, you will provide inspiring leadership to a team of employees that can motivate them to work harder and more effectively. The RGM will work with your team to develop strategies that reduce costs and increase sales within the company. The RGM will ensure that customers have a positive experience when dining in the restaurant, and the provision of quality service and food to our customers as directed by Management. Being a people-driven organization, this includes the deployment, development and performance management of employees.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Primary responsibilities include:
General
Oversee and manage all areas of the restaurant/ outlet and make final decisions on matters of importance.
Financial
Adhere to Management directives to achieve sales targets and costs limits, including COGS & all operating expenses. Involves the perpetual monitoring of key financials and revenue figures.
Analyze the restaurant budget to find and price inventory, reduce expenses, review current pricing and adjust purchasing strategies if needed.
Control operations by developing effective policies, creating high standards and working to make adjustments when appropriate.
Responsible for ensuring that all financials/ reports/ invoices/ receipts etc and personnel/ payroll related administrative duties are completed and if required, forwarded to the supporting departments of Accounts/ HR etc accurately, on time and in accordance with company policies and procedures.
On-Premise & Inventory
Enforce sanitary practices for food handling, general cleanliness, and maintenance of kitchen, bar and dining areas. Ensure compliance with operational standards, Management directives, local laws and ordinances.
Ensure an outstanding dining experience by regulating presentation, taste, service and atmosphere for all guests in accordance with Management directive; develop ways to cultivate a regular customer pool.
Collaborates with the kitchen/ culinary team to ensure consistent high quality of food preparation and service.
Maintain professional restaurant image, including restaurant cleanliness, proper uniforms, and appearance standards.
Estimate and track COGS, anticipates restaurant stock requirements and ensure optimal stockholding and the unlikely event of stock unavailable.
Guest service
Ensure positive guest service in all areas. Respond to complaints, taking any and all appropriate actions to turn dissatisfied guests into return guests.
Manages and ensures reservations and enquiries are promptly responded to, with minimal or no loss of business due to inappropriate, inadequate or late actions from the restaurant.
Operational responsibilities
Ensure that proper security procedures are in place to protect employees, guests and company assets/ inventory.
Manage and achieve efficient and effective shifts by personally leading the team during lunch/ dinner operations.
Manage daily shifts which include: daily decision making, scheduling, deployment, planning while upholding standards & product quality.
Ensures the facility both front end, backend, stores, offices are kept tidy and neat at all times.
Investigate and resolve feedback or complaints concerning food quality and service.
Personnel
Provide direction to employees regarding operational and procedural issues in accordance with Management directive.
Supervise a team of employees; work to create a cohesive unit of people who effectively communicate; work with HR to create a hiring process for employees that ensures qualified people are selected, trained and retained through top recruiting practices.
Ensure orientation of new employees, on-going staff appraisals and on-job-training are conducted and managed.
Ensure punctuality and attendance of all employees in the restaurant, planning for peak periods and lull periods, including recommending periodic closures for rest/ re-organization.
Develop employees by providing 1 on 1 feedback, establishing performance expectations and by conducting performance reviews, including the recommendation of rewards & increments to Management as and when necessary.
Maintain & foster a peaceful, harmonious & professional work environment in the restaurant where all staff are respected and treated as professionals. Ensuring that senior employees and ownself set the standards and example for a professional team. To lead by example and to ensure ownself demonstrates the same standards Management expects and directs.
QUALIFICATIONS

Intermediate to advance knowledge of Japanese cuisine, ingredients and preparation techniques.
Intermediate knowledge of beverages including but not limited to, sake, whisky, wines, cocktails.
Relevant Diploma or Degree in Business Management/ Hospitality/ Tourism/ Culinary Arts is preferred. A combination of practical experience and education will be considered as an alternative.
Knowledge of computers (MS Word, Excel).
Proficient in the full spectrum of restaurant management functions: food planning and preparation, procurement, sanitation, security, accounting policies and procedures, personnel management, recordkeeping, and preparation of reports.
Able to understand and present basic P&L/ Balance Sheet figures, with basic knowledge of Principles of Accounting.
PERSONAL REQUIREMENTS
Able and willing to work long hours as and when necessary, and to substantially perform longer work hours than subordinates/ junior staff, on or off-work premises.
Disciplined, driven, adaptable, pre-emptive, motivated, with key leadership traits.
Pleasant, polite & respectful with great interpersonal skills.
Ability to motivate employees to work as a team.
Must be able to handle the pressures of simultaneously coordinating a wide range of activities and recommend appropriate solutions to restaurant problems.
Must possess good communication skills for dealing with diverse staff.
Able to multi-task with high threshold for new tasks and responsibilities.
Able to meet timelines and datelines.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Keeps Managing Director promptly and fully informed of all issues (i.e. problems, unusual matters of significance and positive events) and takes prompt corrective action where necessary or suggests alternative courses of action.
Completes job responsibilities and performance objectives in a timely and effective manner and in accordance with Management directive.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as required or requested.
SUPERVISION SCOPE
12 to 14+ employees per shift
WORKING CONDITIONS
Hours will closely mirror operational hours and the Restaurant General Manager is expected to lead in person, restaurant shifts whenever possible.
Ability to perform all functions at the restaurant level.
Position requires prolonged standing, bending, stooping, twisting, lifting products and supplies weighing 45 pounds, and repetitive hand and wrist motion.
Work with hot, cold, and hazardous equipment as well as operates phones, computers, fax machines, copiers, and other office equipment.
Thank you for your interest in our company, please email your resume to fabian@fkdunamis.com, and we will reach out to you if your application is found suitable.

title: Clinical Operations Manager
company_info: Natural Healings is an Integrated Pain Management and Preventive Care Specialist Group providing Chiropractic, Physiotherapy and Clinical Sports Massage Mission To provide trusted, high-quality and consistent clinical pain management care to our patients, empowering them to lead an active, mobile and pain-free life. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking an experienced Clinical Operations Manager to join our team in a high-volume retail clinic setting. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional care to our patients, while managing clinic operations each day.

Provide professional consultation, analysis and explanation to patients by reviewing their health and medical histories including information on previous injuries, surgeries, general health and lifestyle
Conduct physical examinations, focusing on spine and posture and noting on the range of movement

Recommend treatment methods and/or management plans based on diagnosis
