Liaise with other healthcare practitioners and refer patients who require other medical attention
Manage day-in and day-out clinic operations
Maintain accurate and timely patient records, including progress notes and treatment plans.
Manage a high volume of appointments each day while maintaining exceptional patient care and satisfaction.
Co-operate and communicate with colleagues to ensure smooth clinic operations and retain patients' patronage
Work retail hours
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree / Master of Chiropractic, Physiotherapy or body anatomy related studies from an accredited chiropractic college
Minimum 5-10 years experience working in a high volume clinical set-up that specializes in chiropractic and pain management
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Self-motivated, positive attitude and strong integrity
Professional interpretation of x-ray report

Supporting the Leasing Department and the marketing communications team will be part of your role, involving event management and tenant coordination to enhance tenant satisfaction and property utilization.
As part of your broader responsibilities, you will actively manage energy consumption and propose initiatives to promote energy efficiency and sustainability within the property.
Collaborate with various stakeholders to optimize facility operations, including coordination with tenants and internal departments.

Experience with Commercial & Retail properties

Manage CAPEX , A&A including budgeting, procurement, execution and quality of work

Roles & Responsibilities
Your new company

My client is a renowned leader in the wine industry and is seeking a highly skilled APAC Operations Manager to join the supply chain team. They are commitment to excellence, innovation, and delivering the finest products to their customers which makes this an exciting opportunity.

Your new role
As a APAC Operations Manager, you will be instrumental in overseeing and optimizing the supply chain & logistics operations for the APAC markets. Your role will involve leading a team of professionals, managing day-to-day operations, and coordinating orders efficiently from the internal system.

- Coordinate orders seamlessly from the internal system, guaranteeing on-time fulfillment and delivery.
- Develop and implement strategic plans to optimize supply chain operations and meet company goals.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve processes, reduce inefficiencies, and enhance customer satisfaction.
- Foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the regional team.

What you'll need to succeed
- Diploma or Bachelor's degree in logistics, supply chain management, or a related field
- 6 to 7 years of proven experience in logistics operations management, with a focus on 3PL operations, overseeing freight management, and coordinating orders

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Ability to make quick decisions in a fast-paced environment.
- Knowledge of SAP system
- Demonstrated ability to lead and develop high-performing teams

title: Operation Manager (Sushi Production / Outlet)
company_info: JSTT SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us:
We are a leading sushi manufacturer and distributor with a strong presence in supermarkets in Singapore. We are committed to delivering high-quality sushi products to our customers while providing an exceptional dining experience at our sushi counters. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a dedicated and experienced Operation Manager to oversee both our production facility and outlet operations.

Job Description:
We are seeking an Operation Manager to join our team and take charge of our sushi production facility and outlet operations. The ideal candidate will be a skilled leader with a passion for food production and customer service. If you are a results-oriented individual with a deep understanding of sushi production, supply chain management, and outlet management, we want to hear from you.

Responsibilities:

Production Facility Management:
Oversee all aspects of sushi production, ensuring quality, safety, and efficiency.
Manage a team of sushi chefs, kitchen staff, and production workers.
Develop and maintain production schedules to meet customer demand.
Monitor inventory levels and procurement of raw materials.
Implement and enforce food safety and sanitation standards.
Continuously optimize production processes for cost-effectiveness.

Outlet Management:
Supervise the daily operations of our sushi counters in supermarkets.
Train and motivate staff to deliver exceptional customer service.
Monitor sales performance and implement strategies to increase revenue.
Maintain inventory levels, including fresh ingredients and sushi products.
Ensure compliance with food safety regulations and health standards.
Handle customer feedback and resolve any issues promptly.
Budget and Cost Management:
Develop and manage budgets for both the production facility and outlets.
Monitor expenses and identify cost-saving opportunities.
Analyze financial reports to make data-driven decisions.
Quality Control:
Maintain high-quality standards for sushi products.
Conduct regular quality checks and implement improvements.
Ensure consistency in taste, presentation, and portion control.
Qualifications:
Proven experience in sushi production and outlet management, preferably in a similar role.
Strong leadership and team management skills.
Knowledge of sushi preparation techniques and food safety standards.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle pressure.

If you are a dynamic and driven individual who is passionate about sushi production and providing outstanding customer experiences, we invite you to apply for the Operation Manager position. Join our team and be a part of our journey to deliver the best sushi products to our valued customers.

Ensure compliance with all regulatory and legal requirements
Ensure compliance and performance of all Company initiatives, directives and instructions within stipulated timeline and ensure alignment to overall business strategies

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Adaptable
Negotiation and Conflict management

title: Vice President, Digital Business Services COO Office Operational Management
company: THE HONGKONG AND SHANGHAI BANKING CORPORATION LIMITED
company_info: HSBC in Singapore offers a comprehensive range of banking and financial services including retail banking and wealth management; commercial, investment and private banking; insurance; forfaiting and trustee services; securities and capital markets services. One of the earliest banks to establish in Singapore, HSBC today is a prominent player in Singapore’s financial services sector serving the international banking needs of multinational corporations, home-grown businesses, private banking clients, institutional and retail customers. HSBC Singapore serves as the leading international bank for ASEAN, an international wealth and regional wholesale hub, regional centre of excellence for sustainability, while being a sandbox for digital innovation experiments for the Group. If you are looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover an international banking career. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment.
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 10 MARINA BOULEVARD 018983
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role:
The Operational Management function provides support to Regional,Country COO and/or CAO on an ad-hoc basis across all of their areas of responsibility, covering the DBS COO Office, as directed.
The Operational Management (OM) Team will deliver and contribute to the definition of necessary policies, processes, procedures, and tools for their implementation and management in DBS COO Office, working with Global Functions such as Communications, Finance, HR or Strategy & Planning where required. The OM Team will drive continuous improvement across the Group/Region/Country COO structure in areas such as Change Execution, Financial Management and People.

A Manager within the OM Team is jointly accountable to DBS CAO. This is a key role within in the Management layer within Region/Country COO Office.

This role has responsibility for contributing to:
Change Execution – managing change, either internally or externally driven, on a continuous improvement basis.
Communication – support line manager in developing and executing communication plans, with Region/Country Communications.
Service Performance Management – support line manager in managing any “services” delivered to the business, with appropriate benchmarks, metrics and reporting on efficiency, effectiveness and success of those “services”.
Governance & Documentation – support line manager in ensuring appropriate and consistent governance is developed and implemented with robust documentation and supporting management.
People – support line manager with implementing people strategies with Global/Region/Country HR.
Project execution – support line manager with region/country specific programmes supporting Group/Region/Country COO strategic actions’ execution or provide governance oversight on cross-line of Global Business / Global Functions.

Principal Accountabilities: Key activities and decision making areas

Impact on the Business - COO’s/ CAO
Provide management and administrative support to the Region/Country CAO/Senior Manager OM.
Supports the delivery of Change Execution – manage change, either internally or externally driven, effectively and efficiently, with appropriate stakeholder communication, to ensure the Group/Region/Country COO and CAO delivers its required services
Management Information - Produce accurate and timely management information including regular and on demand key performance indicator / management information reporting
Communication – develop and manage communication plans both within and outside of the Function to ensure internal and external teams have a strong understanding of the Function’s purpose, strategy, deliverables and value
Governance & Documentation – support line manager to ensure appropriate governance managed along with robust documentation and supporting management controls.
People – support line manager and execution of policy and process, in line with Global/Region/Country HR, ensuring our people are engaged, well managed and supported.
Strategy Execution –support line manager to develop and implement approaches for Region/Country CAO/ Head of OM and or Senior Manager (s) ensuring strong stakeholder understanding of the purpose and value of the HSBC strategy.

Customers / Stakeholders
The role operates across all levels of management and drives implementation and execution of the Operational Management framework across geographical area. Stakeholder management is therefore multi-faceted across geographies, Businesses and Functions.

Leadership & Teamwork
Leads by example, demonstrating core behaviours and values including teamwork, focus, drive and determination.
Acts in a manner that transparently promotes the organizations values and delivers in an aligned manner.
Cultivates an environment that supports diversity and reflects the HSBC brand.
Leading by example, ensures effective and open communication across the Operational Management Community.
Contributes to the implementation of the Group COO people strategy
Provide a professional representation of DBS COO Office across the Region/Country.
Influences greater team communication and collaboration

Operational Effectiveness & Control
Support the governance process and ensure robust documentation and supporting management controls are implemented
Provide documentation support for the governance meetings chaired by the Region/Country CAO / Senior Manager OM.

Knowledge & Experience / Qualifications

The role holder will have knowledge, skills and experience in the following areas:
Financial analytical background and proven ability in financial/analytical reasoning, including being able to contextualise financial data into business activities and conclusions
Demonstrated business knowledge, experience of working in a global P&L unit is preferred.
Excellent interpersonal skills, coupled with the ability to work within a matrix management structure and build and maintain regional team relationships;
Ability to authentically engage with team, colleagues and business partners to deliver at pace.
Working knowledge of the external environment – regulatory, political, competitors etc.
High level of personal drive and motivation to ensure delivery of a broad range of outputs simultaneously across HSBC
Ability to articulate issues concisely and in simple language to support problem analysis
Excellent relationship management, collaboration and influencing skills
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills with a proven ability to communicate effectively and confidently at all levels across the Group
Ability and comfort to work across cultures
Practical experience of business transformation activities is preferred but not essential
Understanding of HSBC structures, processes and objectives across the Group (if recruiting internally)
Understanding of DBS or similar functions – functionally, operationally and financially

Qualifications / Experience
Educated to graduate degree level in business management related field or associated relevant business experience
Prior experience in banking/ financial services, ideally within a global organization.
Proven experience in financial budgeting, project implementation, communication and people management processes
Proven project management experience with an ability to influence at different levels
Previous background of working in a matrix organization structure; ability to persuade individuals at different levels
Excellent verbal and written communications skills required in English; other language abilities are advantageous

title: HR Operation Manager #(West) / HR Infrastructure / Manufacturing Industry / (Payroll / Operation / Recruitment)
company_info: RecruitPedia is an innovative, efficacious recruitment solution provider headquartered in Singapore. We are constantly expanding and our trained headhunting consultants are distinguished by their extensive international industry knowledge and experience. It will be our greatest honour to be able to guide you along the ever-changing job market and assist you step-by-step with any challenges you face along the way. RecruitPedia believes that all our clients and candidates deserve excellent service and strives to be the best and trusted service provider.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a Manufacturing Industry. They are looking for a HR Operation Manager to assist their team for the next phase of their business. They are located in They are located at West– easily accessible.

Responsibility:
Handle full spectrum of the HR duties which include payroll, recruitment and HR operation.
Develop and implement HR infrastructure, processes, and systems across multiple regions, ensuring alignment with business objectives and local regulations.
Establish standardized HR policies, procedures, and practices to promote consistency and efficiency.
Drive initiatives to enhance employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention.
Develop and implement performance management processes, including goal-setting, performance evaluations, and career development plans.
Ensure compliance with local employment laws and regulations across the regions of operation.
Analyze HR metrics and trends to identify areas for improvement and implement HR programs and initiatives to drive operational excellence.
Requirements:
Min Degree in HR or any related field
Minimum 5 years experience
Regional experience in people operation is a bonus
Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please click APPLY NOW or email an updated copy of your resume/cv.
We regret that only shortlisted candidate will be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
1-1. Overall Operations Supervision
- Supervise overall warehouse operations including SG local transportation from/to company’s warehouse(s)
- Establish and monitor the basic practice and implementation such as MHE pre-inspection, daily-walk-about in the respective work environment with the support from section leads below SLM
- Supervise and monitor WSH monthly reports and take a lead to close any negative findings.
- Receive an external or/and internal escalation upon any deviation or potential risk of deviation from the set KPIs.
- Provide the respective section leads with the relevant guidance and direction whereby how to adjust, correct, or upgrade daily operations.

1-2. Overall Operations Projects Supervision
- Delegate the respective tasks to the respective section leads by determining a schedule.
- Monitor the completion of respective project tasks.
- Receive any escalation from the section leads upon any potential delay or obstacles.
- Provide the respective section leads with the relevant advice and guidance for their clear understanding. - Schedule and arrange any internal session for internal alignments in case of any potential issues, especially the severe ones.
- Properly and timely escalate the potential risks to the direct superior.

1-3. Operations Resource Planning
- Come up with operations manpower resource planning.
- Conduct recruitment interviews in case of additional manpower resources to bring into the operations team.
- Exercise any warning session(s) or termination session(s) related to the respective section leads

1-4. Warehouse P/L Control
- Analyse monthly department P/L starting from sales revenue, direct cost, indirect cost up to gross profit with the direct superior.
- Come up with some proposals to improve our sales or/and cost for further discussion and finalisation with the direct superior.

3. Mandatory Requirements
- Minimum 3 to 5 years’ experience in a managerial position in 3PLWarehouse operations.
- Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environments
- Mature, self-motivated, and able to work independently.
- Ability to motivate & manage a dynamic service-oriented organization.
- Ability to support change in a fast-moving environments & coach organization
- Ability to use the technical skill, process discipline to build & develop service deliverables & capabilities.
- Able to speak, read and write English upon directly communicating with customers or / and appointed vendors

title: Operations Manager (Cleaning)
company_info: BNL is a leading provider of integrated environmental solutions, covering a range of landscaping, cleaning and waste management services. Having provided comprehensive solutions to the our national parks, commercial buildings, hotels and public projects for the last 50 years. We put our clients first and take immense pride in their success. We are committed to provide unparalleled service that exceeds our partners'​ expectations and results that help them succeed.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Developing, executing and ensuring company SOP's are followed throughout assigned sites
Buiding open and trusting relationship with clients to achieve long term partnership and contractual renewal
Monitoring and upholding the cleaning and maintenance quality standards and operating procedures for all job-sites and surpass the client's expectations
Oversee effective OJT training on equipment and skills surrounding latest implementations (robotics and health policies) to maintain high standards of works
Managing overall staff motivation, discipline, development and performance according to the organizational, human resource and government manpower policies
Overseeing the assigned job sites according to manpower and site requirements to achieve profitability and cost-effectiveness
Planning of manpower deployment at various sites to meet the contractual requirement of clients
Resolving of feedback or complaints from clients and taking immediate preventive measures to ensure that similar problem does not resurface
Recruiting and interviewing applicants and conducting effective 2-way dialogue performance review
Ensuring that all related Workplace Safety & Health requirements are met and that monthly updates on Toolbox Meeting Records, Staff Induction Records and any other requirements as stipulated by the Safety Compliance Committee are submitted accordingly.
Handle the budgeting of sites assigned and ensuring that it is kept within
Job Requirements:
Management Skills, Planning, compliance, organizational, analytical and decision-making skills
Oral and written communication skills
Tactful and discrete when dealing with people and confidential information
Leadership and motivational skills to rally people towards goals achievement
Able to work well with the organisation and able to interact with all levels

Company Overview
Listed as one of NParks Registered Landscape Companies, we handle both residential and commercial corporate properties. Besides regular landscaping and garden maintenance, consult us for customised solutions on your properties.
We know what it takes to provide a thorough and efficient cleaning job. Supported with a huge cleaning fleet and equipment and well-trained staff, we pride ourselves on quality, offering a range of different services that are sure to meet your expectations.
Disposing of waste in an environmentally-friendly manner is essential to your business. We can help. Our experts will assess your waste streams and develop the right recycling and disposal solution for you.

title: Senior Operation Manager

We serve a fine selection of Japanese and Australian wagyu, and our pride is the highly acclaimed A4/A5 Miyazaki wagyu which has won Japan's "National Wagyu Award" three consecutive times.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Responsibilities
Managing the regional operation with the direction of the Directors on day to day business of the outlets and regional profit and loss performance.
Provide inspired leadership for the organization.
Make important policy, planning and strategy decisions.
Develop, implement and review operational policies and procedures.
Assist HR with recruiting when necessary.
Help promote a company culture that encourages top performance and high morale.
Oversee budgeting, reporting, planning and auditing.
Work with senior stakeholders.
Ensure all legal and regulatory documents are filed and monitor compliance with laws and regulations.
Work with the board of directors to determine values and mission, and plan for short and long-term goals.
Identify and address problems and opportunities for the company.
Support worker communication with the management team.
Outlets Management
Outlet sales budget (or target) management; and management of KPIs.
Outlet cost control: Labour cost, food cost, operating cost; e.g. utilities, disposable products and others.
Improving on outlet operation flow and SOP manual.
Improving on outlet promotion and marketing activities.
Well versed in menu and operations, train and lead the team to achieve higher performance.
Handling or dealing with customer feedback, complaint and comment in a professional way.
People Management
Involving team members recruitment and hiring.
Conduct and review training such as orientation, on the job training (OJT) and others.
Monitor team members’ training progress and performance evaluation.
Other
Plan and conduct monthly outlet meeting with target and action plan.
Monthly outlet performance analysis and audit, analysis and action plan.
Ensure outlets compliance with all relevant regulation and legislation, e.g. labour laws, hygiene standards, licenses for business, liquor and others.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Overall Job Objectives
This role is to support global business processes across sales, factories and business unit organizations.
We are looking for a resourceful candidate with a strong analytical capability, and able to utilize various systems for data evaluation. This position is based at our Regional Singapore office.


Core Responsibilities
Build up cost models to provide package cost estimates and manufacturing readiness inputs to business unit, engineering and factory
Support critical meetings with internal cross functional teams on product / package costing
Develop relationships with factory, sales and business units to ensure alignment with industry and customer trends
Responsible for production pricing maintenance duties, including approving pricing issues in SAP
Assist global sales take-or-pay coordination and reconciliation
Adhoc analysis of various revenue related items

Job Specifications
BS degree in Engineering.
Minimum 6years of relevant experience in semiconductor industry.
Direct experience and/or strong familiarity with semiconductor test opportunities is a plus.
Demonstrated understanding of manufacturing processes and raw materials.
Advanced Excel usage and large data set manipulations.
Strategic thinker with a proven ability to translate technical requirements/issues into the business context or vice versa.
Able to work independently and to multi-task, excellent communication and presentation skills and working across functional groups as well as cross-culturally.


Interested applicants, please kindly email your update resume to marketing@aristos-search.com. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Airfreight Operations Manager
company_info: Ferrari Logistics Singapore Pte. Ltd., a fully owned branch of Ferrari Group Headquartered in London, provides logistic solutions and supply chain management for major brands globally. Due to expansion plans, we are looking for suitable candidates to embrace the growth and be part of its family in Singapore.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Ferrari Group

As a one-stop service provider specializing in shipping, integrated logistics and high value-added services for precious goods worldwide, Ferrari Group is a leading corporation in the freight forwarding business for luxury clients.
Founded in Italy, now headquartered in London, UK, Ferrari group has a network of offices and agents in over 80 cities.
The Singapore office, with 3 offices across the city, is seeking talents to join our young and vibrant team in our expansion project.

Responsibilities:

· Manage day to day Import or Export (scheduled rotation) operations
· Planning and liaising with other departments for smooth operations
· Drive continuous improvement of our operations in line with internal protocols
· Ensure full compliance with customs and airport regulations
· Monitor and supervise team of executives
· Hands-on in full scope of airfreight operations
· Accomplish ad-hoc tasks
· Providing excellent pre- and post-customer service
· Display high level of professionalism and work ethics

Requirements:

· Knowledge in CCN/ Customs Regulations will be added advantage
· Knowledge in Valuable Cargo will be added advantage
· Experience in international movements of cargo, freight forwarding or logistics industry will be added advantage
· At least 5 year’s relevant experience
· Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications
· Good command of written and spoken English
· Strong interpersonal skills

title: Cleaning Operations Manager

description:

Cover staff duty when required (Need hands on) / Physically fit to carry out cleaning duties such as dusting, wiping, sweeping, mopping, handling and disposing waste and include basic gardening and grass cutting.
Must be able to handle and use cleaning equipment / Must be familiar with scrubbing and high jet washing and operating Battery Operated cart to collect rubbish.
Plan, manage and supervise a team of cleaners to carry out their work in accordance with company procedures and practices.
Support the Operations and other cleaning supervisors in all duties of the cleaning operation, coordinate, scheduling, and supervise cleaning site staff.
Responsible to inspect job sites for proper cleaning and inventory cleaning supplies.
To attend to clients’ complaints promptly.
To resolve problems efficiently without unnecessary delay.
Ensure all works carried out by Supervisor and Cleaners as set out in their Job Descriptions are completed with due observation to appropriate Health & Safety requirements.
Able to be hands-on when the situation requires and any other responsibility as assigned by superiors.

Job Requirement
Initiative and keenness to learn.
Willing to work night shift/ rotating shift / weekend.
Willing to work outdoor (some projects might include outdoor environment)
Able to work under pressure
6 days’ work week

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

• Ensure enhancement of Cyber Security Operations for cyber threats monitoring, detection, analysis and response through the use of threat intelligent and automation
• Project management and Vendors Management
• Drive continuous improvement of Incident Response Framework, Incident Response Plan, Event Management, Standard Operation Procedure, Playbook and etc. for cybersecurity operations and incident response
• Perform advanced trend, pattern and statistical analysis to project future technical cyber threat scenarios
• Synthesize multiple information sources and analysis reports into a holistic view of potential threats
• Conduct in-depth research into cyber security issues of industry- or nation-wide significance
• Produce findings to help initialize or support law enforcement and counterintelligence investigations or activities
• Establish incident management procedures for the detection, reporting and handling of incidents
• Develop a playbook for cyber incident management
• Perform the remediation and resolution of cyber incidents at the organizational level
• Direct post-mortem activities following critical incidents
• Work closely with internal and external parties to manage the operation of SOC
• Manage security operation to ensure implemented security technologies and controls are effective and adequate to protect our infrastructure/business
• Track and analyse cybersecurity metrics for effectiveness, benchmarking and management reporting.


QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

• 6-8 or more years of experience in running security operations including project management and implementation skill set.
• Technical know-how and experience in IT security solutions such as (but not limited to) and at least operated in more than one of the followings:-
• Network Security : F/W, IPS, VPN, UTM, NAC
• Knowledge in Checkpoint, Juniper, Cisco, Aruba and Fortigate, CyberArk, Tripwire, will be an added advantage
• Content Security : WEB Security, Anti-Spam/Anti-Virus
• End point Security : Anti-Virus/Malware, Host base IPS, DLP, BitLocker
• Security Information Management: SIEM, Security management, Forensics
• Advance Persistence Threat Solution
• Experience in conducting detailed cyber security events investigation and analysis including leading and responding to cyber security incidents
• Familiar with Kill Chain methodology, MITRE Att&ck, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001, 27002 and etc.
• Relevant Cybersecurity Certifications such as CISM, CISSP, GCIH, GNFA, CCSK, CRIST will be an added advantage

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Provides proactive supervision and direction at all times to ensure the chemical plant is operating as to maintain safety, environmental, and operational priorities at the optimum production level
To ensure criticalplant parameters are within the target and provide guidance and advice for corrective action in the event of any plant upsets or hiccups which include conducting investigation/troubleshooting
Be knowledgeable on how to achieve operating targets and strategies (KPI), and lead the operating team to achieve those results
To prepare and forecast plant production planning and communicate effectively with shift team leader to ensure the target is achieved
Take measures to keep sufficient levels of reagents and consumables for daily plant operations
To properly plan foequipment handover to maintenance in order to achieve minimum equipment downtime. This includes equipment handover planning for shutdown and turnaround
To review and update operational work process update and review i.e risk assessment (RA), standard operating procedure (SOP)
Assist in preparation and monitor monthly budgets for reagents, consumables and all other controllable operating expenses.
To support report writing/dashboard development to management on plant performance and compliance
To provide support to technical compliance, QHES and HR team related with operational training development and tracking within operation team
Support the engineering department on plant improvement initiatives and capital project base
Take the lead in operational improvement/modification initiatives. This includes managemenof change (MOC) implementation, design review, commissioning new facilities and lead Pre-Start Up Safety Review (PSSR)
To support any other activities and initiatives as delegated by Operation Manager
In the absence of the Operations Manager, the incumbent shall act as the Deputy Operations Manager
Ethics and compliance are two areas where our rules and our standards are strictly non-negotiable. You are expected to stick to ethics and compliance rules and standards which ultimately mean doing your job properly and conducting our business like true professionals, whatever our missions and our place in the Group.
Job Requirements:
Degree in Chemical / Process Control / Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
Minimum 5 years of experience in chemical, refinery, power plant, waste to energy, or environmental process operations.
Incumbents with 2nd grade Steam Boiler Engineer Certification has an added advantage
Possess a good working knowledge of the chemical and thermal process units and an understanding of combustion systems / furnaces / COGEN, evaporation, distillation, instrumentation, process control, air pollution control systems, safety systems, pumps, screw compressors, exchangers, and more.
Results oriented individual with robust technical abilities and problem solving skills.
Able to work independently and in a team to achieve departmental goal of lean production.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for someone who is a dynamic and go-getter individual, to manage the Delivery Operations.
To be successful in this role, you should have experience in managing various aspects of delivery operations including financial management, optimizing and simplifying the delivery, resource management as well as managing various internal and external stakeholders. In addition, you would need to work independently with various teams towards accomplishing the tasks at hand.
Ultimately, you will ensure delivery teams are able to focus on the delivery to the strategic client and all ‘operational’ matters are handled effectively by reducing burden on the delivery teams.
Responsibilities
· Establish the framework and SOPs for Delivery Operations.
· Work closely with Head of Delivery and Service Line Heads responsible for delivery to the strategic client on various day to day operational matters including tracking of financials, resources allocation and deallocation, contracts review and approvals, hiring based on client needs etc.
· Program manage various optimization and simplification initiatives and ensure stated outcomes are achieved within agreed timelines.
· Program manage various automation initiatives working closely with Quality team and delivery teams – ensure client buy-in and agreement for automation to ensure overall success.
· Coordinate with Quality team regarding various quality initiatives rollout including ISO certifications.
· Work closely with other tech team to ensure all training and certification programs are delivered and resources are certified/licensed to operate in client environment.
· Work closely with the Chief Delivery Officer and other client account delivery teams and ensure items requiring cross-delivery teams’ attention are dealt with on a timely basis.

Requirements and Skills
· Minimum of 12+ years of experience working in an IT Services organization with at least 3+ years of working in a Delivery Operations role
· Ability to work independently and able to navigate through organizational hierarchies and teams
· Has a good understanding of financial reporting, resources management including managing resources on the bench
· Has experience in managing initiatives and programs and able to successfully execute them to closure
· Has sound knowledge on various Quality frameworks and methodologies and able to apply the same working in conjunction with Quality team in driving various quality programs
· Good networking skills and boundary spanner
· Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or Science is needed


Interested applicants please send your resume to janeng@recruitexpress.com.sg

Jane Ng Wei Ling

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Title: Operations Executive (E-commerce Healthy Brand)

Job Description: We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Operations Executive to join our dynamic team at an e-commerce healthy brand, AMGD. As an Operations Executive, you will play a vital role in ensuring the smooth and efficient functioning of our operations to meet the growing demands of our business. You will be responsible for overseeing various operational aspects, including inventory management, order fulfillment, logistics coordination, and customer service.
Responsibilities:
Manage and optimize inventory levels to ensure availability of products while minimizing holding costs.
Coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of products and maintain healthy relationships.
Oversee order processing, fulfillment, and shipping operations to ensure accurate and timely order delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and customer service, to streamline operations and improve customer satisfaction.
Monitor and analyze operational performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement effective strategies.
Maintain accurate records of inventory, orders, and shipments using appropriate software tools.
Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and returns in a prompt and professional manner.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, market demands, and regulations related to the e-commerce and healthy brand industry.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or diploma in business administration, operations management, supply chain or a related field.
Proven work experience in operations, preferably in the e-commerce or retail industry.
Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in using inventory management systems and software tools.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with team members and external partners.
Familiarity with logistics and supply chain processes.
Knowledge of the e-commerce industry, including customer expectations and best practices.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
Passion for health and wellness is desirable.

title: Operations Controller (Lylo)
company_info: Based in Singapore, Lumens Group is a family of brands offering an ecosystem of services around cars. Our story began as a private hire car leasing company to address the needs of the new sharing economy led by Uber and Grab. Our core business has been leasing to ride hailing drivers and we grew our car fleet to one of the largest in Singapore in under 8 years. During this time, we have expanded our services to personal & corporate vehicle leasing, vehicle purchasing and financing. Emerging strong from the Covid-19 period, Lumens is building for an exciting new era that brings in a wide range of merchants and individual consumers to our ecosystem. By owning a critical mass of vehicles and driver relationships, we are able to innovate on vehicle setup, driver upskilling & deployment, as well as technology and data capabilities to build mobility platform services that impact our everyday lives.

title: ICT Command Centre Operator
company: DXC TECHNOLOGY SERVICES SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
company_info: DXC Technology is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 clients in more than 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.technology.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
You will be part of a team who is responsible to run an IT Command Centre offering round-the -clock service desk and system monitoring services to the users of the ICT Systems. The IT Command Centre offers a Self-Service ITSM Portal for users to log requests to the various vendors supporting the ICT Systems for assistance. The IT Command Centre is also equipped with monitoring, reporting and analytical dashboards and smart operations maps projected onto a video wall depicting an overview of the health status of the ICT Systems.

Job Description
Responsible to man the service desk phone calls and respond to emails from users
Provide assistance to users in the usage of the Self-Service ITSM Portal
Responsible to ensure that the calls logged are clear and comprehensive
Perform triage and appropriate routing of incidents by escalating to the appropriate vendors for resolution
Takes on an active coordination role to ensure that all incidents are promptly resolved
Act as first responder for system alerts to verify, assess impact and escalate to the appropriate vendors for resolution
Perform system health checks and support L2 Team with the resolution
Assist in report generation
Assist in documentation
Assist in setting up of conference calls between systems project managers and vendors for major incidents resolution
May participate in adhoc, short-term projects eg. conduct system demo
Support the operations manager in the continual efforts to improve the command centre processes
Requirements
Minimum Diploma holder in Information Technology or Computer Studies or equivalent or two (2) years of experience in an enterprise command centre
Knowledge in incident management
Has knowledge & basic working experience with supporting Windows, Unix, Network, Applications etc.
Experience with call tracking / ticket management system (ServiceNow preferred)
Must be able to work independently and/or in a team environment
Customer-oriented and able to interact professionally with a diverse group of colleagues, vendors and clients
Capable of maintaining a calm cool composure even when navigating challenging situations and frustrated clients
Willing to work shifts – 12-hr shift including Public Holidays and Weekends.
Fully Vaccinated
Work Location – North of Singapore

title: Client Lifecycle Management Operations Lead
company_info: UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors. With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs. From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your role :
Would you like to help us enhance our client experience, now and for the future? Are you client-focused with high risk awareness?

We’re looking for Client Lifecycle Management (“CLM”) Team Lead to:

- Lead the Client Lifecycle Management team in post-Onboarding services including client maintenance & names screening
- Coach team members and nurture talents
- Maintain in-depth awareness of regulatory requirements and UBS policy; ensure controls are robust
- Act as key point of contact for stakeholders for CLM topics
- Design and implement process simplification, systems enhancements and automation to increase efficiency and manage risk.
- Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders across front office, compliance, legal, risk and change in front to back initiatives

Your team :
You’ll be working in Client Lifecycle Management team within Wealth Management Chief Operating Office (“COO”). This team, based in Singapore, offers Client Lifecycle Management & Names Screening services for existing clients in both Hong Kong and Singapore.

Your expertise :
- 7-10 years of relevant experience in Wealth Management Client Lifecycle Management or related Operations roles. Working knowledge of Hong Kong and/or Singapore regulatory landscape favored. At least 1 year experience in managing teams
- Client focused and motivated to partner front to back stakeholders in defining practical solutions
- Keen interest in process simplification and automation. Experience in leading and implementing process changes & automation favored
- Strong risk and control mindset; logical and creative approach to problem-solving
- Highly motivated, client service oriented and enjoys working with a team.
- Effective communicator and comfortable in engaging stakeholders at senior levels.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
An integral part of Singapore’s “City in a Garden” vision, Gardens by the Bay spans a total of 101 hectares of prime land at the heart of Singapore’s new downtown – Marina Bay. Comprising three waterfront gardens – Bay South, Bay East and Bay Central – Gardens by the Bay will be a showcase of horticulture and garden artistry that will bring the world of plants to Singapore and present Singapore to the World. We have career opportunities for the following and we would like to invite suitably qualified candidates to join us.
RESPONSIBILITIES
You will manage key visitor touch points of the various gated attractions, as well as the transportation and mobility of the visitors within the Gardens. You will implement visitor management plans and processes and ensure a pleasant and wholesome experience for all visitors. You will respond swiftly to incidents and emergencies and work closely with the business and events teams to facilitate programmes and events within the Gardens. You will also oversee the ticketing operations team and work with business units to attract new and repeat visitors through planning and implementing innovative ticketing and promotions.
QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in any relevant field
Minimum 5 years’ of relevant experience in a tourist attraction or related industry
Ability to manage, supervise, and deploy a frontline team with robust teamwork
Resourceful and dynamic with strong interpersonal and communication skills
Pleasant and friendly disposition, with the ability to remain customer-oriented under challenging situations
Creative, adaptable and able to work in a fast-paced environment
Able to work weekends and public holidays
  Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Gardens by the Bay

title: Theatre Manager
company_info: Gateway Entertainment is wholly dedicated to creating unforgettable magical experiences. Established in 2000, Gateway Entertainment was set up to produce homegrown theatre, magic shows, corporate events, movies and social/community ventures. Since then, it has remained a committed contributor to Singapore’s arts scene through its stage productions, arts programmes and social ventures. Drawing on the universal power of magic to move and delight, Gateway Entertainment has created and staged mega illusion-theatre productions in over 100 cities that have been enjoyed by millions of people around the world. As part of its vision to positively influence popular culture, Gateway Entertainment has also produced 22 movies and television specials that have been seen all throughout Asia. Gateway Entertainment also manages and operates Gateway Theatre, an arts centre in Bukit Merah. With a 922-seat Theatre, 207-seat Black Box, a Dance Studio, and other multi-purpose spaces, there is a space for everyone at Gateway Theatre. Its mission is to support and promote made-in-Singapore works and talents of all cultures, while developing an appreciation of the arts in Singapore. Gateway Theatre strives to be a place that allows artists to explore their creativity, and encourages the public to explore their imagination.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a positive, result-driven, and highly motivated leader to be responsible for overseeing the theatre’s organisational structure, fundraising, marketing, budgeting, accounting, and day-to-day operations.

The role of the Theatre Manager is to work closely with the Theatre Director to oversee the ongoing operations of all departments in the company, ensuring that all of the Theatre’s efforts are delivered consistently in a tangible, efficient, and effective manner. He/she will assist in directing the company towards its primary goals and objectives, leading the departments to consider major decisions including business development, acquisitions, and programming of events. This individual is responsible for ensuring that the theatre is a welcoming and vibrant space for audiences and artists.

If you possess excellent leadership and management skills, have a strong passion for the arts, and would like to play a part in developing Singapore’s arts landscape, we welcome you to join us for a challenging and fulfilling career.

Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Business Planning and Resource Allocation
Working with the Theatre Director, the Theatre Manager is responsible for driving the development, refinement, and implementation of the Theatre’s business strategy. This includes:
· Planning resources effectively and providing leadership to develop the Theatre’s role as an arts centre.
· Providing recommendations for the formulation of the strategic direction and targets of the Theatre.
· Supporting the Theatre Director in the preparation and implementation of the strategic and annual plans and ensuring that these are formally updated on a regular basis.
· Defining and documenting the primary responsibilities for the Theatre’s leadership team.
· Reviewing the financial results of operations and comparing with the Theatre’s objectives, taking appropriate measures to correct unsatisfactory performance and results.
· Making resource allocation decisions and supporting initiatives that further the Theatre’s achievement of its strategic objectives.
· Supporting the Theatre Director in the recruitment of key positions within the Theatre’s structure.
· Motivating and developing staff so that the Theatre has the human resources and competence to ensure high professional standards.
· Working with the programming team to produce a line-up of events that aligns with the Theatre direction/programming objectives, while considering audience demographics, and balancing venue hire and programming.
· Developing partnerships and networks with stakeholders including arts, culture, and entertainment industry players, educational organisations, education institutions, relevant bodies, and the public, and encouraging engagement in artistic activities.

2. Financial Management
Assisting the Theatre Director in performing accurate analysis of financial trends and budgets.
Evaluating the Theatre’s financial, operational, sales and marketing structures to plan for continual improvements and a continual increase in operating efficiencies.
Improving the planning and budgeting process continually by educating departments and key members of corporate leadership.
· Providing the Theatre Director with accurate financial reports, helping to analyse profit and loss, and act swiftly to make decisions which will improve profitability.

3. Front-of-House and Operations (working with the Venue Sales Manager)
· Managing all operational matters relating to the front-of-house, bar and catering operations, and putting a staffing structure in place to support this within set budgets.
· Ensuring that all aspects of front-of-house areas provide a welcoming environment to customers and potential customers.
· Acting as Duty Manager on some daytime and evening shifts. During shifts where there is a performance, to liaise with production staff to control the venue’s performances. Responsible for the well-being and safety of the audience, and managing the front-of-house.
· Ensuring that visitors with special needs or access requirements are catered for appropriately and that the theatre is an accessible venue.
· Promoting and managing events (non-arts and entertainment events or related activities), conferences, functions, etc; liaising with external hirers, and in-house technical staff, and coordinating all activities relating to the events.
· Overseeing events for other departments, including but not limited to events for media, fundraising, etc.

4. ‘Project Welcome’
· Playing a key role in ‘Project Welcome’ – a project to ensure that artists, audiences, and front-line staff feel engaged with the organisation and at home in the building.
· Ensuring that all public spaces and other spaces are welcoming and inviting, working with the Marketing Communications and Facilities teams to achieve this.
· Working alongside the Venue Sales Manager to motivate and train the front-line staff, so that they reflect the values of the theatre.
· Welcoming all companies, performers, and artists when they are in the building and ensuring that they feel supported.
· Helping to create an atmosphere of creativity in the building that encourages artists and audiences to create and participate in our artistic programme.

Requirements:
· Proven work experience as a Theatre Manager or similar role
· Knowledge of organisational effectiveness and operations management
· Experience in budgeting and forecasting
· Familiarity with business and financial principles
· Excellent communication skills
· Leadership ability
· Outstanding organisational skills
· Degree in Business, Operations Management, or related field
· Good knowledge of Singapore’s arts scene will be an added advantage

title: General Manager
company_info: SKYLINE BUSINESS CONSULTING PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Looking for a broad level of experience and understanding of international trade and logistics endeavors General Manager to lead and oversee the development of the total business, both locally and overseas, and provide corporate goals and directions to ensure success, maximize revenue and profit, and accountability to the stakeholders. Duties for the General Manager will include allocating budget resources, coordinating business operations, monitoring and motivating staff, managing operational costs, and monitoring financial activities. Assisting our organization in maintaining relationships with clients, generating new business, increasing staff productivity, improving service, ensuring sustainability, and meeting business objectives.The successful candidate for this role should possess excellent communication skills, superior knowledge of business functions, exceptional budgeting, and finance skills, and strong leadership qualities.

Responsibilities:
· Overseeing daily business operations and responsible for business planning and control, marketing & sales, business development, implementing and improving standard processes and tools to drive operational efficiencies, and met operational and financial commitments.
· Manage the transportation logistics for a range of bulk commodities, ensuring they reach their destinations safely and cost-effective transportation of goods .
· Responsible for negotiating major trade deals in countries such as the United States and Australia, as well as facilitating trade activities in Southeast Asia.
· Identify, evaluate, negotiate and manage important business opportunities such as sales, projects, consulting, engagements and partnership.
· Build and maintain close relationships with various external stakeholders and partners to ensure customer retention.
·Maintain budgets and optimize expenses to ensure the financial viability and cost structure is regularly analyzed and appropriate measures are taken to monitor and reduce costs in relation to the operations.
· Give strategic direction and hands-on leadership to the management team to drive commercial growth.

Requirements:
· Minimum a Degree in Business/Economics or equavalent field.
· At least 10 years experiences in logistic industry, must have knowledge in international trade experiences in similar role and industry with a proven track record of operations management.
·Excellent analytical, problem-solving, organizational, budgetary and project management skills.
· Well developed leadership, people management, problem solving, planning and management skills.
· Excellent communication skills, able to speak Chinese/English fluently and communicate with Chinese/local smoothly. Candidates with long-term working experiences in China are preferred.
· Willing to go on oversea business trips, long-term stay at overseas may be required. International work experience, especially in Asia, will be advantageous.

Skyline Business Consulting Pte Ltd (EA Lic No: 14C7389)

Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for like-minded individuals - people who are passionate, disciplined and focused - to join our mission to become Singapore's leading English and Writing Specialist.

Are you a driven, resourceful, committed, creative and independent individual? Join us for a fruitful and hands-on experience!

Responsibility
Aptitude for teaching and nurturing towards kids

title: Retail Operation Manager (Beauty Dept)
company_info: Bluebell Group is a distributor of luxury, premium, and lifestyle brands throughout Asia. Since 1954, our passion for all things luxurious, inspiring, and beautiful has helped establish some of the world’s leading brand names in Asia. We have the most comprehensive distribution platform and network in Asia thanks to years of building trusted partnerships. Global partners trust us to manage complex distribution channels for their brand, targeting multiple cultures and market sectors, while local partners rely on us to curate and accelerate the inherent potential of our brands. Our ability to consistently deliver value is the gold standard that runs through the core of our company.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
Responsible for the sales maximization and brand profitability of the assigned brands for both retail and wholesale. Also to manage, lead and motivate a team of retail staff to drive growth of the brand.

Sales
· Responsible for the sales performance and profitability of the brand(s) both retail and wholesale.
· Provide feedback and recommendation to enhance sales and customer database.

Customer Service
· Main liaison with the Marketing & Communications Department to ensure all current and important customers are informed of activities and brand events at the boutique level.
· Provide personalized service to selected important customers.
· Handle customers’ feedback and complaints.
· Analyze existing customer service database in efforts to maintain regular customers and introduce new customers.

Inventory Control and Security
· Responsible for the overall stock positioning and stock management of the brand.
· Supervise and regular checks to ensure stock control policies for stores and warehouse are followed diligently to control stock loss.
· Manage stock status, sell-thru, promotion, discounts and stock margins.
· Provide timely feedback on categories or groups of merchandise not performing for each season and take immediate actions.

Operations
· Perform regular visits to stores to ensure that operations are efficiently managed by the Operation Manager and team.
· Feedback on market intelligence / competitors (e.g. pricing, entry and exit of brands).
· Communicate to staff changes in directions and policies of the Company.
· Ensure all regular reports for submission to Head office and Brand Principal are done accurately and on a timely basis.
· Review and ensure monthly expenses are well within budget.
· Build and maintain good relationship with mall / retail management.

HR & Training
· Recruit, build and motivate a strong team that work towards the common objectives.
· Ensure staff issues are managed according to the Human Resource guideline.
· Provide feedback to Human Resource Department on staff related issues and practical suggestions to enhance staff motivation.
· Ensure training and development activities are carried out by relevant departments to enhance the performance of the staff.

Merchandising
· Ensure guidelines from principal are being adhered to.
· Ensure shop windows, in-store and store room are well merchandised and in tip-top condition.

Marketing
· Work with Marketing & Communications Department to plan for the annual marketing calendar for each brand.
· Participate in the marketing activities and brand events.
· Provide timely feedback on the effectiveness of the marketing activities and brand events.
Dimensions / Territory / Scope / Scale (indicating the areas to which responsibilities extend and the scale of responsibilities)

Internal stakeholders
· Division Manager
· General Manager
· Senior Management Committee
· Managers and employees of all other levels
· Direct report and team members in retail stores and wholesale

External stakeholders
· Regular and important customers
· Principals of Brand
· Mall management / Landlords
· Regulatory bodies
· Suppliers / Vendors
· Event organizers


Requirements:
• Candidate must possess at least Degree, Diploma, or related fields
• At least 5 years of supervisory experience in luxury retail
• Experienced in sales forecasting, store operations, rostering and leading a sales team
• Possessed great leadership and motivation skill in order to drive the team to achieve targets

title: Assistant Operations Manager, Building Services & Tenant Management
company_info: GOUGH RECRUITMENT (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. GOUGH’s vision is to strive to be the leading and preferred industry specialist with a holistic approach to delivering quality talent in the Real Estate, Property, Development and Construction markets.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company Overview:
Our client, a leader in the real estate industry, is seeking a dynamic and experienced individual to join their team as an Assistant Manager for Building Services & Tenant Management. This prestigious Grade A office building is known for its commitment to excellence, and they are looking for a candidate who can help them in keeping that lead.
Responsibilities: As the Assistant Manager for Building Services & Tenant Management, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of this mixed office-retail development while maintaining exceptional service levels. Your responsibilities will include:
Assisting in the development of plans and daily operations management to ensure the highest standards are met.
Contributing to the development of policies to enhance operational efficiency and productivity.
Collaborating on the improvement of standard operating procedures (SOPs) and departmental business continuity plans (BCP).
Managing a team of service providers and ensuring effective communication and KPI achievement.
Reviewing contract specifications to ensure cost-effectiveness and competitiveness.
Overseeing capital replacement, asset enhancement, and maintenance projects.
Liaising with government authorities and consultants on regulatory compliance.
Ensuring adherence to building and statutory requirements/regulations.
Implementing safety and health procedures in accordance with relevant laws and regulations.
Preparing budgets for operational and capital expenditure and managing maintenance expenditures within approved limits.
Conducting tender exercises for operational and capital projects and ensuring timely completion.
Preparing and drafting approval documents for expenditure requests.
Managing service providers and their processes to support the organization's core business.
Ensuring high standards of maintenance and operational efficiency are maintained.
Administering contractual obligations and ensuring timely renewal of maintenance contracts.
Planning and organizing preventive maintenance for all facility-related works.
Identifying defects or irregularities and overseeing rectification work.
Planning building inspections and developing facilities-related emergency plans.
Developing building improvement strategies and proposing rectification and preventive programs.
Maintaining and updating the Fit-Out Guide.
Cultivating strong landlord-tenant relationships.
Managing and addressing tenant service requirements.
Planning tenancy-related work, including fit-out, alterations, and reinstatement.
Coordinating with other departments for sub-division or tenancy improvement projects.
Ensuring proper handovers and documentation for premises.
Maintaining and updating building records.
Managing the tenant survey process.
Job Requirements: To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and attributes:
Bachelor's degree from a reputable institution, preferably in Building Management, Facilities Management, or equivalent.
Minimum of 5 years of supervisory experience in estate/property management, preferably in large commercial or retail buildings.
Experience in managing tenants in Grade A office buildings.
Proficient in reading and understanding technical/structural drawings, such as as-built drawings.
Strong business acumen and effective managerial leadership skills.
Excellent interpersonal and communication abilities.
Independent, resourceful, self-motivated, results-oriented, and a team player capable of working well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Versatile and quick in problem-solving within specified deadlines.
Profound knowledge of statutory requirements and codes of practice related to building services, facility operations, maintenance, and safety.
If you meet these qualifications and are eager to contribute to the success of our client, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join them in setting new standards of excellence in the real estate industry.

Asher Tan

EA Licence No. 11C3753
Reg No. R1988776

title: APJ XDR Strategy & Operations Manager
company_info: No information added.
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
The Sales xDR Operations Team (Sales Development Operations- SDR/BDR) strives to be the brain and the spine of the xDR team at Okta. As part of the Business Operations group, you will be responsible for the APJ xDR team’s success by ensuring they have the insight, tools, processes & strategies needed to run effectively and efficiently.

The Opportunity

You’ll partner closely with xDR managers to put structures in place that help the organization achieve their qualified lead (sales meetings set), stage 2 opportunity and pipeline quotas. You’ll collaborate with other Okta colleagues to design and implement your operational solutions, including Marketing Operations, Business Technology and Sales Enablement.

What you’ll be doing

Business Partnership:
Serve as a trusted advisor to APJ xDR leadership & managers. Provide recommendations on operational improvements and ways to drive effectiveness and efficiency across Global teams.
Manage xDR quotas and PipeGen attainment, including the coverage and generation needs for each team. Work with Finance & Marketing Operations teams to identify and address areas of opportunity or concern.
Enable xDR teams by building assets such as: reports, dashboards, models, frameworks, etc.
Regularly inform stakeholders across xDR, Sales, Marketing, GTM Strategy & Planning of deeply analytical insights on xDR performance to ensure cross functional alignment and drive a data-driven decision strategy. Analyze and interrogate insights to proactively identify opportunities and prioritize initiatives to drive the business forward.
Annual Planning:
Support the development of the annual and quarterly APJ xDR planning processes including capacity and coverage models, quota setting etc.
Apply functional expertise and insights to support the strategy formation and validate alignment to the company objectives with optimal return on investment.
Business Reviews:
Supervise the weekly Territory Review, MBR, and QBR procedures, providing insights and identifying gaps to subsequently define a Call to Action strategy aimed at promoting growth.
Day to Day:
Work closely with your AMER/EMEA xDR Operations counterparts and the APJ Marketing Operations team to drive alignment on Global KPIs and processes, proactively identify areas of opportunity and execute on key strategies.
Implement APJ xDR reporting packages to increase rep effectiveness and productivity.
Conduct weekly metrics reviews with xDR management.
Review the pipeline generation needs and variances for each team. Work with xDR managers to identify areas of opportunity or concern.
Document essential processes and engagement rules; help enforce processes such as activity metrics & SLA attainment.
Make recommendations to optimize the xDR User Experience in Salesforce by identifying areas of process simplification and automation.
Collaborate with Marketing Operations to provide feedback and insights into areas such as Lead Scoring, Propensity models, monthly Call Blitz planning etc.
What you’ll bring to the role
Experience in a Sales Development Operations (or similar) role
Expertise in Lead management best practices & processes for both inbound (BDR) and outbound (SDR)
Expertise in quota setting exercises & strategies
Strong understanding of the Demand Funnel
Salesforce mastery: create complex dashboards & reports, custom report types
Intermediate experience in Tableau dashboard creation desirable
Working knowledge of Anaplan desirable
Exceptional quantitative and Google Sheets/MS Excel skills (sumifs, index/match and vlookup, table formulas)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You can hold a meeting with directors and VPs

8) Responsible for resolving operational problems raised by the members of their operation teams, when such problems are beyond the authority or ability of their team members.
9) Take note of customers’ feedback and complaints and ensure that these feedback or complaints are addressed.
10) Initiate correction or rectification in the event of a service deficiency or non-conformity occurring and undertaking corrective action to prevent a recurrence where it is applicable.
11) Carry out daily tasks according to quality management system and operations procedures in order to meet their assigned quality objectives or key performance indicators.

B. Competencies
1.The ability to identify relevant sources of information. To learn how to communicate relevant information clearly and effectively in written and oral communication through liaising with multiple parties.
2. The ability to effectively communicate business values and cultures.
3. The ability to multi-task.
4. The ability to liaise and handle drivers/customers.
5. Utilisation of transport management system.
6. Corrective and preventive actions analysis.
