title: Director of Operations
company_info: DDB Group Singapore is a full service marketing communications agency, and is part of the DDB Worldwide communications network, headquartered in New York City. DDB Worldwide is a member of Omnicom Group Inc., an American global advertising, marketing and corporate communication​s holding company.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As the Director of Operations, you will drive flawless execution across all engagement. You will be responsible for allocating resources, managing and securing freelancers, working with HR to bring on new employees, engaging third-party vendors and partners, developing operating policies and processes, fostering teamwork, establishing and measuring KPIs, resolving issues between departments, and taking charge of overall staff utilisation. Simply, you are responsible for driving operational excellence across the Agency.
You will be responsible for developing a framework for cultural change, enabling the organization to do the best that it possibly can. You will challenge everything as you work to change the status quo. As the director of efficiency, you will be constantly looking for better ways to get things done and this will be one of the most important aspects of the role.

Key responsibilities;
· Successful project delivery.
· Performance against key KPIs, most notably: team utilization, client satisfaction and staff efficiency with a view to maximise client profitability.
· Owning all aspects of a Project Management System rollout including stakeholder management, change management, implementation, and training with a view of 100% staff engagement.
· Ensuring adherence to Project Management best practices and helping to drive improvements to current practices in collaboration with other agency leaders.
· Collaborating with Traffic and Project Managers to ensure effective and strategic use of all personnel time.
· Work with Account Management and Team Leaders to successfully on-board new client work and navigate team transitions for on-going work.
· Ensure a clear delivery plan is in-place and maintained for all active client accounts.
· Management of Timesheet process with a view to maximise accuracy and compliance.
· Establishing defined processes and training guides that is repeatable and scaleable and ensuring all new recruits are trained accordingly.
· Total Quality Management of all output
· Management of Project Management & Traffic team.

Skills & Qualifications;
· Technologically proficient with a passion for automation, digital transformation, and change
· Extensive experience working with cross-disciplinary teams in an Agency Environment with 3+ years in a Senior Operations management role in a mid to large sized agency.
· Experience in delivering/or overseeing complex client deliverables.
· Proven success on delivery against KPIs, with a view of delivering quality output profitably.
· Experience working with Replicon Polaris or Workfront will be highly regarded but not essential.

Interested applicants, please send your resume and notice period to career@sg.ddb.com, indicating current and expected salaries.

title: 23675487 Assistant Vice President, Branch Operations Service Manager
company_info: Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At Citi, we get to connect millions of people across hundreds of cities and countries every day. And we've been doing it for more than 200 years. We do this through our unparalleled global network. We provide a broad range of financial services and products to our clients – whether they be consumers, corporations, governments, or institutions – to help them meet their biggest opportunities and face the world's toughest challenges.

Shape your Career with Citi
Citi Global Wealth (CGW) brings together the full power of Citi to serve the entire continuum of wealth clients, from affluent to ultra-high net worth to family offices.
We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as an Assistant Vice President, Branch Operations Service Manager based in Singapore. Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well-being to help plan for your future. For instance:
We empower our employees to manage their financial well-being and help them plan for the future.
Citi provides access to an array of learning and development resources to help broaden and deepen your skills and knowledge as your career progresses.
We offer our employees resources and tools to volunteer in the communities in which they live and work. In 2019, Citi employee volunteers contributed more than 1 million volunteer hours around the world.
In this role, you’re expected to :
Provide operational and service leadership and direction to the team
Responsible for providing support for operations activities in the Branch Channel segment
Day-to-day focus is on resolution of complex problems or transactions, where expertise is required to interpret against policies, guidelines or processes
Full ownership for one or more processes, reports, procedures or products, and may also be considered analytical or procedural experts representing a unit or team on cross-function process or project deliverables
Full leadership and supervisory responsibilities, including duties such as performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary and terminations as well as direction of daily tasks and responsibilities.
As a successful candidate, you’d ideally have the following skills and exposure:
Minimum of 5-8 years relevant experience in front line or customer facing roles within Retail Banking
Knowledge of Retail Banking operations and solid understanding of industry standards and practices.
Excellent communication, both written and spoken; and diplomacy skills
Ability to manage relationships both internal and external
Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience
Working at Citi is far more than just a job. A career with us means joining a family of more than 230,000 dedicated people from around the globe. At Citi, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career, give back to your community and make a real impact.

title: Events and Operations Associate (1 year contract)
company_info: For the last 56 years, Singapore Cancer Society (SCS) has been minimising the impact of cancer, seeking to bring normalcy and quality of life back to those impacted by cancer. Through its public education, advocacy, cancer screening services, support for cancer research, welfare aid and hospice care and through its various community engagement events, SCS has been working with key partners and rallying the community together in the fight against cancer. As SCS expands and refines its mission to serve more and serve better, we are looking for various talented individuals with an affinity for our cause to join Team SCS. If you believe you have the passion and you can add value to enhance our mission, we are looking for suitable candidates for varius positions in our organization.
description:

Reporting to the Manager, you will oversee the Colorectal Cancer Faecal Immunochemical Test (FIT) kit screening project. This includes facilitating smooth operations, logistics, data management and engaging partners. You will assist the project team lead to conceptualize, plan and implement the campaign for Colorectal Cancer.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Assist with Campaign Management

Coordinate re-stocking efforts
Conduct monthly stock take and related invoicing Implement checks on vendor’s data entry

Manage vendors for system access and records keyed
Conduct daily checks and upload screening participants data
Update system records and handle positive case
Survey form data entry/data analysis
Update participant database after returned mails
5. Others duties include:
Purchasing and billing
Manage calls from participants
Volunteer and partner training on FIT distribution
Qualifications and Experience
Diploma in logistics, events management
2 years of relevant experience in events or operations management
Ability to link overall communication strategy with organisational mission and vision
Able to work in a fast-paced environment
Meticulous and detailed in work output
Able to work independently as well as with teams
Able to work on weekday evenings/ weekends
Excellent verbal and written skills
Ability to work with department teams and cross-functional teams with concurrent projects
Identify solutions and work with campaign teams to address challenges
Excellent interpersonal skills to work in teams and people from different background

title: Operations Manager
company_info: At Advanced Dental, we are committed to providing our patients with dental care catered to each of their unique needs. Since the establishment of our first clinic in 1986, we have grown to over 19 clinics across Singapore. Today, we are one of the fasting growing practices in Singapore and are proud to be able to provide a full range of treatments to meet all our patients’ dental needs within our practice. This is made possible by a dynamic and diverse group of professionals working together, whether in our clinics or behind the scenes. We are passionate about helping our patients feel amazing about their oral health every time a bite is taken or a smiled is shared.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Operations Manager will be responsible for all aspects of the Operations Department and all associated functions to ensure all clinics’ operations are run smoothly and successfully.

He/She will lead, develop, support and coordinate operations teams in the headquarters and clinics to ensure operational needs across all clinics are met, and provide timely and accurate information and feedback to the senior management.

Areas of responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Develop and implement strategies and plans to ensure effective and smooth clinic operations, and ensure policies and SOPs are properly developed and adhered to by all clinics and staff
Develop appropriate targets and initiatives to optimize clinic performance, and organize and lead the team to achieve them
Management of resource and manpower planning - including planning and administering staff rosters
Ensure clinic infrastructure is sufficient and functional, including managing maintenance and repairs of equipment where necessary
Ensure that the general clinic environment is maintained to required standards.
Manage procurement processes and inventory, to ensure all materials and equipment are purchased and delivered to clinics as necessary
Manage setting up of new Clinic locations
Oversee Operations and Customer Service teams to ensure operational efficiency of the Call Centre and manage patient feedback/complaints and plan/executive appropriate service recovery
Constantly drive and facilitate improvement initiatives to heighten service levels, productivity, and efficiency
Work closely with all relevant departments and stakeholders (such as Human Resources, Finance, Marketing) on various initiatives and tasks as assigned, to ensure objectives are met and deliverables are produced
The Operations Manager will report directly to top management and work with all relevant stakeholders on the above matters, and any other duties as may be assigned.

Qualifications / Requirements

Experience and Education:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred, Diploma acceptable
At least 5 years of working experience
Prior experience with managing large teams would be advantageous
No prior experience in dental industry required, but prior experience in the following related fields would be advantageous:
Experience in a clinic or healthcare setting (Including non-dental experience).
Experience in the service industry (F&B, Spa, Airline, etc)
Proficient in Microsoft Office
In addition, the successful applicant should possess:
Strong interest in service operations management, customer service or equivalent
Excellent communication and written skills
Excellent critical thinking and analytical skills
Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills
Positive working attitude with willingness to learn
Ability and flexibility to work with different stakeholders in fast-paced and dynamic environment
Ability to work under pressure
Strong drive towards continuous improvement, with resourceful and innovative thinking
Keen sense of responsibility and accountability

title: OPERATIONS MANAGER
company_info: A-Gas is an international speciality gas and chemicals business, which predominantly focuses on the refrigerant recovery and reclamation but also operates in the fire protection, industrial gas and performance chemical sectors. A-Gas has over 700 employees based at 15 operating sites, in 10 countries (including UK, US, South Africa, Australia, China, Singapore and Japan), on four continents around the globe which we have developed through a mix of new entry “start-ups” and acquisitions. We believe that A-Gas is the only pure-play global platform in refrigeration gases. A-Gas has a successful track record of acquisitions, completing three in the last 18 months, eight in the last five years and over 15 in the Group’s 25 year history. Current pro-forma revenues for the Group are in excess of €300m. A-Gas currently has four operating businesses in the Asian region (“Asia BAU”) –a reclamation and recovery operation in Singapore, a recovery and reclamation operation in Japan, a lab/sourcing operation in Shanghai and a small sales, warehouse and packaging facility in Thailand. A-Gas Singapore has a full operation in refrigerant recovery and reclamation. Singapore is the hub for ASEAN countries and the group has positioned A-Gas Singapore as the “Centre of Excellence” for the region to provide full support to the operation in other Asia countries.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Purpose
Lead all operational aspects of production including: material production, technical / quality control, compliance, logistics, procurement, Engineering projects, Maintenance as well as day-to-day people management for all on-site employees. Work with Management Team to continuously improve operations, optimise production decisions, and enable rapid reaction to changing market conditions.
Ensure future strategic operational plans align with commercial and market requirements.

Managerial
· Compliance with all relevant safety, quality, environmental and People and Culture policies, procedures and directions in place coupled with maintaining a safe work environment.
· Working with A-Gas management to implement A-Gas policies, procedures, work instructions, mission, and goals.
· Demonstrating the personal qualities, behavioural traits and A-Gas values and behaviours listed below.
· Reporting to A-Gas management (both formally and informally) as requested.
· Perform any other tasks as directed within an employee’s skill and competence.

Production
· Provide consultative support to the Continuous Improvement Manager on the development of long-term site planning and production strategy.
· Maintain the production plan for the site by working closely with the Operations, Commercial & Management teams.
· Provide regular production reporting and work with the Operations & Management Teams to provide commentary on progress and potential issues.
· Support the SIOP process
· Lead the execution of the production plan and ensure highest possible utilisation levels.
· Monitor operational staff performance, identify, and ensure delivery of training as required.
· Lead the operational management of production assets onsite.
· Ensure sites are maintained to highest possible standards.

Compliance
· Support the Safety, Quality and Environment coordinator with the development of SQE documentation.
· Provide the highest-level safety performance monitoring for all aspects of site operations.
· Lead the implementation and maintenance of compliance standards and governance as driven by the Safety, Quality and Environment Coordinator.
· Ensure the site is fully compliant with all legal requirements.

Technical
· Ensure full understanding of all Governance Standards.
· Continuously provide efficiency analysis, identify areas for improvement and process enhancement. Work with Continuous Improvement Manager to facilitate sharing of best technical practice.
· Ensure full induction and training is provided when new products are incorporated into production.
· Ensure risk assessments and hazard identification are carried out for all tasks being undertaken.
· Work with staff to monitor and minimise equipment downtime in accordance with site KPI’s and implement measures to address issues identified so that production targets are achieved.
· Lead operational/engineering projects for the design, specification and build of new equipment so that A-Gas is using the most up to date technology for the benefit of product quality.
· Ensure preventative and reactive maintenance is completed as required to ensure the safe and continued running of all plant equipment.

Procurement
· Provide support and experience to Procurement and Logistics team to enable the development of procurement objectives, policies and plans.
· Execute all site procurement activities in compliance with policies and plans.
· Maintain an updated waste material plan.
· Work with Management Team on the SIOP process to understand required changes to waste material.
· Manage all site-specific procurement contracts, including administration to ensure high quality and on-time service from providers.
· Own and maintain the Capex plan, control and tracking for sites

Logistics
· Work with the Procurement and Logistics team to determine inbound and outbound logistics plan, including logistics-partner and cylinder / ISO tank requirements.
· Work with the Procurement and Logistics team to develop and maintain a material stock management plan, covering finished goods, quota material and/or recovered waste material.
· Lead the execution of all site logistics activities, manage costs according to agreed budgets / cost levels.

Experience, Knowledge, and Qualifications
· Essential
- Experience in a Management position
- Tertiary qualifications in Management, Engineering or equivalent experience
- Proficient safety, quality and environmental awareness and knowledge of relevant legislative requirements and statutory regulatory authority requirements.
- Proficient knowledge of dangerous goods/hazardous substances
- Leadership skills that complement a forward thinking, innovative and modern business practice
- Clear and concise communications skills (both verbal and written)
- Technologically competent with the ability to learn new software programs. Proficient with Microsoft Suite of Products and Outlook
· Desirable
- Relevant experience in the Gas and/or Chemical Sales and Service Sector
- Post Graduate qualifications
- Internal auditing and risk assessment skills

Personal Qualities & Behavioural Traits
- Punctual and ability to work to set timeframes/deadlines
- Problem solving skills
- Attention to detail
- Respect and work with others
- Seek assistance where necessary
- Flexible and willing to adapt to new programs and work environments
- Team player
- Well organised
- Ability to work on multiple tasks and prioritise as necessary
- Has a style of working that fits with the SPOT ON Zero Harm values and company values & behaviour (below)

title: Channel Operations Manager
company_info: Trellix is a global company redefining the future of cybersecurity. The company’s open and native extended detection and response (XDR) platform helps organizations confronted by today’s most advanced threats gain confidence in the protection and resilience of their operations. Trellix’s security experts, along with an extensive partner ecosystem, accelerate technology innovation through machine learning and automation to empower over 40,000 business and government customers. More at https://trellix.com. McAfee Enterprise and FireEye have combined strengths and are building an extraordinary portfolio of security capabilities. This combination immediately creates a Global cybersecurity market leader with more than 40,000 customers, 5,000 employees, and nearly $2B of revenue. The new company’s integrated security portfolio protects customers across endpoints, infrastructure, applications, and in the cloud. As one company, we offer an unbeatable combination. With vast opportunities to expand our global cybersecurity footprint, broaden our solution sets, and deepen our customer relationships. We have a strong footprint in Singapore and SEA with primarily Go To Market, Sales, Consulting and Systems Engineering/Technical Architect roles. We offer a comprehensive Benefits package for your personal and family security. The time to join us is right now!
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Trellix (www.trellix.com)
Trellix is a global company redefining the future of cybersecurity. The company’s open and native extended detection and response (XDR) platform helps organizations confronted by today’s most advanced threats gain confidence in the protection and resilience of their operations. Trellix’s security experts, along with an extensive partner ecosystem, accelerate technology innovation through machine learning and automation to empower over 40,000 business and government customers.
Emerged from McAfee’s Enterprise business in July 2021, when Symphony Technology Group a leading Menlo Park-based private equity firm focused on the software, data, and analytics sectors acquired it. The brand “Trellix” was launched in January 2022.
The name “Trellix” is coined from the word trellis, a strong and safe framework to support growth of climbing plants and trees. Just like how we support our customers growth through living security. Always learning. Always adapting.

The Channel Operations Manager will be responsible for building and driving elements to support the relationship with channel partners and system integrators.

About the Role:
Plan, define and execute channel strategy aligning with the overall organization strategy.
Define, develop, and establish new channel programs with clear goals, objectives, metrics, and governance that enable immediate business operation needs as well as support long-term priorities required for partner/distribution route to market
Work closely with global partner enablement, and other cross-functional stakeholders to build and implement programs focused on Trellix partner ecosystem growth
Increase partner investments in Trellix’ s technologies, solutions, skills, marketing, and go-to-market programs
Ensure the partners have both sales and technical capability to successfully sell and promote Trellix’ s offerings
Execute a country level well-structured enablement plan for Distributors and growth/strategic partners in the region
Drive the Partner Prime series – a strategic initiative to drive key actions around the channel enablement, marketing, executive alignment, and program adoption metrics
Promote executive engagement on an ongoing basis to ensure key strategies for increasing Trellix’ s footprint in partner customer accounts
Maintain and manage the key performance indicators (KPIs) for distribution & partner route by country and overall APAC region
Lead the annual VOP initiative - Identify and analyze partner experience patterns to acts as a voice of partner (VOPs) to directionally inform relevant business groups. Leverage partner's feedback to provide input on business plans developed by the country channel team.
Maintain practice memberships (communities of practices)
Provide leadership and guidance to promote integration, collaboration, and alignment between global enablement teams and APAC; facilitate excellent communication and community development
Own partner utilization of Market Development Funds (MDF) and enable appropriate spend of MDF on marketing initiatives by being an SME on process, guidelines, and options for partners
Creating operational efficiency and agility through continuous improvement
Engage with the region partner and field marketing manager and senior sales and channel sales leadership in the region to define, prioritize, and implement marketing programs and campaigns with the local partners and alliances ecosystem, taking full account of partners’ operations and delivery model for their business users
Pro-actively address and simplify complex processes working closely with the various cross functional teams and stakeholders
About You:
A strong understanding of the Channel ecosystem.
At least 10-12 years of experience with designing partner programs, channel enablement and business intelligence
Good understanding of Trellix technology products and the ability to advocate enablement path for channel partners
Excellent communication and negotiation skills with the ability to identify customer and partner needs and to overcome challenges;
Ability to work in fast-paced environment.
Highly detailed and process oriented, strategic thinking, problem solving skills.
Company Benefits and Perks:
We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
Paid Time Off

Support for Community Involvement
We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why we prohibit discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

title: Manager, Business Operations Management
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The School of Biological Sciences (SBS) is a school of the College of Science. It was established in 2002 with the mission to make a strong contribution to biological and biomedical sciences. SBS is a unique research-intensive school, focused on delivering excellence in various and diverse areas of biological sciences. Research areas at SBS include infectious diseases, immunology, neurodegenerative diseases and telomere biology and genome function. SBS links new insights from the life sciences with expertise from emerging technologies in engineering and natural sciences to understand the basis of life processes, and to develop potential solutions to a wide variety of life science-based problems. Since then, many talented individuals from around the world and Singapore have joined SBS as scientific leaders, and researchers.
SBS is looking for a highly motivated and experienced business operations management manager to assist the School and the School Chair in pursuing its ambitions to develop collaborations locally and internationally, develop new programmes, explore philanthropic opportunities and develop and implement guidelines, in support of achieving its strategic goals. The successful appointee will also be involved in coordinating and supporting all research-related administration and policies, develop, implement, review and monitor strategic activities and serve as liaison between SBS and external parties.
Responsibilities
Support new programmes and initiatives to achieve School’s strategic goals
Scan for new opportunities in the life sciences industry to bring projects to market
Host events and/ or networking sessions for engagement with external key stakeholders, government agencies and potential industry partners
Plan programme budgets and monitor utilization of approved budgets
Ensure action plans are followed up and executed by designated parties and are on track
Handle, review, monitor service agreements, NDAs with overseas collaborators
Point of contact for external and overseas visitors to the School
Prepare various reports, documents and correspondences for meetings and external stakeholders
Prepare and deliver presentations when necessary
Provide research administration support to the Chair
Provide secretariat support for meetings as assigned by School Chair
Liaise with SBS Corporate Services and NTU LSO on legal/ contractual matters
Provide guidance and coaching to secretary to ensure that the Chair’s Office is operating efficiently, effectively and seamlessly
Identify opportunities for process improvement within the Chair’s Office and implement changes to enhance efficiency and productivity
Requirements
M.Sc or PhD in Biomedical/Life Sciences (or a related area) from an internationally recognized institution
Biomedical knowledge
Familiarity with local and international grant agencies, research and collaboration policies and scientific administration
At least 10 years as a biomedical research scientist with experience in laboratory/department management
Project/ programme management experience, experience in an institute of higher learning or research institution environment will be preferred
Business development experience with industry, agencies, and international partners will be advantageous
Experience in research administration and scientific publishing will be advantageous
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work independently and also a team player
Able to manage multiple tasks effectively and produce quality work under time pressure
Meticulous and possesses excellent organizational skills to plan and execute
Proficient in MS Office applications and familiarity with virtual platforms (eg. ZOOM, Teams)
Ability to develop policies/guidelines and collaborative arrangements with external institutions
Sociable, able to initiate and follow through, engage and maintain relationship with all stakeholders, strong ownership, has integrity, pro-active
The School of Biological Sciences seeks a diverse and inclusive workforce and is committed to equality of opportunity. We welcome applications from all and recruit on the basis of merit, regardless of age, race, gender, religion, marital status and family responsibilities, or disability.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Create, formulate, oversee, and execute local operational strategies and guidance for freight forwarding teams covering all aspects of importing, exporting, and cross-trade shipments.
Establish and oversee key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure efficient operational performance.
Ensure adherence to all relevant laws and approved best practices.
Cultivate strong client relationships at a senior level and take responsibility for delivering customized end-to-end solutions to secure profitable business.
Sustain existing customer connections.
Prepare and present comprehensive responses to bids and tenders, with a focus on meeting customer needs and leveraging the brand and competitive advantages.
Foster a company-wide culture of continuous improvement in quality, compliance, safety, technical expertise, and security.
Actively promote the company through industry events, marketing initiatives, customer development opportunities, international travel, and more.
Maintain up-to-date market insights and competitor information.
Requirements:
A minimum of six years of experience in Operations Management within the Freight Forwarding and Shipping industry, with a preference for substantial involvement in Project Forwarding for major industrial construction projects in sectors such as Oil, Gas, Petrochemical, and Mining.
Proficiency in managing freight across multiple modes of transportation, coupled with a strong ability to negotiate favorable pricing and terms.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Summary:
As an KTLO Ops Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and leading the technical support team, ensuring the smooth operation of critical applications. Your extensive experience will be pivotal in guiding the team, troubleshooting complex issues, and maintaining high service standards.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead and mentor a team of Application Support Engineers, providing guidance and support.
Ensure timely and efficient resolution of escalated incidents and client inquiries.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including development, to address technical issues.
Investigate and analyze application logs and data to identify root causes of complex issues.
Oversee routine maintenance, application updates, and continuous improvement efforts.
Develop and maintain documentation of support processes, procedures, and best practices.
Manage on-call support rotations to provide 24/7 coverage for critical issues.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define service level agreements (SLAs) and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Continuously monitor and optimize application performance and availability.
Foster a culture of excellence, professionalism, and continuous learning within the support team.
Requirement:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
7 to 10 years of experience in a technical support role, with a focus on application support.
Proven leadership experience, including mentoring and managing technical teams.
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex issues.
Familiarity with application monitoring and diagnostic tools.
Experience working with database systems (SQL, NoSQL) and knowledge of SQL queries.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, for effective client interaction.
Ability to work collaboratively within a team and interact effectively with stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Flexibility to participate in on-call support rotations
Interested candidates can forward their CVs in MS Word format to alex@triton-ai.com

title: Operations Excellence Manager
company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
REC Group is an international pioneering solar energy company dedicated to empowering consumers with clean, affordable solar power through high-quality solar panels with a leading power density. As Solar’s Most Trusted, REC is known for its patented innovations and multiple award-winning products with reliable long-term performance. The cornerstone for REC’s strong reliability is advanced and highly efficient manufacturing using Industry 4.0 practices. Founded in 1996 in Norway, REC has always been committed to a low carbon footprint in its solar materials and panels. REC is headquartered in Norway with operational headquarters in Singapore and regional hubs in North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. As of December 2021, REC is part of Reliance Industries Limited, India’s largest private sector company with revenues of USD 104.6 billion.
Find out more at recgroup.com
RESPONSIBILITIES
We are looking for an experienced, highly motivated, hands-on leader for the role of Manager, Operations Excellence.This role will be leading a group of high-level individual contributors with accountability for the operations excellence initiatives for the operations division.
The main tasks will be to engage and influence senior management, managers and other exempt/non-exempt staff on RBS, deploy/implement RBS principles, systems, tools and techniques to drive Operational Excellence / Continuous Improvement, across all levels in the organization. Lead, coach and facilitate improvement teams on problem solving. You will be a change agent to spread RBS, Lean, Six Sigma and systematic problem-solving culture.
The successful candidate will also be deployed on short to mid-term stints in our expansion projects overseas. As a Lean Six Sigma expert, this individual will coordinate the planning of workstream activities related to production workflows and 4M considerations of the new factories.
He/she will also organize and plan resources to develop, coach team members for the next level competencies and job responsibilities for succession planning.
Operations Strategy
Understanding of market forces in this highly dynamic industry using the outside-in approach and provide the next 2-3 years business roadmap to drive the organization.
Engage in constant communication with the Technical Sales, Supply Chain, Finance, Procurement and R&D for all Business Plans, Cost Scenario studies based on event triggers in the PV industry or socio-political factors .
Ability to provide and evaluate modeling options that enable an optimal cost of operation and balanced scorecard for key indices.
Provide business case support to Corporate Strategy and Finance groups by analyzing CapEx and OpEx spending and gains analysis through total cost of ownership (TCO), Return of Investment (ROI) payback and Net Present Value (NPV).
Product Mix optimization for various Capacity and Capital Expenditure Scenarios.
Operations Excellence and REC Business Systems (RBS)
Drive RBS culture building, systems development and implementation in overall Operations through trainings and leading/coaching improvements projects and workshops.
Lead / Coach / Facilitate Improvement Projects - Drive factory initiatives to identify, implement and maintain sustainable improvements in Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost and Productivity.
Drive a sustainable Cost Reduction Program through the Annual Manufacturing Analysis Workshop
Organize, influence and align operations, plant leaders in the Annual Strategic Goals Workshop to outline the workplan for the financial work year.
Drive the RBS 4M programs - ICCM (In Control, Capable and Maintain), TPM (Total Productive Maintenance), SFM (Shop Floor Management), MMS (Material Management System) programs and initiatives with relevant organization stakeholders. This will be done through training, coaching and working with the functional operations team.
Drive Value Stream Mapping and improvements. Lead VSM and implement business impactful initiatives to improve organization key value streams.
Be a great change agent and drive changes/improvements to successful completion
QUALIFICATIONS
PhD / Masters / Degree Holders in Engineering or related fields of work
10 years relevant working experience in Management in an operational manufacturing industry
Proven track records in successfully leading a team in achieving significant results for the organization
Strong communication skills 
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - REC Group

title: KTLO Service Operations Manager / Governance (L2 Application Support)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Summary:
This role manages the team to develop, establish, and maintain project deliverables, as well as provides technical support for application-related issues, monitors related daily service health monitoring, server maintenance, and resiliency improvements.

You are responsible for ensuring project deliverables are met, as well as delivering new and improved capabilities in systems monitoring, recovery, and stability aspects of the system.


Key Responsibilities:
· Lead a team of application analysts to review and track application tasks for more than 600 applications.
· Work with the governance team to produce performance metrics and dashboards to provide operation performance updates.
· Conduct regular review of operation performance analysis and follow up on non-compliance items.
· Update to institution CIOO (CIO Office) on periodic progress status and highlight issues.
· Liaise with relevant internal teams to work on initiatives to improve the governance-related process and platforms.
· Provide regular reports of the operation governance progress and update to senior leadership.
· Collect and provide feedback on areas of improvement and optimization in application operation process and governance.
· Engage regularly with application leads to highlight operation process issues and work collaboratively to resolve them.
· Maintain good rapport with application leads and HOD to gain their support and cooperation in application governance.


Qualifications:
· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
· Minimum 7 years’ experience in IT project management and operations.
· Experience in enterprise application support and maintenance, audit, performance monitoring, software security, application resiliency, and application compliance.
· Possess political savviness when engaging the application teams and institution CIOO.
· Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
· Resourceful and capable of working with application teams and cross-functional teams to identify root causes of issues.
· Able to drive Application Leads and their teams to complete the activities timely.
· Comfortable in escalating up to through the application of the command chain.
· Ability to present key updates to senior stakeholders and management.
· Proficient at the advanced level of MS Excel and MS SharePoint.

title: Operation Engineer
company: ASAHI KASEI SYNTHETIC RUBBER SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
company_info: Asahi Kasei Synthetic Rubber Singapore Pte. Ltd., a 100% subsidiary of Asahi Kasei Corporation (Japan), produces synthetic rubber called S-SBR in Jurong Island, Singapore. S-SBR is a key material to improve performance of automobile tires (e.g., safety, fuel efficiency, durability). Asahi Kasei is expanding the S-SBR business through this Singapore entity as one of its core businesses.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Safety and environment management
a) Review abnormality report, non-conforming product report, accident/ incident report, support investigation and propose corrective and preventive measures
b) Planning for operational Non-regular work, provide work instruction and training to Supervisor and technicians via toolbox meeting
c) Support regulatory requirement such as water efficiency management plan, energy conservation act and Workplace safety and health act (Major hazard installation regulation
Operation Support
a) Setup and maintain operating conditions, guides, check sheets and logs sheets in collaboration with shift teams to ensure environment, health, safety, quality and productivity requirements are met
b) Administration control and monitoring of DCS system, to ensure changes to DCS / SIS sequence and settings are properly documented. Alarm optimized to prevent nuisance alarm.
c) Trouble shooting of production process and quality problem
d) Lead and support ASDM work, assigned by superior, including planning and certain work Instructions making to include various phases including push back, purge, LOTO, leak test, N2 replacement, flushing, filling and commissioning
Process Improvement
a) Responsible for process optimization and capacity improvement projects in the plant
b) Lead the operational MOC and ensure action plan related to the change has been implemented
c) Implement cost reduction measures or projects to reduce the cost of production
d) In close cooperation with technical department members, support and implement new product / process plant trials.
e) Prepare monthly Production Uptime report. Perform analysis and come out with improvement solution. If needed, work with Technical division (and its relevant department) to reduce the equipment downtime.
Capital expense project (Capex management)
a) Follow up of assigned capital expense project and related documentations including non-regular work, capex form, MOC form and risk assessment checksheet and obtain necessary approval
b) Carry out preliminary process design and identify potential hazards / risk
c) Liaise with Vendors for preliminary quotes, specification and drawings of the capital jobs
d) Control the budget allocation and schedule for the capex project
e) Coordinator for project execution as the key contact between contractor and plant group (Shift team, maintenance department, QC department, EHS department)
f) Ensure completion of project including documentation update such as updating process safety information
Additional reference of OE duty & responsibility in compare with Process Engineer
a) Identify and develop area of improvements (including production rate) to effectively utilize equipment, materials, and manpower to maximize production without compromising EHS and quality.
b) Evaluate current production activities and make recommendations for EHSQ and efficiency improvements. (Note: common job scope for Sr. Day Supervisor/SDS too)
c) Provide engineering support for production, maintenance, and other improvement activities to ensure maximum production, improve EHSQ and cost savings and other efficiency.
d) Ensure shift teams are following the existing process control parameters. (Note: New process control parameters is established by Process Engineers or new installation PIC)
e) Liaising with SDS on process control suggestion for improvement and work with engineers in other department to make necessary adjustment on the existing process control parameters. E.g. interlock pressure setting etc. Changes on the existing process control parameter is to follow AKSS’s MOC/NRW procedure.
f) Determine which machines, equipment, etc. will be used and where they will be stationed in the facility. If necessary, collaborate with Technical division (and/or its relevant department) to ensure the right machine/equipment is being procure & use.
g) Diagnose origin of operational breakdowns, including human factor. Troubleshoot the problems with relevant department(s) and implement resolution plan that assigned to him/her.
h) Keeping abreast of advancements in engineering and production and sharing knowledge with co-workers.
i) Identify unsafe operations and practices and report the same to Manager immediately.
j) Assists Assistant Operation Manager and/or Production Manager in budget preparation and monitor expenses and profitability.
k) Follow and adhere to all state, federal and company enforced EHSQ rules and regulations.
l) Collaborate with engineers from other department(s) on daily and/or per needs basis to achieve safe and stable operation and produce high quality products. E.g., during NRW period, improvement projects implementation, commissioning, etc.
m) Develop operational strategies to achieve production and financial objectives.
n) Establish new operating procedure/Work Instruction/Check Sheet and risk assessment for production activities. (Note: SDS- to review and update existing procedure/check sheets/RA, also to develop simple new procedure/check sheet/RA)
o) Develop operational best practices to improve production capacity, quality, and reliability.
Requirements
· Degree in Chemical / Mechanical engineering or its equivalent
· Minimum 2-year experience as operation engineer in a chemical processing plant
· Good knowledge of chemical engineering, mechanical engineering and / or polymer science
· Experience in a process safety management, quantitative risk assessment such as LOPA (layer of protection analysis) or safety case preparation will be advantageous
· SCEM, or Steam engineer/ boiler attendant certificate, preferable
· Working knowledge in ISO9001, ISO14001, SS506-Part 3, cost control and regulations
· Highly motivated, energetic individual, with inquiring mind set and willingness to take up new challenges
· Good interpersonal and communication skills

title: Management Trainee (Operations)
company_info: SK CATERING PTE. LTD. Join one of Singapore’s most prominent caterers in our Event Sales Team and be in the forefront of Singapore’s MICE and F&B Industry! Creative Eateries Catering has successfully executed numerous high profile events such as: Beerfest Asia ▪ Formula 1 ▪ Singapore Airshow ▪ Singapore Biennale ▪ APEC Summit Singapore ▪ Communicasia Exhibitions
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This position is responsible for assisting in the planning and direction of the workers and resources of the restaurant for the efficient, well-prepared, and profitable service of food and beverages.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Assisting the Restaurant Manager in working with chefs and other personnel to plan menus in line with the brand’s culinary direction. Work with chefs for efficient provisioning and purchasing of supplies. Estimate food and beverage costs.
• Supervise portion control and quantities of preparation to minimize waste. Perform frequent checks to ensure consistent high-quality preparation and service.
• Work with other management personnel to plan marketing, advertising, and any special restaurant functions.
• Direct hiring, training, and scheduling of food service personnel.
• Investigate and resolve complaints concerning food quality and service.
• Assist in dishwashing duties
• Perform other duties as assigned by management.

REQUIREMENTS
• Min Diploma or equivalent with relevant experience
• Strong communication, interpersonal, and management skills
• Passionate about providing excellent management and interpersonal skills
• Able to work independently and in a team
• Able to communicate in English and 1 other language
• Excellent vision required for seating guests, expediting food, cleaning equipment, and reading floor plans, charts, and schedules.
• Self-discipline and self-motivated and enjoys interacting with people and serving customers.
• Always maintain a high standard of personal hygiene with a clean appearance and neatly attired.
• Pleasant, Polite manner, Energetic, cheerful, and hardworking. Possess enthusiasm for learning and keen to get feedback for improvement.
• Ability to engage in physical activities which require long hours of standing during the working shift.
• Require to work on a rotating shift basis which includes weekends and public holidays.

title: Operations Director (Warehouse)
company_info: No information added.
job_category: General Management, Logistics / Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Purchasing / Merchandising
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are a MAISON, the first collaborative creative perfumery house for the luxury-lifestyle generation, who want to stand out from everyday scents with sustainable haute couture natural ingredients. We believe each one of us deserve to create their own unique scent through experiences within its beautiful and luxurious boutiques as well as online, allowing tailor-made creations for all with an astounding quality at its core.

We are seeking a seasoned and results-driven Operations Director to lead and optimize our end-to-end operations in the warehouse. As a pivotal member of our executive team, you will play a crucial role in shaping the future of Maison 21G. This role is ideal for a proactive and strategic leader who can drive operational excellence in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.

Main Responsibilities:
Operational Strategy: Develop and execute the company's operations strategy, aligning it with overall business goals and objectives.
Manufacturing Excellence: Oversee and enhance the manufacturing process, ensuring quality control, efficiency, and scalability while driving cost-effectiveness.
Supply Chain Management: Manage the end-to-end supply chain, including sourcing, procurement, inventory management, and distribution to support omnichannel retail operations.
Team Leadership: Build and lead a high-performing operations team, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
Process Optimization: Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement lean methodologies to streamline operations and reduce waste.
Quality Assurance: Implement and maintain quality control systems to ensure the delivery of consistently high-quality products to customers.
Inventory Management: Develop strategies to optimize inventory levels, minimize stockouts, and reduce excess inventory, while ensuring accurate demand forecasting.
Cost Management: Drive cost reduction initiatives while maintaining product quality, seeking efficiencies in manufacturing and logistics.
Compliance: Ensure compliance with industry regulations and standards related to manufacturing, safety, and product quality.
Vendor and Partner Management: Manage relationships with suppliers, vendors, and third-party partners to ensure on-time delivery, quality, and cost-effectiveness.
Technology Integration: Identify and implement technology solutions to improve operational efficiency, including ERP systems, automation, and data analytics.
Risk Management: Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies to protect the company's operations and assets.
Reporting and Analytics: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and reporting mechanisms to monitor and evaluate operational performance.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in operations management, Supply Chain, Business, Warehouse Management, or a related field
Proven experience (10+ years) in operations leadership roles within a retail or manufacturing industry
Experience in a startup or high-growth and fast-paced environment is a strong plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated ability to build and manage high-performing teams.
Knowledge of best practices in manufacturing, supply chain management, and inventory control.
Familiarity with relevant industry regulations and standards.
Proficiency in using technology and data analytics to drive operational improvements.
Strategic thinking and the ability to align operational goals with overall business objectives.

title: Senior Operations Executive (Facilities)
company_info: QUESS SELECTION & SERVICES PTE. LTD fka Comtelpro Pte Ltd (EA Licence Number: 17S8727) Employment Agency (excluding maid agency), General (Non IT) staffing
job_category: Building and Construction, Real Estate / Property Management, Repair and Maintenance
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This role will report to and assist the Operations Manager to ensure that facilities and equipment within the property are maintained in good operating conditions at all times and be part of the CERT and WSH Risk Management committee.

You will be required to:
Work with a team of technicians, outsourced housekeepers & security personnel to oversee daily building operations, including carrying out inspections to check on defects, plan and implement of building preventive & corrective maintenance and carpark management.
Attend to feedback, incident or emergency crisis in the building and manage tenant relations including coordination and organising of tenant engagement activities.
Liaise and co-ordinate with contractors / vendors to ensure timely service in accordance with contractual requirements
Track and ensure timely implementation and renewal of term contracts and statutory licenses
Investigate and follow up on building defects, general repairs & maintenance and procurement works including sourcing quotations/tenders, raising POs, issue award letters and contract agreement among others
Handle tenancy handover/takeover, manage fitting-out works in accordance with the house rules, authorities requirements and SOPs
Plan and execute assigned CAPEX works, collate and maintain all utilities and data of the properties;
Assist with compilation and preparation of monthly management report & slides.
Manage and update varioussystems, including the tenant portal, access control, and PTW (Permit to Work)submission.
Requirements:
Minimum Diploma preferably in Building Management, Facilities Management, Engineering or equivalent and at least 3 years of relevant experience in commercial buildings.
Good communication and interpersonal skills (both written & spoken) and with experience in tenant management in retail malls/commercial buildings
Independent, resourceful, meticulous, result-oriented, positive attitude and a team player who is able to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Proficient in MS Office including word, excel, powerpoint. Those who are familiar with SAP will have an added advantage.
EA Licence Number: 17S8727
Registration ID: R1110099

title: Senior Retail Operations Executive
company_info: SJ 1 is a pioneer in integrating Traditional Chinese Medicine with modern spa treatments and beauty aesthetics services to deliver personalised treatments that match each individual’s body constitution, and lifestyle to bring about a sense of balance and total wellness.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Day to Day Operations
· Streamline the operations processes and improve efficiency and customer service standards.
· Ensure the company’s policies and standards are communicated and implemented.
· Oversee and assist in team members day to day task to ensure smooth operation.
· Ensure all outlets maintain outstanding store condition and visual merchandising standards.
· Work alongside our team members in-stores frequently to assist and to drive sales and improve operations
Stock/Inventory Management
· Control and manage inventory and transfers across all locations effectively
· Oversee stock-take exercises at all locations.
· Manage and execute all scheduled inventory counts in a timely manner
· Investigate any inventory discrepancies and reconcile all inventory reports and highlight all issues for management
· Ensure that the stock level at all locations is within the acceptable thresholds and work closely with the buying team on stock management.
Leadership
· Drive, inspire, motivate, manage and lead the team to achieve the company’s objectives by meeting sales target with an outstanding customer service and excellent operations management.
· Work with the team on personal development and onboarding training
· Provide consistent and effective feedback and performance counselling to coach each team member, ensuring that each team member grows professionally and develops outstanding sales and customer service to meet their personal sales target.
· Review and monitor individual performance in line with the company’s objectives.
· Deal with all issues that arise from team members’ (complaints, grievances, etc) and handle team members’ disciplinary issues
· Improve employee turnover and absenteeism
· Maintain staff discipline.
· Manpower training and recruitment.
· Provide leadership across all our locations and improve team spirit.
· Work closely with Ops/Sales manager to manage staff roster and manpower planning by ensuring smooth operations and cost-efficiency.
Customer Engagement
· Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction through outstanding customer service.
· Offer exemplary product knowledge to assist customers with their buying decisions.
· Develop customer service SOP and monitor compliance with a view of preventing and minimising customer complaints and better service recovery.
· Facilitate training to retail staff to ensure outstanding customer service standards
Job Requirements:
· Possess at least a Diploma in any field or any other relevant qualifications in retail studies with at least 5 years of experience in retail management, with at least 1 years of managerial experience.
· Possess strong analytical and leadership skills with good business acumen.
· Good in excel spreadsheet is a plus.
· Independent and able to work in a fast-paced environment
· Strong interest in retail operations and a passion to drive the brand forward
· Strong customer management and organizational skills.
· Foster, build and maintain relationships with stakeholders.
· Self-disciplined, driven and motivated.
· Adaptable to changes.
· Able to lead, motivate, and coach a team.
· Inventory Management and Loss Prevention

Our client is an established and very stable organization. They have their own office building in town.

Manager - Facilities, Operations & Hospitality
The Manager – Facilities, Operations and Hospitality will do the planning, development and management of the facilities/support services and hospitality assets of my client’s HQ building owned by them.

Manage licenses, renewal, repair and replacement projects;
Develop and manage contracts for services which are outsourced, against financial performance and outcome targets including but not limited to cleaning, security and parking;

Develop and monitor key performance indicators facilities maintenance works, and manage performance towards targets and benchmarks; and
Manage efficient use of resources (i.e., equipment, time, physical assets, supplies, etc.) within the building.

Establish and develop strategies, goals and action plans for development of hospitality offerings;
Oversee and administration of event spaces – multi-purposes hall, conferences and activity rooms, catering and F&B assets;

Perform other duties as assigned by the Management.

This position is responsible for the planning, setting of the direction of the crew, and resource distribution of the restaurant to achieve an efficient, well-prepared, and profitable food and beverages restaurant.

• Assisting the Operations Manager to work with chefs and other personnel to plan menus that are flavorful and popular with customers.

• Strong communication, interpersonal, and management skills

company_info: YCH Group is one of Asia's leading supply chain and logistics conglomerates and partners some of the world’s largest companies and brands in more than 100 cities across Asia Pacific. As a renowned 7PLᴛᴍ supply chain and logistics provider, our team of supply chain specialists, logisticians, technology disruptors, planners and other specialists, work together to achieve the common goal to be the partner of choice for integrated end-to-end supply chain management. We deploy award winning supply chain solutions to serve multisector clients. YCH values employees and advocate lifelong learning for employees to develop their career. As part our YCH’s LEARNTM ecosystem, talent enablement, learning and innovation have always been a huge part of our DNA. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Detailed Job Responsibilities
Lead, manage and motivate with cross discipline team members to make sure that all parties are aligned to project requirements/scopes, schedules and costs
Build and sustain effective communication with other roles involved in the project
Project scope management: develops and maintains project documentation which includes creating project business case, project schedule and issue list, establishing role & responsibility and key tasks / milestones
Identify and mitigate risks and issues arising in project and timely escalations throughout project life cycle
Write business requirements documents for projects/enhancements/ continuous improvements
Map AS-IS and TO-BE processes, design new business processes and re-engineer existing business processes and define operational process metrics.
Responsible for super user/ end user acceptance testing, including executing some test scripts and overseeing and execution of process training
Manage change requests to ensure all parties are informed of the impacts on schedule and budget
Conduct pre-and post-implementation audits
Manage customer satisfaction within the project period
Ensure a seamless handover of successfully implemented project to operations team
Document lessons learned at the end of project cycle
Perform other job-related functions as assigned
Requirements
· A bachelor Degree in a related discipline (preferably engineering)
· Proven track record in project management, data analysis skills
· Strong understanding of formal project management methodologies
· Experience as an operation manager in warehousing/ eCom ops experience
· Able to multi-task and work under pressure and tight schedule effectively and independently
· Proficient in MS Office Suite
· 5 years experience in a supply chain project implementation
· Travel requirement: 30 – 50%

Salary shall commensurate with relevant experience.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Following the success of this humble eatery, Da Paolo expanded into Da Paolo Group, comprising two restaurants, eight Gastronomia outlets, a catering arm and a professional services arm. Responsibilities:
