Lead by example in providing exceptional customer service, ensuring that guests have a memorable dining experience.
Handle customer inquiries, concerns, and feedback professionally and effectively.
Resolve any service-related issues promptly and to the satisfaction of the guest.
Menu and Beverage Management:
Collaborate with the executive chef and sommelier to develop and maintain a high-quality food and beverage menu.
Ensure menu items are presented and served according to established standards.
Manage inventory, order supplies, and monitor food and beverage costs.
Financial Management:
Develop and manage the restaurant's budget, including revenue and expense forecasting.
Monitor financial performance, identify cost-saving opportunities, and maximize profitability.
Maintain accurate records of sales, expenses, and inventory.
Reservation and Event Management:
Oversee the reservation system and ensure proper handling of special requests and events.
Coordinate and execute private dining events, parties, and promotions.
Compliance and Licensing:
Ensure compliance with all relevant local, state, and federal regulations, including food safety and alcohol licensing.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, regulations, and best practices.
Marketing and Promotion:
Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute marketing and promotional initiatives.
Build and maintain relationships with local food critics, influencers, and media outlets.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management or related field (preferred).
Proven track record in Italian fine/ semi-fine dining
Minimum Sommelier level 2
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Exceptional customer service skills and a passion for creating memorable dining experiences.
Knowledge of fine dining etiquette, wine service, and culinary trends.
Financial acumen with the ability to manage budgets and control costs.
Proficiency in restaurant management software and Google Suite.
Food safety and alcohol service certifications (e.g., FSC Level 3) are required.
Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.

title: Assistant Manager, IT
company_info: ISS INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL PTE. LTD. International School Singapore (ISS) is an authorised International Baccalaureate (IB) World School for students from more than 50 countries. Catering to students from Kindergarten to Grade 12, ISS provides the full IB curriculum (Primary Years, Middle Years and the Diploma Program).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Summary:
The Assistant IT Manager reports to the Director, Finance and Operation and assumes the critical role of being the gatekeeper for company data security measures and the linchpin for ensuring unwavering stability in the digital infrastructure. Responsible for overseeing day-to-day IT operations and support functions, this role involves managing helpdesk operations, evaluating technology needs, proposing upgrades, implementing IT policies, providing technical support, and vigilantly upholding data security measures.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:
Supervise and support the helpdesk operations, ensuring timely and effective resolution of technical issues.
Collaborate with users and departments to gather resource requirements, proposing and implementing upgrades and solutions to enhance the IT infrastructure.
Evaluate the school's technology usage, computing needs, and system requirements. Recommend enhancements to hardware, software, and infrastructure.
Assist in the development, implementation, and documentation of new IT policies and processes.
Contribute to the preparation of laptops for new staff, teachers, and students. Perform software installations as required.
Provide technical assistance to administrative and academic staff, resolving hardware and software-related issues.
Administer, maintain, and oversee Google accounts for staff, teachers, and students. Ensure the integrity and accuracy of the directory information.
Offer vigilant technical support for the school's network infrastructure, ensuring seamless connectivity.
Log and manage support requests/incidents through email and logging systems.
Provide reliable assistance for IP phone systems, ensuring uninterrupted communication and system stability.
Participate in testing new hardware and software, focusing on security, stability, and recommending enhancements.
Proactively monitor network traffic, remote and local server status, bandwidth allocation, and perform regular backups to ensure stability and data security.
Perform initial troubleshooting of server and network issues, ensuring rapid problem resolution.
Coordinate and supervise the installation of IT equipment when required.
Maintain accurate records of all IT assets. Ensure alignment with Finance's asset list.
Request and evaluate quotations from vendors for IT-related purchases.
Provide standby technical support during examinations to ensure smooth IT operations.
Manage, supervise, and train new IT staff, fostering a culture of stability, security and high performance standards.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Supervisor.
Requirements
Diploma in Information Technology or Computer Science.
Proficient understanding of Google Workspace and Microsoft Office.
Familiarity with various devices including Chromebooks, Macbooks, iMacs, Apple TV, and Chromecast.
Basic diagnostic and troubleshooting skills for technical issues.
Ability to support PCs, printers, projectors, and IT peripherals setup and maintenance.
Knowledge of Firewall, DNS, DHCP, NTP, SMTP, FTP, Anti-Virus, and system monitoring setup and management.
Familiarity with Wintel Servers and virtualization technologies (advantageous).
Strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative team player.
Excellent communication skills for effective interaction within the team.
Meticulous attention to detail and focus on tasks.

title: Assistant Store Manager
company: SINGAPORE STRAITS WINE COMPANY PTE. LTD.
company_info: The Straits Wine Company was established in 2006 with a singular focus: to celebrate the art of wine with discerning drinkers across Asia. Today, we are a leading wine importer, retailer, and distributor with a presence in Singapore and Malaysia. The Straits Wine Company is an advocate for quality and artisanal wine producers located around the world, with a focus on sourcing well-crafted wines produced by passionate and progressive winemakers. Through the years, The Straits Wine Company has grown to become a trusted partner and collaborator of Michelin-starred restaurants, innovative hospitality groups, and luxury hotels – known for our wine expertise and exceptional service alike. Our 7 venues located across Singapore, together with our vibrant and evolving e-commerce platform, have perennially served as favourite discovery touchpoints for discerning wine lovers across the island.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Title - Assistant Store Manager

Job Role Description
The Assistant Store Manager oversees the operations of store in assigned area. Together with the Retail Operation Manager, Area Manager and Store Managers, he/she is responsible for managing the area's operational and service excellence plans with the end objective of optimization to achieve set sales targets. He/she will also action on any sales campaigns and customer sales leads. In additional, he/she will oversee the fulfillment of the area’s sales orders to ensure seamless customer experience across all in-store level channels.

This job responsibilities shall include but not be limited to:

Job description
Work closely with HQ teams and Stakeholders.
Maintain smooth operations & standard of work.
Collaborate & provide feedback to Management.
Ensure both food hygiene standards and work safety are met.
Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations and licensing requirements pertaining to the sale and promotion of alcoholic beverages, copy of latest licenses are put up in-store and stay updated on industry regulations.
Working with retail team to execute planned sales activates for the assigned stores.
Share knowledge across training.
Monitor and manage financial aspects.
Monitor SOH by store, inventory movements and ensuring adequate levels of stock and in-demand skus to be represented in all stores represented in assigned area.
Manage and maintain the SOH inventory, financial or other assets of property of the company to reduce & eliminate any losses or wastage.
Ensuring shelves, displays and wine racks are regularly dusted, organized and visually appealing with proper labeling.
Create visually appealing wine displays, highlighting featured wines, promotions and tasting notes.
Perform check of the store’s cleanliness, count and reconcile cash register, review, and update any necessary reports or documentation.
Upsell, cross-sell related products and inform & promote in-house promotions, members program and upcoming events to customer.
Ensure quality customer service experience is provided across the stores, enquiries are handled quickly and effectively.
Assist the team and address customer issues efficiently.
Setting a positive example, demonstrating integrity, and inspiring your team members to perform at their best.
Offer guidance, support and knowledge sharing to team members by conducting regular check-ins with your team members to assess customer service performance, provide feedback, and address any challenges they may be facing.
Enhance communication skills and create a positive and productive communication environment within the team, leading to better understanding, collaboration, and overall success in the store.
Any other operational duties assigned by Management.

Requirements:
- Prior 3 experience in wine sales is preferred or experience in F&B and/or wine bar.
- Passion in wines
- WSET certified & food and hygiene certificate will be an added advantage.
- Well organized and good team player

Benefits:
- Professional development
- Health Insurance
- Medical benefit
- Staff Discount
- Staff Training
- Sales Commission
- Performance bonus

title: Assistant General Manager
company_info: An old colonial chapel rests atop Dempsey Hill, a charming abode tucked between the folds of a lively city. Through careful preservation, it still radiates with the gaiety of gatherings and a feeling of home. Adorned with delicate foliage, Claudine is an homage to yesterday and a toast to tomorrow; bienvenue à la maison!
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Assistant General Manager is a visible, energetic and ethical leader who develops, maintains and promotes a management philosophy that culminates in guest satisfaction and employee engagement, while consistently achieving annual and long-term financial and strategic plans.

Accountable for the restaurant’s business performance, the Assistant General Manager sets the overall goals in alignment with the strategic direction. This person will have an overall responsibility for the management of all operations of the restaurant and maintain high standards of excellence.

As a member of the restaurant’s management team, this person will actively represent the restaurant’s mission and values as appropriate at Board meetings and external events. At the helm of this restaurant, the role requires the individual to oversee every aspect of the venue, from its people to its daily service operations. Deep understanding and familiarity with the industry and business developmental needs is critical in ensuring the restaurant maintains its high level of service and food standards.


General Management
Overseeing operations, assisting the General Manager – managing restaurant standards and guest service.
Having strong wine knowledge will be an additional advantage
Developing and executing plans to achieve daily and monthly targets
Manage staff, overseeing work schedules and assigning specific duties
Create and improve standard operating procedures for service and product preparation
Oversee venue equipment and facilities management/maintenance
Conducts regular inspections on the general cleanliness and maintenance of venues and takes corrective action as and when necessary
Monitor venue adherence to all licensing laws regarding the service of food and beverage, public/employee safety, and food safety
Plan and manage activities with the Marketing department relating to sales promotions, events, etc
Review and analyze sales mix, inventory, and other performance data to measure productivity and goal achievement and to determine areas needing cost reduction and program improvement

Human Resource & Financial Management
Assist the General Manager in manpower planning and budgeting
In charge of overall Profit & Loss statement of the restaurant
Analyse POS reports and sales trends, recommend and implement cost control exercises, and improvements to onsite sales and marketing tools
Conceptualizing staff development plans according to the needs of the business
Determine staffing requirements, interview, hire and train new employees, or oversee the administrative proesses
Setting direction and expectations for the team to achieve team goals
Implementing training strategies for the venue
Monitors and liaises with the Human Resources team on all venue onsite training activities
Liaises with Human Resources regarding employee movements and performance feedback
Fully understanding, and ensuring procedural compliance with the Company’s policies


The ideal candidate should have/be:
At least 6 - 8 years of senior operations leadership experience in the hospitality industry, and holding overall operating budget (P&L) responsibility
Related field of study such as Hospitality or F&B Management would be advantageous
Prior experience in fine dining would be at an advantage
Strong knowledge in wine
An effective and energetic people leader with experience
Expertise in service excellence and business operations
Well-developed skill set and demonstrated professional track record in the areas of operations management, budgeting & financial analysis and cost-based management, strategic planning, internal & external customer relationship management, talent management, program and project management, leading monthly reports & meetings

title: F&B Outlet Manager
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Customer Service, Events / Promotions, F&B, Hospitality, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for an F&B Outlet Manager to lead all aspects of our businesses. You will deliver a high-quality menu and motivate our staff to provide excellent customer service.

As an F&B Outlet Manager, your responsibilities include maintaining the restaurant’s revenue, profitability, quality goals and staff deployment. You will ensure efficient restaurant operations and quality customer service standards.

To be successful in this role, you will need good management skills and experience in both front and back of the house. We want you to know how to oversee the dining room, check-in with customers and balance seating capacity. Back of the house management experience is also essential, as you will play an essential role as a hiring manager for your Outlet. You will need to be experience in overseeing food preparation and comply with health and safety restaurant regulations in F&B.

Ultimately, you have to ensure our restaurant runs smoothly and customers have a pleasant dining experience.

Job Responsibilities
To coordinate daily restaurant operations.
To oversee food and beverage services to customer’s satisfaction.
To respond efficiently to customer complaints.
To coordinate daily Front and Back of the House and operations.
To ensure consistent food and beverage product quality.
To optimize employee rostering.
To appraise staff performance and provide feedback to improve productivity.
To monitor future needs for goods, kitchen utensils and cleaning products.
To ensure compliance with SFA regulations.
To uphold good image of both the Company and the restaurant.
To control operational costs and identify measures towards sustainability.
To create sales reports on daily basis.
To facilitate events and promotions with Marketing strategies.
To come up with creative and innovative ideas to reach a larger target market.
To impart knowledge to new and current employees on proper F&B practices.
To implement good policies and protocols that will maintain future restaurant operations.
Any other tasks assigned by the Management and/or Operations Manager.
Requirements and skills
Prior experience as a Restaurant/ Outlet Manager/ Executive or similar experience preferably in establishments such as Toast Box, Killiney, Ya Kun Coffee and Toast.
Extensive food and beverage (F&B) knowledge, with ability to remember and recall ingredients and dishes to inform customers and wait staff.
Familiarity with restaurant management software, like OpenTable, PeachWorks and Raptor
Strong leadership, motivational and good people skills.
Please note that our establishments serve pork.

title: IT Programme Manager (Government Project)
company_info: Incorporated in 2004, ScienTec Consulting Pte Ltd has since redefined the standards of HR services by transforming organizations with its 4 principal services: Staffing, Specialist Search, HR Managed Services/Outsourcing and HR Consulting. ⭐Credential and industry awards by ScienTec include Recruitment Agency of the Year, Best Client Service, Best Candidate Experience, Specialist Recruitment, etc. By submitting your application or resume to us, you will be deemed to have agreed & consented to us collecting, using, retaining & disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration of your candidature. Please refer to ScienTec’s Privacy Policy (https://www.scientecconsulting.com/privacy-policy) for full details. If you wish to withdraw your consent, please write to us at dpo@scientecconsulting.com We request that you DO NOT provide sensitive personal data such as government identification numbers (e.g., NRIC number, passport number) or any other sensitive personal data that is not required during job application stage. Please note that such data may be deleted accordingly. All job applications will be processed with strict confidence and only shortlisted candidate will be contacted. ScienTec Consulting Pte Ltd 1 Maritime Square, #10-33A/B, Harbourfront Centre, Singapore 099253 Tel: +65 6225 3272 www.scientecconsulting.com
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
IT Programme Manager
Working Location: Central
Remuneration Package: Up to $8000 (basic) + AWS
We are seeking an experienced and motivated IT Program Manager to lead our IT projects, manage vendor relationships, drive change management initiatives, and promote the adoption of cutting-edge IT solutions within our organization.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead a team of project managers to manage IT application deliverables and services from project conceptualization, funding through to operations.
Manage the procurement of IT products & services and ensure alignment with procurement policies and the necessary approvals for procurement are obtained from the relevant approving authorities.
Manage vendor contracts to ensure IT services are planned and delivered on schedule, within budget, and meet business requirements.
Manage project deployment/rollout activities, drive change management, and adoption of products.
Engage agency higher management for the endorsement of the plans & change activities at agencies, interface with Change Management Team for the sharing & celebration of product adoption success at WOG level and at Community of PSes (COPS) as well as for the development of Change Management capabilities across public service.
Support Programme Office for the engagements with external and internal stakeholders to onboard and transit the application product
Create awareness and educate agencies on application product services & service offerings through workshops, sharing on success stories, roadshows, brown bag sessions, eDMs & collaterals, etc.
Liaise with the marketing and communications team to increase awareness of programs.
Manage budgets, invoices, and report on fund allocation.
Qualifications:
At least 5 years of experiences in leading programs or projects, including procurement and vendor management.
Strong understanding of change management principles and experience driving organizational change.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage with stakeholders at all levels.
Budget management and financial acumen.
Relevant certifications (e.g., PMP, ITIL, Change Management) are a plus.
If you are excited with this opportunity and enjoy making things happen, do apply now!

OR

Email your updated resume to: speytu(at)scientecpersonnel.com by quoting "J42345" in your email subject for faster processing.

All job applications will be processed with strict confidence and only shortlisted candidate will be contacted.

Elane Yap Theng Yu- R1989397
ScienTec Consulting Pte Ltd - 11C5781

title: Biomedical Diagnostics Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs Manager
company_info: Camtech Diagnostics aims to enable ideal human health and wellness through technology and innovation in testing. Founded in 2013, we have developed and commercialised a range of testing solutions for biodefence, food safety and clinical diagnostics applications. Our detection platforms provide the basis for delivering innovative rapid testing solutions. Camtech Diagnostics has built significant R&D and Manufacturing capabilities to support these developments.
job_category: Design, Engineering, General Management, Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Manufacturing
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for an experienced professional to develop, implement and maintain policies
and programs to ensure compliance with the relevant international regulatory requirements
applicable to clinical diagnostic products. The candidate must be able to successfully interface with
governmental and regulatory agencies, notified bodies and other external auditing bodies in
support of diagnostics product development. The candidate will train and manage a QA team to
implement and sustain an industry standard Quality Management System through regular
meetings, management review and other surveillance mechanisms as appropriate.
Responsibilities
- Work in a dynamic environment to establish and proactively maintain an industry
standard Quality Management System ensuring compliance to internal, and
international requirements for IVD medical devices (e.g. 21 CFR 820, cGMP, ISO13485)
- Prepare, review and approve new SOPs for IVD product development and ensure
document control procedures are aligned with applicable international regulatory
requirements
- Provide input to the operations of laboratory and manufacturing facilities for IVD
product development
- Plan and manage audits
- Give regulatory advice to teams working on individual IVD product development
projects and support the preparation of product registration dossiers
- Mentor and manage junior members of the QA/RA team
- Conduct audits on key suppliers and vendors
Qualifications
- Qualified individual will have MSc, BS or BA degree in life sciences or engineering
- Minimum 4-6 years industry experience with thorough working knowledge of
regulatory and certification processes (e.g. FDA - 21 CFR 820, cGMP, ISO 13485/9000
standards)
- Experienced in the quality management of device product development
- Experience in manufacturing associated with the IVD industry (experience from the Pharmaceutical
industry would also be considered)
- Hands on experience in Manufacturing/ Production Operations Management would be valued
- Knowledgeable and proficient in quality management/control activities in the IVD
industry with focus on product development and registration
- Experience in the successful handling of external audit/inspection, supplier audit
- Practical knowledge of ISO13485 Audit or FDA Inspection is highly preferred
- ASQ or other professional certification will be viewed favorably

title: Student Hostel Night Duty Manager - Mandarin Speaking
company_info: Balestier Students' Hostel (BSH) is a 4-storey building situated at the junction of Boon Teck Road and Balestier Road. It was founded about decade years ago and is registered with the Government of Singapore. The Hostel is very spacious, well-equipped and properly managed to cater to the needs of foreign students from countries in this region.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Chinese Speaking with BSH Hostel keeps constant vigilance of activity on and around the hostel property and reports, with documentation, incidents with the intent of improving the safety and security of Guests, Team Members, and others.

As a Night Duty Manager , you are the first point of contact for dealing with operations manager related inquiries that arise within the hostel. The position predominately involves face-to-face contact with Guests and represents Senior-level hostel management in their absence. It is also the Management contact point for any hostel operational issues that arise that cannot be resolved by the department. Specifically, the Duty Manager will perform the following tasks at the highest level of service.

- Be visible in the hostel premise, particularly during busy time and after-office-hours, especially during public holidays and week-end.
- First point of contact for dealing with any general management related matters that arise within the hostel.
- Engage students in conversation and provide general assistance.
- Ensure that all student complaints are handled promptly and completely.
- Pick up the student and major corporate clients upon arrival from Airport.
- Coordinate the services and special facilities provided to extended-stay Guests.
- Demonstrate thorough knowledge of all credit procedures and ensure they are applied properly.
- Offer current knowledge on all hostel products, services, policies, and emergency procedures.
- Monitor Guest satisfaction reports and implement actions to improve results.
- Handle any management issues or emergencies that arise, record them as required, and remediate as required.
- During your night shifts you should assist the students with troubles and provide them with full support.
- Face-to-face contact with students and represents senior-level management in their absence.
- Report incidents with the intent of improving the safety and security of students and team members.
- Keep constant vigilance of activities on and around the hostel.

Requirements:
• More than 5 years of working experience in hotel/hostel management and client engagement
• Experience dealing with regulators and managing regulatory responses
• A diploma or above in Chinese Study, Business Admin, or Equivalent
• Highly proficient in Chinese Mandarin
• Good understanding of client dynamics and requirements
• Calm, efficient, and the ability to work well under pressure
• Autonomous leader & team player
• Familiar with the current situation and the Chinese culture
• Has good communication skill, ambitious and interested in taking up challenging tasks
• A passion for delivering exceptional levels of Guest service
• Willing to work the night shift and over the weekends

Those interested, please send your profile to admin@bshostel.com. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Operation Manager
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Ensure all operations are carried on in an appropriate, cost-effective way
Improve operational management systems, processes and best practices
Help the organization’s processes remain legally compliant

title: Operation Manager
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Operations Manager to join our dynamic team. As the Operations Manager, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and optimizing our cleaning operations to ensure efficiency, quality, and customer satisfaction. You will be responsible for managing a team of cleaning professionals, implementing operational strategies, and maintaining the highest standards of service.
Key Responsibilities:
Team Management: Lead and mentor a team of cleaning staff, including hiring, training, scheduling, and performance evaluations.
Operations Oversight: Ensure the smooth day-to-day operations of our cleaning services, including organizing schedules, supply management, and equipment maintenance.
Quality Control: Monitor and maintain high standards of cleaning quality, ensuring client expectations are met or exceeded.
Client Relations: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, addressing their concerns and proactively seeking feedback to improve our services.
Budget Management: Manage the budget for cleaning operations, including cost control and resource allocation.
Safety Compliance: Enforce safety protocols and regulations, ensuring the well-being of our employees and clients.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement efficient cleaning techniques to enhance productivity.
Reporting: Prepare and present regular reports on operational performance and key performance indicators to senior management.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or a related field (preferred).
Proven experience in operations management, preferably in the cleaning or facility services industry.
Strong leadership and team management skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Organized, detail-oriented, and able to multitask effectively.
Proficient in using software and technology for scheduling and reporting.
Knowledge of safety and cleaning standards and regulations.

description:

DESCRIPTION
The Port Operations Manager is responsible for the smooth transition of port operation and otherwise.
To perform this role, the Port Operations Manager stays in close contact with a range of industry groups, such as customs and quarantine, stevedores, and shipping lines.
The Port Operations Manager is responsible for the efficient use of port facilities and resources with specific responsibilities for health and safety and security. title: Production & Operations Manager
company_info: Lumina Live Pte Ltd (www.lumina.com.sg) is an established experiential event agency with offices in Singapore and China that specialises in the luxury, lifestyle, corporate and FMCG sectors. We are passionate about crafting experiences that strengthen brands, not only creating events. We are dedicated to the creation and implementation of sophisticated and quality experiential events for global brands and corporations, with the purpose of building better customer engagement. Innovation is in our DNA. Incorporated in 2000, Lumina Live has produced outstanding results across the Asian region, offering solutions in different areas: • Production & management of large-scale events • High-end luxury and fashion events • Product launches • Branded exhibitions • Corporate conferences and seminars • Public events
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for an experienced Production and Operations Manager to oversee and manage the set production and technical requirements for luxury and lifestyle events, pop-ups, and exhibition.

You will ensure events are successful, paying attention to production quality, time and budget constraints, and will get exposure to projects with international luxury and premium lifestyle brands.

BENEFITS
Good remuneration package, including project-based incentives
Supportive and cohesive team environment
Annual Dental, Optical & Medical Entitlements
Hospital & Surgical Insurance Entitlements
2-days flexible Work from Home arrangements per month (bi-weekly)
Off-in-lieu provided for work on weekends and public holidays
Good opportunities to work on overseas projects for wider exposure
SCOPE OF WORK
Be part of the production and operations team in planning and coordinating events and exhibition in Singapore and regional countries
Manage overall production and operations timelines and quality
Oversee vendors & logistic agencies to ensure deliverables are met
Cost negotiation and managing suppliers’ relationships
Project operations planning and administration which include pre-event preparation, onsite execution and post event closing
Internal liaisons and communication with our projects and design divisions
Production management from fabrication to on-site set up supervision and management for events and exhibitions
Supervision and management of dismantling phase of projects
Proactively handle any arising issues and troubleshoot any emerging problems during set up and event day
Co-ordinating risk assessments, safety regulations and process management documentation
CRITERIA
Between 3 - 5 years’ experience of production and operations management for premium lifestyle events & exhibitions
Relevant experience and knowledge in set construction and electrical requirements for events and exhibitions
Strong supplier management and quality control to ensure supplier deliver high quality finishing
Effective negotiation skills for costs with external vendors and contractors
Able to produce timeline and production schedules
Must be able to handle multiple projects concurrently
Understand AutoCAD layout and technical production plans
Possess positive attitude and in good health.

title: Commercial Operations Manager
company_info: CAVASIA PTE. LTD. cavAsia is as system and solution provider, we have good engineering know-how to design technically complex systems, have experience project execution team on site to execute and meet fast-track project schedules without compromising quality, as well as assertive safety personnel to ensure all aspect of safety are complied with. Our Singapore and Malaysia team has the technical capabilities to design and build all kinds of Cleanroom Systems, HVAC, Process, Exhaust, Electrical, Control and Instrumentation systems and focus primarily in the electronic, solar renewable energy, hospital, pharmaceutical and other high tech industries. Other than being a turn-key or specialist trade contractor, we also provide facility management services, design consultation, construction management and EPCM services to assist our clients to control and manage projects on site.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What you will do:
As a Commercial Operations Manager, you will Supervises the execution of small projects. Serves as primary on-site project leader, following standardized project management procedures. Uses standard tracking tools to report project progress. Evaluates project costs and progress against budget and plan.

How you will do it:
Driving Commercial Excellence/Results:
Work with the management to develop/oversee a smooth & effective sales forecasting process to enable the growth of cavAsia in both SG and MY.
Track and analyze key metrics including pipeline generation/growth, forecast accuracy, win/loss rates, sales productivity and quota attainment.

Internal Process Improvements & Monitoring - Ownership and in-depth review of current business/operation processes to identify gaps and provide related recommendations /enhancements.

Drive P&L and Commercial Operations – Work closely with the project teams and Project Cost Controller to regular monitoring and tracking P&L related items such as:
Project Cost forecast and execution – monthly cadence by working with respective PMs to get the COGS forecast for the month. Review and formulate mitigation plan if fail to meet Revenue/GM target.
Manage project cashflow, AR and Unbilled Revenue figures to meet target. Support AR by talking to client where necessary to chase payments for overdue invoices. Payment Requisition Form issuance against PO issue. Monitor and follow up with Procurement for timely PO issuance, especially for urgent PO.
Co-ordinate with finance and AP team to ensure on time payment to Vendors. Monitor IBC reports to ensure issues are resolved on time.
Weekly meeting with Project Admin to track MIGO status and outstanding issues in FS2 & IBC reports. Subcon/Vendor due invoices must be paid on time as per JCI payment cycle.

Project Admin – Lead, Monitor & manage the Project Admin team to ensure SAP MIGO, PRF and GPR are completed on time.

CIS Booking – Major Project VOs. In charge of CIS for major project VO booking and work with Sales Admin to book into SAP.

Integration – Lead & ensure smooth and timely integration into JCI system. Co-ordination with other departments/stake holders to improve and ensure effective workflow.

Business Development and Strategy – Partner with in-country leaders to assist developing company/region go to market business strategies in order to drive profitable growth (both short & long term). Prepare and implement comprehensive business plans to facilitate achievement by planning cost-effective operations and market/business development activities.

Special Projects - Ad-hoc projects based on management needs.
What we look for:
Bachelor’s degree in in Business, Technology, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 8 to 10 years of relevant experience in Construction sector with increasing level of responsibilities within an MNC. Prior experience with SAP a plus.
Strong business partnering/interpersonal skills and the ability to lead and work within a multi-discipline team with shared purposes. Prior experience in leading individuals to work as an effective team a plus.
Possess advanced analytical and objective critical thinking skills with the ability to effectively balance financial and operational needs in order to deliver timely and appropriate solutions to complex business issues.
Ability to develop/review/drive/enhance business model/processes and track progress/realizations accordingly.
A high degree of proactivity, creativity and latitude is expected.
Willingness to take on new challenges.
What we offer:
Competitive salary
Paid vacation/holidays/sick time
Comprehensive benefits package
On the job/cross training opportunities
Encouraging and collaborative team environment
Dedication to safety through our Zero Harm policy

title: Assistant Landscape Operations Manager
company_info: Carrying the message of healthy living with nature, OneO2Hydroculture Pte Ltd has a vision of bringing nature closer to men and women who might otherwise have missed the benefits and comfort that nature can provide. job_category: Customer Service, General Work, Real Estate / Property Management, Risk Management, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:

The Assistant Landscape Operations Manager helps the Senior Landscape Operations Manager to lead the execution of landscape enhancement for maintenance of softscapes and hardscapes. He/She is responsible for the scoping, planning, initiating and execution of such projects by leading a team of supervisors, technicians and workers. He/She may manage multiple maintenance sites or projects concurrently and must balance priorities amongst them. He/She is also involved in business development activities including the development of proposals for getting new contracts as well as development of marketing collaterals to grow the organisation's brand in the sector.

The work involves significant amount of planning and coordination to ensure successful execution of maintenance projects. He/She is required to balance time between planning and reviewing progress reports in office, and monitoring actual execution on site. He/She is an efficient planner and project manager, often required to manage within resource constraints.

He/She should be an effective communicator and comfortable in problem solving as well as resolving conflicts. He should also be proficient in collaboration and stakeholder management, given the number of stakeholders he must engage with on a regular basis.

Job Tasks:
Create landscape plans according to clients' needs.
Ensure quality of landscaping is acceptable.
Manage all areas of the project including planning daily work and worker timetables.
Manage workers and contractors working at the project location.
Meet with clients to understand their landscaping needs.
Brief workers on safety methods when working with equipment and tools.
Assist Operations Manager/Director with site projects
Liaise and maintain good relationship with clients
Assist to draft quotations for clients
Assist to prepare project report for regular submission
Coordinate and handle paperwork for site projects, operations administrative and submission to office
Practice and ensure good documentation for projects
Assist to manage project team, able to communicate with foreign labourers
Assistant to prepare maintenance programs for projects
Assist to research and place orders for horticulture items
Attend site meetings and tender briefing if required
May station at sites at times
Drive workers to site
Other ad-hoc duties as assigned
Requirements:
5.5 days’ work week
Minimum Diploma qualification with at least 3-5 years experience in related field
Good knowledge of Microsoft word and excel
Possess Horticulture / arboriculture knowledge will be preferred
Driving license class 3/4 will be preferred

Liaise with vendors and subcontractors to ensure timely delivery of goods, equipment and fabricated items.
Coordinate and supervise construction teams and subcontractors for the erection, testing and commissioning of installation of equipment to the required specification and quality.
Liaise with consultants, owners and relevant authorities on their engineering request.
Plan and schedule work activities at sites in accordance to master program and ensure work is conducted in a timely and safe manner.
Ad-hoc duties assigned by the Management from time to time
Supervises Installation Compliance and requirement during the construction stage from start to the completion and handover of the project
Supervise subcontractors’ works according to design drawings, specifications, shop drawings, method statement and local codes and regulations
Liaise and work with relevant authorities / subcontractors / clients on shop drawings / equipment submissions, inspections, testing requirements and commissioning
Minimum 5 years experience in Electrical site installation in the construction industry,
Relevant project experience in the field of Commercial, Building projects in Singapore

JOB DESCRIPTION
Maintaining the appearance of the store by monitoring the condition of the store environment, merchandise, and employees’ uniforms and appearance

Reviewing financial reports to identify opportunities for increasing revenue or cutting costs
Ensuring that all company procedures are followed to ensure employee safety and customer satisfaction

title: Restaurant Operations Manager
company_info: AL DENTE TRATTORIA PTE LTD Join one of Singapore’s most prominent caterers in our Event Sales Team and be in the forefront of Singapore’s MICE and F&B Industry! Creative Eateries Catering has successfully executed numerous high profile events such as: Beerfest Asia ▪ Formula 1 ▪ Singapore Airshow ▪ Singapore Biennale ▪ APEC Summit Singapore ▪ Communicasia Exhibitions
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This position is responsible for the planning and direction of the workers and resources of the restaurant for the efficient, well-prepared, and profitable service of food and beverages.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Overall responsible for the administration and operations of several restaurant outlets under one restaurant brand.
• Work with chefs and other personnel to plan menus that are flavourful and popular with customers. Work with chefs for efficient provisioning and purchasing of supplies. Estimate food and beverage costs. Supervise portion control and quantities of preparation to minimize waste. Perform frequent checks to ensure consistent high-quality preparation and service.
• Work with other management personnel to plan marketing, advertising, and any special restaurant functions.
• Direct hiring, training, and scheduling of food service personnel.
• He/she is to implement all standardized procedures, rules, and regulations systematically in order to be in line with company standards and policies
• Ensure proper working condition of all outlet equipment and prepare equipment defect list
• Safe keeping of company properties
• Ensure proper daily sales deposit
• Ensure outlet cleanliness upkeep according to NEA requirements
• Investigate and resolve complaints concerning food quality and service.
• Prepare checks that itemize and total meal costs using the Point of Sales system.
• Perform other duties as assigned by management.

REQUIREMENTS
• Min GCE ‘N’ level or equivalent with at least 4-6 years of relevant experience
• Strong communication, interpersonal, and management skills
• Energetic, positive-minded individual
• Able to work independently and in a team

title: Sales Operations Manager
company_info: Kinetic Technologies designs, develops and markets proprietary innovative, high-performance analog and mixed-signal integrated circuits, specializing in power, protection, video/audio interfacing and signal integrity, servicing consumer, communications, industrial, automotive and enterprise markets. Our core products sit “Behind Every Port™”, providing solutions to manage, protect, regulate, and monitor power coming through the port, satisfying the growing demand for USB Type-C, DisplayPort™, HDMI™, Ethernet, and other power connectors in system designs. We also offer solutions to convert the high-speed data through the port as well as to improve its signal integrity. Through our proprietary circuit design techniques and silicon process technologies, we have created application solutions which solve problems by eliminating external components, reducing package size, reducing noise, protecting electronic loads, increasing power efficiency and improving data quality without compromising performance. In fact, Kinetic Technologies products meet and exceed some of the industry’s toughest specifications and standards, such as VESA DP, Qi/WPC, IEE802.3, IEC61000-4-2, IEC61000-4.5 and AEC-Q100. Kinetic Technologies was founded on the fundamental principle of innovation and that driving force is stronger than ever today. It is deep-rooted in Kinetic the understanding that consumer, communications, industrial, automotive and enterprise System OEMs must continually reinvent themselves by bringing better, faster, smaller, smarter products with new features and functionality to market with each new generation.

title: Assistant Operations Manager (MICE)
company: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.
company_info: Resorts World Sentosa (RWS), Asia’s premium lifestyle destination resort, is located on Singapore’s resort island of Sentosa. Spanning 49 hectares, RWS is home to world-class attractions including Universal Studios Singapore, S.E.A. Aquarium, the Maritime Experiential Museum, Dolphin Island and Adventure Cove Waterpark. Complementing the adventure and adrenaline of its theme parks and attractions are six unique luxury hotels, the world-class Resorts World Convention Centre, a casino and the Asian flagship of a world-renowned destination spa. RWS offers award-winning dining experiences and exciting cuisines from around the world across its many renowned celebrity chef restaurants, establishing itself as a key player in Singapore’s vibrant and diverse dining scene and a leading gourmet destination in Asia for epicureans. The integrated resort also offers world-class entertainment, from original resident productions to concerts and public shows such as Crane Dance and Lake of Dreams. RWS has been named “Best Integrated Resort” since 2011 for nine consecutive years at the TTG Travel Awards which recognises the best of Asia-Pacific’s travel industry. RWS is wholly owned by Genting Singapore, a company of the Genting Group. For more information, please visit www.rwsentosa.com.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Primary Responsibilities
Lead and motivate a team of Food & Beverage (“F&B”) staff to contribute effectively in achieving MICE’s plans and goals
Ensure memorable and exceptional experiences for all guests and customers with creative and innovative ideas and concepts with a strong guest recognition system/program
Monitor and collaborate with the Culinary team to achieve and maintain a healthy food cost, efficiency and/or profitability
Ensure all guest areas are kept and maintained in a spotlessly clean and comfortable state, and proper work areas are provided for team members and kept and maintained in a safe, clean, tidy and organized environment
Provide coaching and guidance to F&B team and fulfill all training needs for their future development
Requirements
Preferably certificate in F&B/Hospitality Management
Minimum 2 years’ experience at a managerial level, preferably having F&B banquet experience
Knowledge of various drink recipes and beverage service standards
Good interpersonal and communication skills with cheerful personality
Able to perform rotating shifts, including weekends and public holidays

title: AVP, Regional Operations Management
company_info: Mizuho Bank, Ltd. is a subsidiary of the Japan-based Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. (listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and NYSE) and is one of the largest financial services companies in the world. Mizuho Bank, Ltd. provides financial and strategic solutions for the increasingly diverse and sophisticated needs of its clients with offices located in all the major cities of the world such as Tokyo, New York, London, Hong Kong and Singapore. Join Mizuho Bank, Ltd., in Singapore, and be part of our expanding team, passionate to build the future together. "One MIZUHO: Building the future with you"
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Regional Operational Risk Monitoring – To analyze & manage operational risks of overseas offices through reviewing:
Quantitative Risk Profile
Operational Errors
Local Operations Committee
Intra-Office Inspection Plan and Results
Control Self-Assessment
Internal Operation Procedure
Business Continuity Management
Managing Operational Planning and Support through addressing operational concerns, operational risk mitigation, HOP matters and streamline workflows.
Introduce strategies to prevent, eliminate & mitigate operational risks of overseas offices by providing opinions and advises for streamlining of workflow and processes
Analyze branches' operational workflow and identify potential bottlenecks and operational lapses to reduce operational errors
Prepare branch OER, Tranz Vol & Operational Analysis report for Management
Participate in Branch’s evaluation through coordinating with HQ on Mizuho Awards
Engage with the overseas offices to select core SQE items
Evaluates overseas offices' achievement based on the criteria set by HQ, IOPD
Training – on-site, offsite and/or ad-hoc training to our overseas offices
To plan and organize Forums to upgrade the skills and knowledge of overseas offices national staffs;
Assist overseas office in Pre-Audit preparation and review their operational process to confirm adequacy of internal control
Other Ad-Hoc Support
Handle overseas offices' adhoc enquiries
Review overseas offices’ application and share our analysis of any impending risks e.g. Branch Reorganization, Delegation of GM/JGM authorities, Setting up of New BCP Office, Office Relocation, New Product etc.
Regional Report
Reporting & Analysis; compiling reports, updates, translation from English to Mandarin & vice-versa
Prepare consolidated report on Asia Pacific region’s Transaction Volume, Operational Errors, Trade Volume, MGEB ratio etc.
Strategic Operations Planning
Contribute comprehensively in the areas of operational risk and provide cross-functional support between other HQ teams and overseas offices: -
To strengthen BCP measures of overseas offices through planning with other HQ teams
Rollout and improve remote access operations across overseas offices
Promotion and Implementation of SEIBI Asia Rollout for overseas offices
Streamline the process of each overseas office in order to have smoother SEIBI preparation
Drive LIBOR Discontinuation PJ for overseas offices
Job Requirements
Strong working knowledge of MS Office applications
Diverse knowledge of various back-office operations (Loans, Treasury, Trade, Remittance, Deposit), Operations Planning and Risk Management with over 10 years experience for back-office operation related work
Willing to travel for short business trips to branch offices when required

Drive system / data integrity and utilisation of HR Shared Services.

Tax Managerment - manage administration and logistics relating to international tax and payment activities.

CFC Management – run periodic Headcount planning & monitoring activities.
Audit – perform annual audit, supporting other functions audit activities regarding HR / employment related topic, ensure records are being retained for appropriate duration in line with local regulations.
Act as an HR Business Partner to key functions within the business
Work with leaders to deliver performance, talent and pay calendar
Support onboaring of new joiners into key functions
Handle employee relations issues in a supportive and objective way
Own the company benefits provision, considering the opportunities to position Reckitt as an employer of choice
Review company wide policies to ensure they fit and support our values
Benchmark and review the benefits provision working with reward partners
Maintain holiday and sick leave systems
Enrolment of new staff into medical services, and providing high level advice on the provision
Implementation of new benefits provisions on a project basis

Minimum 4-7 years relevant working experience in managing payroll, HR operations, administration and procedures will be preferred.
Computer literate and proficient in MS Office applications, especially Excel (i.e. v-lookup, nested if, string, pivot table, and other advanced Excel functions and formulas)
Knowledge about ER/ IR and local regulations (Employment & Tax related)
knowledge of HR Systems such as SuccessFactor, and HRIS will be added advantage.

title: Senior Manager, Operation Management
company: KEPPEL DATA CENTRES HOLDING PTE. LTD.
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Scope:
You will play a pivotal role in managing various tactical functions within the division. Your responsibilities will encompass a wide range of tasks, including the governance of Keppel’s business life cycle process, working closely with Investment Managers in bid management, managing commercial deals review, and other critical support functions. Your role will contribute to the overall success of our business by ensuring efficient and effective coordination of strategic initiatives and processes.

Responsibilities:
DIF (Datacenter Investment & management Framework)
Govern and contribute to the development and/or refresh of DIF process; business life cycle from Investment, Build, Operate to Exit of Keppel’s assets
Update the Global Operating Process (GOP) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) of DIF
Foster collaboration between the Investment team, Project build, Operations and all KDC assurance teams throughout the DIF life cycle process
Prioritize and schedule DIF’s gates meetings with respective secretaries
Coordinate the scheduling of all other DIF-related meetings
Work on standardizing internal operational agreements and update them as needed
Bid Management
Working closely with Investment team to manage the assigned global investment deals
Work with Senior Executives, Commercial & Investment teams on bid qualification
Manage virtual bid teams and inputs from a variety of stakeholders
Work with the core team to prepare and review the bid paper
Risk tracking and management throughout the bid process
Work with the Investment team to plan timelines on various gates, ensuring ample time for cost assurance and due diligence
Understand and resolve complex technical, strategic, and business issues
Arrange all post bid reviews within internal organisation and improve the Bid processes
Tracking and report on success/fail bid rates
Facilitate meetings between the Investment and Assurance teams to ensure CAPEX/OPEX estimates align with underwriting
MDM (Major Deals Meeting)
Monitor and report on the top 3 deals with the goal of closing them for the quarter and year
Lead MDM Discussion and provide valuable insights to the MDM team.
MDM minutes and Follow-Up: Document MDM meetings and ensure follow-up on action items
Prompt Investment Team: Initiate Bid Sign-On (BSO) requests when opportunities are ready for investment
Other Responsibilities
Corporate Secretary: Serve as the corporate secretary for assign Keppel’s assets
Preparation of Board’s meeting Slides
Job Requirements
Education and Experience
Degree in Business / Finance / Economics or equivalent, with flair for Numbers.
8 years of relevant working experience in financial, asset and business management field, of which 5 years should be in a managerial capacity
Exposure to REITs or Funds would be an added advantage
Fluent in both written and spoken English and Chinese. Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent in commercial understanding and strong analytical, negotiation skills and problem-solving skills with a can-do attitude in a changing environment
Consistent ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment and to meet and adhere to deadlines
Possesses passion, initiative and drive to continuously develop and work with creativity and innovations
Well-versed in MS Office Applications, PowerBI and PowerApps. Excellent in presentation skills to customer and senior management
Self-motivated, resourceful team player with good people management skills and able to lead initiatives independently

company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Future Ready Food Safety Hub (FRESH) serves as Singapore’s lead scientific platform under the Singapore Food Story R&D Programme, to bring together researchers, regulators and industry to build up Singapore’s food safety science and R&D capabilities to secure Singapore’s food supply and economic value proposition. FRESH will embark on R&D and talent development activities to help enhance Singapore’s local food regulatory capabilities. FRESH is part of the Singapore Food Story R&D Programme (SFS), with partner organisations being the Singapore Food Agency (SFA), A*STAR and the Nanyang Technological University (NTU).
As a key member of the FRESH core team, the Assistant Director will work with the FRESH Director to provide support the operations and administration.

Assistant Director (FRESH):

As a key member of the FRESH core team, the Assistant Director (FRESH) will be responsible for the following:
Key coordinator at FRESH for FRESH partnership between SFA, A*STAR and NTU.
Fully involved in supporting the operations and financial administration of FRESH.
Promote research capabilities to industry partners and explore potential collaborations.
Coordinate and host industry visits and meetings.
Build network and strengthen relationships with industry partners, including handling key collaboration portfolio with industry partners.
Prepare reports, monitor and follow up on industry engagements and trends.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
Assistant Director (FRESH) should have the following qualifications:
Scientific degree and experience in business development would be an advantage
Good business acumen, resourceful and is a team player
Strong network and working knowledge of the Singapore research, regulatory and food industry environment.

company_info: Barn & Potter – Experience Nature through wellness Barn & Potter is founded in Singapore in 2013. The brand was inspired by the rich history of both traditional folk pottery and aromatic medicine in the olden days. We focus on manufacturing high-quality aromatherapy, wellness and skincare products for retail brands. We use only the finest ingredients from best plantations around the world. These include – USA, Brazil, India, Thailand, Egypt, Australia, Bulgaria, Italy and France. Our products are 100% naturopathic, that is, no form of petrochemicals and synthetic fragrances are used. From harvest to distillation, to design and innovation, we ensure devotion to detail and responsibility to Natural – socially and environmentally governed by goods manufacturing process (GMP). Our aim is to research and develop innovative products using premium oils and exciting raw materials. Our RND work closely with our manufacturing facilities to produce customised aromatherapy products based on the specification stated by our customers.

address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Consulting, Logistics / Supply Chain, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for an experienced and proactive Line Operations Executive for one of our leading ship owner clients. Reporting to the Deputy General Manager operationally, he/she will be ensuring the safe planning and reduction of operating cost of vessels as part of the Line Management team. They will also serve as a professional liaison between the Vessel Master, Line Management team, and location agents, addressing operational, vessel scheduling, and capacity-related matters. The ideal candidate should possess a minimum of 2 years' experience in shipping operations, along with excellent communication skills.

Responsibilities:
Assist Line Management in vessel selection with reference to load ability and operational suitability in specific trade areas.
Execution of voyage instructions to new chartered vessels and ensure that operational procedures are followed by the vessel throughout the charter.
Maximize vessel stowage based on CBF declared with minimum shut out / restows due to stowage issues, with equal crane split to optimize cargo operations and without impeding vessel safety.
Schedule update in Bridge for the company’s operated vessels and distribute same.
Closely monitor SMART system to minimize pending reports and delayed submission. Ensure SMART tracking is accurate. Assist Line Managers (LM) with monitoring of alerts to ensure vessels are always following instructions.
Speed adjustment instructions to Captain.
Advise planned draft and load ability for draft restricted ports.
Support line management in monitoring and coordinating downline berth window with port of call agents and highlight situations which could lead to vessel delays, congestion or affect terminal productivity.
Screen DG/OOG requests and ensure strict compliance with the in-house DG exclusion list unless a valid exception has been authorized.
Monitor tug usage on the arrival/departure reports and raise queries with Master/Assist Operations Manager (AOM) where excess tug usage is spotted.
Arranging for Bunker and enter order in ARKS.
Monitor SDR’s closely to ensure initial action is taken and terminals are put on notice. AOM, LM/Legal is correctly informed in case the SDR becomes a claim.
Assist LM with PRF management to control and streamline such costs.
Update forecast and utilization details.
Support current Business Transformation initiatives as and when required concerning EDI integration with terminals, customers and development of internal procedures relating to specifically to areas of expertise.

Requirements:
Minimum Diploma in Maritime Studies / University graduate or equivalent.
Minimum 2 years’ experience in shipping operational.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point).

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This position is responsible for assisting in the planning and direction of the workers and resources of the restaurant for the efficient, well-prepared, and profitable service of food and beverages.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Assisting the Restaurant Manager in working with chefs and other personnel to plan menus in line with the brand’s culinary direction.
• Work with chefs for efficient provisioning and purchasing of supplies. Estimate food and beverage costs. Supervise portion control and quantities of preparation to minimize waste. Perform frequent checks to ensure consistent high-quality preparation and service.
• Work with other management personnel to plan marketing, advertising, and any special restaurant functions.
• Direct hiring, training, and scheduling of food service personnel.
• Investigate and resolve complaints concerning food quality and service.
• Assist in dishwashing duties
• Perform other duties as assigned by management.

REQUIREMENTS
• Min Diploma or equivalent with relevant experience
• Strong communication, interpersonal, and management skills
• Passionate about providing excellent management and interpersonal skills
• Able to work independently and in a team
• Able to communicate in English and 1 other language
• Excellent vision required for seating guests, expediting food, cleaning equipment, and reading floor plans, charts, and schedules.
• Self-discipline and self-motivated and enjoys interacting with people and serving customers.
• Always maintain a high standard of personal hygiene with a clean appearance and neatly attired.
• Pleasant, Polite manner, Energetic, cheerful, and hardworking. Possess enthusiasm for learning and keen to get feedback for improvement.
• Ability to engage in physical activities which require long hours of standing during the working shift.
• Require to work on a rotating shift basis which includes weekends and public holidays.

title: Head of Operations (PCWG)
company_info: Corporate Profile PERTAPIS was registered under the Societies Act in 1970. It is an approved organisation under the Charities Act, Cap 37 and has also been conferred the status of an Institution of PublicCharacter (IPC), IPC No: IPC000455 and can issue tax exempt receipt for donations. The principal activity of PERTAPIS is the running of welfare projects which are designed to address some of the social problems faced by the community. These projects include the running of welfare homes, providing social support for the needy families and educational services. Our Journey PERTAPIS was formed in 1969 by a group of young aspiring Muslims who believed in the importance of moral and religious education in order to build a strong resilient self in youth. In the days of kampung living, the community would come together to help ease the burden of families in need. For most, this did not change even after modernisation and families moved into flats. They carried on that kampung spirit by forming ‘block committees’ and organising activities involving social interaction, community bonding and welfare support. From its humble beginnings, PERTAPIS, as a ‘self-help organisation’ is today an approved charitable organisation under the Charities Act with Institution of Public Character (IPC) status and has helped more than 3000 families in need.
description:

title: Senior Executive Line Operations (Maritime)
company_info: TRITON AI (EA License Number 21C0661) is a Singaporean-owned talent resource organization formed with the purpose of developing a Singaporean core for our clients. Established since 2011 and formally operating as Talent Touche Pte Ltd, TRITON AI has undergone a total rebranding exercise in 2021 in alignment with our mission to enhance the effectiveness of Talent Acquisition and People-Powered Projects with Technology and Artificial Intelligence.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are currently working with a world's largest independent feeder carrier.
We are to help bring in a Line Operations Executive.

Role and Responsibilities:
Assist Line Management in vessel selection with reference to load ability and operational suitability in specific trade areas.
Execution of voyage instructions to new chartered vessels and ensure that operational procedures are followed by the vessel throughout the charter.
Maximise vessel stowage based on CBF declared with minimum shut out / restows due to stowage issues, with equal crane split to optimize cargo operations and without impeding vessel safety.
Closely monitor SMART system to minimise pending reports and delayed submission. Ensure SMART tracking is accurate. Assist Line Managers (LM) with monitoring of alerts to ensure vessels are always following instructions.
Support line management in monitoring and coordinating downline berth window with port of call agents and highlight situations which could lead to vessel delays, congestion or affect terminal productivity.
Screen DG/OOG requests and ensure strict compliance with the in-house DG exclusion list unless a valid exception has been authorised.
Monitor tug usage on the arrival/departure reports and raise queries with Master/Assist Operations Manager (AOM) where excess tug usage is spotted.
Arranging for Bunker and enter order in ARKS.
Monitor SDR’s closely to ensure initial action is taken and terminals are put on notice. AOM,
LM/Legal is correctly informed in case the SDR becomes a claim.
Update forecast and utilisation details.
Support current Business Transformation initiatives as and when required concerning EDI integration with terminals, customers and development of internal procedures relating to specifically to areas of expertise.

Requirements:
Minimum Diploma in Maritime Studies / University graduate or equivalent.
2 - 5years’ experience in shipping operational.

If you believe that you fit the requirements of this opportunity and this opportunity will contribute to your career aspirations, apply now or reach out to jonathan@triton-ai.com.

Triton AI Pte Ltd
Registration Number: R1440473
EA: 21C0661700

title: Assistant Manager - Flight Operations
company_info: WOA Flying Club is the leading Flying Club in Singapore and broader Asia. Being part of the WingsOverAsia group provides the club and its members a full, integrated set of aviation services and flying experiences. We are looking for a dynamic, responsible, self-driven individual(s) who can excel in addressing all aspects of member interactions independently to deliver the first rate flying and membership experiences desired by our unmatched members.
address: WOA AVIATION HANGAR 66, 66 SELETAR AEROSPACE VIEW 797509
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Scope:
- To oversee, manage and guide your team overlooking the daily operations with a high degree of sound judgement and initiative.
- Plan, direct, coordinate, and oversee activities associated with ground handling services including customer service, aircraft fuelling, airside operations, hangar-ramp movements, and the teams performing these duties in accordance to defined processes and safety standards
- Review operational processes and propose areas of improvement to achieve operational efficiency and support
- Provides strong leadership to team through clear communication, motivation, and encouragement; structured and organized actions; positive work environment to ensure highest possible service levels are achieved and employee relations issues are minimized
- Main priority will be to ensure customers’ needs are always met or exceeded
- Responsible for staffing actions, including hiring, dismissal, discipline, evaluation, priorities setting, and counseling employees through coordination with Ops & Safety Manager and HR
- Direct involvement with all aspects of team management including, but not limited to, roster planning, shift planning, leave/off/overtime management, training, and compliance to work process
- Train, mentor, skill set development, supervise, and continually evaluate team members
- Providing coaching and managing team’s performance and develop the individual in their respective roles
- Strive for continuous improvements and ensure employees join forces to communicate, stay customer focused, improve work performance and maximize potential
- Review areas of innovation and enhancement to ensure no customer mishandling and satisfactory customer service on the ground.
- Inspect vehicles and all ground support equipment, ensure maintenance schedules are observed, high level of cleanliness and safety procedures are complied with
- Ensure and enforce governmental agency compliance and industry best practices in all operational areas and among all training, safety, and security standards
- Liaise on a continual basis with fellow airport operators and airport authorities, including overseas airport authorities and FBOs for overflight/landing/handling coordination for aircraft operators
- Coordinate and oversee third party service providers ensuring accuracy and efficiency
- Formulate an emergency response plan in the event of a fire, aircraft incident or accident, or any other emergency through coordination with Ops & Safety Manager
- Be conversant and compliant with relevant policies, applicable laws, safety and aviation regulations, especially IS-BAH and ISAGO standards.
- Recognize discrepancies in ground handling service delivery and provide leadership to make positive change.
- Review, develop, and ensure fully updated set of Ground Ops manuals and Standard Operating Procedures are produced, maintained, and controlled
- Conduct regular internal audit check and reporting of ground handling equipment and handling procedures.
- Required to work flexible shifts, weekends and holidays as needed.

Qualifications:
· Must have a minimum of five years of experience in the aviation industry with in both leadership and hands-on roles
· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Products including Word, Excel, Powerpoint
· Be an active team leader with exemplary management, communication, and decision making skills
· Highly Experienced in airside operations and a good understanding of aircraft types and the business aviation industry
· Flexibility, self-motivated, and a positive attitude
· Experienced in ground handling standards such as ISAGO or IS-BAH or have been played a significant role in an airport audit on airside operations.
· Demonstrate good decision making skills, able to think on the spot, solution driven mindset and successful leadership of a diverse group of employees
· Possess personable traits in order to be relatable to customers and foster client relations and communication
· Be able to drive results with high personal accountability and have a strong record in a leadership role in an FBO or equivalent facility
· Must possess a valid Driving license within minimum 5 years actual driving experience
· Demonstrate previous success in customer relations, management, and other performance areas
· Possess strong ethics including honesty, integrity, and trustworthiness

Reporting to: Ops & Safety Manager

title: Assistant Manager – trade operations
company_info: As an emerging superpower India needs to be rebuilt and rejuvenated from its very foundation – its infrastructure. We are keen to take up this responsibility to contribute towards nation building through the businesses we operate in and we want skilled and committed people who would join us in this noble endeavour. Founded in 1988, Adani has grown to become a global integrated infrastructure player with businesses in key industry verticals - resources, logistics and energy. The integrated model is well adapted to cater to the infrastructure opportunities of the emerging economies. The Group has also made significant inroads in the agri-infrastructure business by setting up grain storage silos and cold storage facilities. We are a market leader in edible oil business with our Fortune brand of oil leading the pack. We live in the communities where we operate in and take our responsibilities to the society, seriously. Through Adani Foundation, we ensure that development and progress are sustainable and inclusive; for the people and the eco-system, alike. At Adani, we believe in delivering benefits that transcend our immediate stakeholders. Resources means obtaining Coal from mines and trading; in future it will also include oil and gas production. Logistics denotes a large network of Ports, Special Economic Zone (SEZ) and Multi-Modal Logistics - Railways and Ships. Energy involves Power generation & transmission and Gas distribution.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This position is responsible for the planning, setting of the direction of the crew, and resource distribution of the restaurant to achieve an efficient, well-prepared, and profitable food and beverages restaurant.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Assisting the Operations Manager to work with chefs and other personnel to plan menus that are flavorful and popular with customers.
• Work with chefs for efficient provisioning and purchasing of supplies. Estimate food and beverage costs. Supervise portion control and quantities of preparation to minimize waste. Perform frequent checks to ensure consistent high-quality preparation and service.
• To hit all financial targets
• To lead the team on each shift and ensure the company service standards are upheld
• Assisting the Operations Manager to work with other management personnel to plan marketing, advertising, and any special restaurant functions.
• Direct hiring, training, and scheduling of food service personnel
• Investigate and resolve complaints concerning food quality and service
• Ensure proper working condition of all outlet equipment and prepare equipment defect list
• Prepare checks that itemize and total meal costs using the Point of Sales system
• Ensure sufficient stocks supply in the restaurant for smooth operation
• Supervise the operations of at least two restaurants and above
• Perform other duties as assigned by management

REQUIREMENTS
• Min GCE ‘N’ level or equivalent with at least 4 years of relevant experience
• Strong communication, interpersonal, and management skills
• Passionate about providing excellent management and interpersonal skills
• Able to work independently and in a team
