title: Outlet Manager
company_info: We Popularise music education in Singapore since 1980 For over four decades and counting, Cristofori Music has been committed to providing quality musical instruments and education to the community, inspiring more than 100,000 students in our music education programs. With 35 outlets in Singapore and a team of 500 music teachers, we are proud to be the largest music school in Singapore and have inspired countless aspiring musicians along the way. As the biggest piano retailer in Asia, we take pride in serving over 60,000 piano customers throughout the years. As the exclusive distributor of prestigious German-made piano brands, such as C. Bechstein and Seiler, as well as Pearl River, the world’s largest piano manufacturer, we offer a diverse range of quality pianos that can cater to anyone's needs. At Cristofori Music School, performance opportunities abound through various avenues, including recitals, competitions, and examinations. As a result, our students have the platform to showcase their musical talents, gain confidence, and immerse themselves in the wondrous and captivating world of music-making. We're proud of our active role in organizing and sponsoring many events that boost our local music scene, creating an environment where our students can emerge as stars on the stage. We collaborate with well-known artists such as Martha Argerich, Sir Stephen Hough, Kit Armstrong, Haiou Zhang, Kotaro Fukuma, William Youn, and many more to offer our students unparalleled learning experiences. At our school, students can choose from a diverse range of syllabuses, which include RSL Classical, Rockschool Contemporary, and ABRSM. Our programs cater to both classical and contemporary music learners, offering an effective and enjoyable way to achieve your musical ambitions. If you're passionate about music and keen to embark on a fulfilling career that makes a significant impact, we invite you to join us at Cristofori Music. Our community of talented teachers and staff members will help you unlock your musical potential and bring your aspirations to life. Together, we'll cultivate and unleash your inner music potential.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join our team as an Outlet Manager and contribute to the success of our organization. We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic individual to:
Ensure the smooth day-to-day operations of the outlet, providing a seamless experience for customers.
Lead a team of Executives and teachers, inspiring them to deliver excellent service and exceed customer expectations.
Motivate and support the outlet's teaching team, fostering a positive and productive work environment.
Enhance our digital presence through strategic initiatives, effectively reaching our target audience and increasing brand visibility.
Organize and support the company's marketing events, driving customer engagement and generating business opportunities.
Job Requirements
To qualify as an Outlet Manager, you should possess the following:
A Diploma or Degree holder in a relevant field.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, enabling you to build rapport with customers and effectively lead your team.
Good problem-solving and leadership skills to handle various operational challenges.
Availability to work weekends and retail hours, ensuring the outlet's smooth functioning during peak times.
Music background is an added advantage for this position; however, we welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds.
Remuneration and Benefits
As a qualified Outlet Manager, you can expect the following benefits:
Initial monthly remuneration of $2,800 - $3,200. Monthly remuneration package may increase to $4,500 upon confirmation.
15 days of annual leave.
Opportunities for personal growth through regular training and workshops, enhancing your skills and knowledge.
Career advancement prospects, including the potential to become a Business, Education, and Operations Manager or a Business Development Manager.
Exciting opportunities for free music courses, enabling you to explore your passion and expand your musical abilities.
Join our dynamic team and make a significant impact as an Outlet Manager. We look forward to receiving your application and embarking on this exciting journey together.

title: Restaurant Manager

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Duties and Responsibilities
• Coordinate daily Front of the House and Back of the House restaurant operations
• Delivering superior food and beverage service and maximizing customer satisfaction
• Responding efficiently and accurately to restaurant customer complaints
• Regularly review product quality and research new vendors
• Organize and supervise shifts
• Appraise staff performance and provide feedback to improve productivity
• Estimate future needs for goods, kitchen utensils and cleaning products
• Ensure compliance with sanitation and safety regulations
• Manage restaurant’s good image and suggest ways to improve it
• Control operational costs and identify measures to cut waste
• Create detailed reports on weekly, monthly and annual revenues and expenses
• Promote the brand in the local community through word-of-mouth and restaurant events
• Recommend ways to reach a broader audience (e.g. discounts and social media ads)
• Train new and current employees on proper customer service practices
• Implement policies and protocols that will maintain future restaurant operations
• Ensure strict compliance with all relevant Hygiene and Safety legislation and requirements
• Manage the external food hygiene consultant, and the resulting reports
• Assist in the planning and implementation of new ideas and menu specifications each season, working closely with Central Support to ensure they fit with guidelines and are to the high quality our guests expect
• They will also take line ownership of the Corporate Event menus, signing them off seasonally, in conjunction with the Corporate Events Manager.


Requirements
• Proven work experience as a Restaurant Manager, Restaurant General Manager, Hospitality Manager or similar role
• Proven customer service experience as a operation manager
• Extensive food and beverage (F&B) knowledge, with ability to remember and recall ingredients and dishes to inform customers and wait staff
• Familiarity with restaurant management software, like OpenTable and Peach Works
• Strong leadership, motivational and people skills
• Acute financial management skills
• B.Sc degree in Business Administration; hospitality management or culinary schooling is a plus

company_info: Savills Property Management, became a subsidiary after Savills Singapore acquired a stake in CKH Strata Management and merged their property management business. This vision can now be taken to the next level by tapping into Savills Global network and expertise where Savills has over 1 billion sq ft of properties under management. Savills Property Management Pte Ltd has set itself apart from its competition through professionalism, service excellence, efficiency, integrity, strategic application of information technology and concern for the welfare of the residents. Today, it has become the largest privately held strata management company with a staff strength of over 500 and services over 160 clients, including landmark buildings such as DUO, Shopping/Office/Hotel Complex, orchardgateway, orchardgateway@emrald, 20 Collyer Quay, Sim Lim Square and Singapore larger condominiums such as The Interlace, Parc Oasis, Signature Park and Costal Del Sol. We are currently seeking suitable candidates with the passion for strata management to join us.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Requirements
This is an exciting and dynamic role that offers a lot of opportunities for growth and development within the retail industry. You would be working closely with senior management to:
Develop and implement strategies to improve the overall efficiency, productivity, and profitability of the outlet.
Involved in the day-to-day operations of the outlet including marketing and sales efforts.
One of the key aspects of this role is the rotational program. This program is designed to give you exposure to different departments within the company, allowing you to gain a broad understanding of how all the different functions work together. This will help you develop a well-rounded skillset and prepare you for a future leadership role within the company.
You may also be involved in corporate-wide marketing events. These events are designed to promote the company brand and generate interest in its products or services. As a Management Associate, you would play a key role in helping to plan and execute these events.
Job Requirements
This position is an amazing opportunity for anyone who is passionate about music and wants to establish a career in the music industry. As a successful applicant, you will bring:
A Bachelor's degree from a recognized university
strong interpersonal and communication skills
Your impressive track record in leadership and good problem-solving skills will be valuable assets in this role.
Additionally, fluency in English is a must, and preferably a second language.
Remuneration and Benefits
This position comes with a wide range of benefits and growth potential:
This position offers an exciting opportunity to kick-start your career with a competitive initial monthly remuneration ranging between $3,200 and $3,500. Additionally, you'll have access to regular training and workshops that are specifically designed to sharpen your skills and propel your professional growth.
As a highly qualified Management Associate, your dedication and hard work will be rewarded. Upon successfully completing the 12 months of service, you'll unlock the potential to earn a total monthly remuneration package of $4,000.
After dedicating yourself for 24 months, you'll have the chance to earn an impressive monthly remuneration ranging from $4,500 to $5,000 or even more. This remarkable opportunity not only offers a great salary but also provides a solid foundation for your career growth.
In this role, the path to success is boundless. As you progress in your career, you'll have the chance to explore various exciting avenues. Whether it's becoming an esteemed Outlet Manager, a dynamic Business Development Manager, or a multifaceted Business & Education Operation Manager, the possibilities for career advancement are limitless.
5 or 6 days workweek package, and other fringe benefits.
So, if you're looking for a challenging and rewarding career with plenty of opportunities to grow and develop, apply today!

title: Senior Technology Manager
company_info: We are a leading provider of Intelligent Automation and Analytics services. We are helping our customers with their Digital Transformation journey through our holistic services – advisory and consulting services, implementation and maintenance services, and training and change enablement services. We work with global technology partners such as UiPath, Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, Workato, Microsoft, AWS, Laiye, ABBYY, etc. Our customers include leading global and regional companies in their respective fields - Banking & Financial Services, Healthcare, Education, Manufacturing, Real Estate, Logistics, Transport, Technology, Public Sector and Defense. We have a great team of mentors who are grooming the next generation of consulting practitioners and technology experts. We encourage a culture of creativity, collaboration and happiness at work! We have received several APAC and ASEAN level awards from our technology partners as well as industry research groups such as IDC and Forrester.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Automation & Analytics are 2 digital technology pillars that are going to radically change the way we work. At SimplifyNext, we work with leading organizations to scale automation & analytics, transforming the way they work & make a real difference to their business as well as their employees.

We offer a unique & exceptional career experience to inspire & empower talents like you tomake an impact that matters for our clients, people & community. Our employees go deeper to solve our clients’ biggest challenges & make a positive, lasting impact on their businesses using digital technologies.

As a member of our consulting practice, you’ll work alongside some of the leading consultants in the industry which today forms the largest automation practice in Singapore. You’ll collaborate with your team members on challenging projects, increasing your understanding of complex business problems & how you can solve them through technology. You would develop new skills & experience in areas such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Analytics, Cognitive Automation (AI skills such as intelligent document processing, text classification, NLP, Sentiment Analysis, etc.), & Cloud to further your career.

We are looking for people the relentless energy to push themselves further, to learn and to contribute, thus creating value for our clients, for our business, and for the society at large.

Work you’ll do
You would lead client portfolios and projects for leading organizations across different industry verticals such as Government, Defense, Education, Healthcare, Real Estate, Banking & Finance, Transport & Logistics, Engineering, Manufacturing and Technology.
You would stay at the forefront of one or more technology domains such as RPA, Analytics, Cognitive Automation, Process Mining, Low Code Apps and Cloud. This would include leading technologies such as UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, Microsoft Power Platform, Tableau, Azure/AWS Cloud and ML Services, Dataiku, etc.
You would be involved in originating, and then driving discussions on Centres of Excellence, building internal capability and driving organizational change for leading organizations.
Be the Automation & Analytics ambassador! Work with customer sponsors and project managers to help scale automation & analytics & make a real difference to their business & their employees.
Stay at the forefront of new capability releases from key vendors & partners we work with.
Build long-term relationship with our customers. Increase sales/revenue at client under management through different channels including:
Working closely with Sales team on pre-sales activities such as customer presentations, process discovery workshops, prepare proposals, etc.
Managing standard project management activities around scope, timeline, quality, resource, and budget across multiple projects at the clients under management.
Building customer relationships and making your Customer stakeholders successful by ensuring that projects are delivering the value expected and that maintenance (where applicable) is up to expectations
Be a strong business operator – managing the project P&L, meeting financial targets
Lead & build Community of Practices.
Act as Career Counsellor for Consultants, Assistant Managers etc.
Be closely involved in performance appraisals and defining development/training plans.
Be responsible for cultivating a positive, inclusive culture at SimplifyNext.
Build long-term relationship with our customers.
Qualifications Preferred
At least 10 years at a consulting or a technology organization for Senior Manager.
Proven track record in delivering projects in the area of Automation & Analytics.
Certifications in the one or more of the technology products - UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, Microsoft Power Platform, Tableau, Azure/AWS Cloud and ML Services, Dataiku, etc.
Excellent communications & inter-personal skills with the passion to deliver quality work.
Strong logical approach & problem-solving skills.
Nice to have: Project Management certification such as PMP or PRINCE2.
About Our Company
We are a technology-led consulting company, with a strong focus on Automation and Analytics. We provide a holistic approach for our customers’ automation & analytics journey through our extensive business process experience, deep technical expertise on technology platforms & strong focus on our customers’ internal capability development & organizational change enablement.

We have recently been included in the Forrester’s Now Tech: Robotic Process Automation Services report, as one of the leading automation services providers in the world.

At the forefront of the automation & analytics space, we have achieved many firsts in the Asia Pacific region. We are proud to have a diverse & dynamic team, with a strong collaborative & mentoring culture, focused on delivering our best & making a difference in this world.

Thatz's team of more than 150 ICT professionals pride themselves in delivering cost effective next generation solutions, as well as, services to meet all of our customers’ diverse business needs through the Thatz Way!
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Are you seeking the new norm career opportunities?

We are helping Thatz International Pte Ltd to identify suitable talents to help them to grow their business in the new norm. Selected talents will be placed with them to carry out their Next-Generation ICT Engagement and Consultancy (Thatz 2.0) or Outsourcing business.

Who we are

Our CORE VALUES:

· Forward Looking
· Humanity, and
· Environmental Friendly

Sales Account Manager (ICT & Outsourcing)
Job Title: Sales Account Manager (ICT & Outsourcing)
Work Location: Central Area, Singapore
Job Type: Permanent

Job Summary
The Account Manager acts as a key point of contact between an organisation and its clients. He/She possesses thorough product knowledge and oversees product and/or service sales. He/she works with customers to identify their needs and prepares reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising sales information. He/she contacts existing customers to discuss and give recommendations on how specific products or services can meet their needs. He/she maintains customer relationships to strategically place new products and drive sales for long-term growth.
He/she works in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, and travels frequently to clients' premises for meetings. He/she is familiar with client relationship management and sales tools. He/she is knowledgeable of the organisation's products and services, as well as trends, developments and challenges of the industry domain.
The Account Manager is a resourceful, people-focused and persistent individual, who takes rejection as a personal challenge to succeed when given opportunity. He/she appreciates the value of long lasting relationships and prioritises efforts to build trust with existing and potential customers. He/she exhibits good listening skills and is able to establish rapport with customers and team members alike easily.

Primary Responsibilities:
A) Business Development and Sales Generation
· To promote and market Thatz 2.0 core competencies in Business Solutions and Nextgen Enterprise ICT Services.
· Responsible for business development, revenue growth, productivity, and profit of each customer engagement.
· Implement sales strategy, identify new sales opportunities, and convert sales opportunities to meet sales targets.
· Prepare proposals, costings, quotations, and presentation deck, as well as lead the meetings with customers to turn the business opportunity into sales.
· Advise the customer on technology adoption and implementation strategy including architecture, integration, selection, and operation to improve the success of the customer’s business operation.
· Manage and coordinate resources, as well as, meet contract obligations to deliver good customer satisfaction.
· Collaborate with the Technical Support Team to develop effective sales action programs.
· Work closely with Channel Partners and Principals to develop and promote new products and services to existing, as well as, new clientele.
B. Customer Relationship Management
· Establish and sustain strong business relationships between Thatz and the customers through informal meetings and networking activities.
· Seek business opportunities from customers and fulfill their business needs promptly to convert them into sales.
C. Others
· Strategize, plan, execute, and monitor/review/modify the business development and sales function implementations to achieve the agreed objectives and targets ahead of schedule or on a timely basis.
· Support regional business expansion plan, when necessary.

What we are looking for?
1. Diploma in Sales and Marketing, or related field.
2. At least 2 years of working experience, preferably in the Sales and Marketing field in the ICT industry with good customer engagement expertise.
3. Professional, enterprising, resourceful, self-initiated/starter/motivated, detailed, and sales/result-oriented personnel.
4. Quick learner and adaptive to a dynamic working environment.
5. Reliable and able to take ownership of areas under your responsibilities.
6. A team player and able to work under pressure.
7. Excellent English writing and communication skills.
8. Looking for long-term career advancement within the company.

What will the Career Progression / Path be like?
1. Business / Management Executive (up to 3 years*)
2. Assistant / Manager / Senior (3 to 8 years*)
3. Director/ Senior (8 to 12 years*)
4. Junior/Partner/Senior (> 10 years*)
Note: * based on your actual performance.
Salary Package: Monthly Basic Salary (50%) + Profit sharing (50%).

ARE YOU THATZ ONE?
Get in touch
· Prepare your updated resume (please include your notice period, current salary package with full breakdown such as base, incentives, annual wage supplement, etc.), and expected package.
· Apply through this application or send your resume to jointhatz@thatz.com
· All shortlisted candidates will be contacted

As an advocate for fair employment, we strive to do our best to render objective and merit-based considerations for all applications, and we shall communicate with you when short-listed. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. For those who are not short-listed, your profile will be kept for other opportunities where suitable.

Please note that your response to this job advertisement and communications with us according to this job advertisement will constitute an informed consent by you to the collection, usage, and/or disclosure of your personal data by Thatz Resources Pte Ltd and her customers to carry out its business in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act.

Best wishes for your job search!

Feel free to recommend this position to your friend(s) or relative(s) who may meet our needs and get rewarded.

title: Manager, FinTech Training, Asian Institute of Digital Finance
company_info: The National University of Singapore aspires to be a vital community of academics, researchers, staff, students and alumni working together in a spirit of innovation and enterprise for a better world. Our singular focus on talent will be the cornerstone of a truly great university that is dedicated to quality education, influential research and visionary enterprise, in service of country and society.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description
The Asian Institute of Digital Finance (AIDF) is a university-level institute in the National University of Singapore (NUS), jointly founded by The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), the National Research Foundation (NRF) and NUS. AIDF aspires to be a thought leader, a FinTech knowledge hub and an experimental site for developing digital financial technologies as well as for nurturing current and future FinTech researchers and practitioners in Asia.
AIDF will build the FinTech leadership pipeline for Asia through offering Master’s and PhD program in Digital Financial Technology, skill based FinTech Professional Trainings as well as Fincubator Program. Fincubator is AIDF’s business incubator which will help inventors and entrepreneurs to translate innovative FinTech solutions into market-ready products and services. The candidate will work on a wide range of tasks including event management as well as marketing and operational management.
Responsibilities (including but not limited to):
Managing operations and organizing training programmes and events.
Organizing marketing activities and promotions.
Preparing events and training programme materials.
Engaging in outreach activities via AIDF’s website and social media.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Provide L2 Support that covers both functional and technical needs to traders, sales and risk managers involved with a non-linear derivative trading platform during trading hours.
Perform data improvement by configuring new and existing products, reports and processes in general.
Understand the entire stack’s technology on which the application runs and how it fits in the overall chain.
Oversee and managing production incidents arise during trading activities, lead incident resolution efforts, coordinating with relevant teams and stakeholders to minimize disruptions.
Offer expertise in derivatives and risk management, troubleshoot issues related to connectivity, pricing, trade execution, construction of curves, P&L discrepencies, and work closely with users to optimize the various market risk reporting and modelling
Perform Functional testing and Change Management activities in order to ensure the safe deliveries to Production environment.
Collaborate with teams to optimize performance of data-synapse grid computing.
Drive for effective problem management, ensure preventive and detective measures of the applications are identified and resolved through the backlog and communication/ dialogue with the Product Owner
Build, enhance and maintain tooling and scripts to automate repetitive or error prone tasks, using the correct Event Alerts
Requirement:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or equivalent by experience
Good written and spoken knowledge of English.
Experience in derivates valuation , market risk reporting and modelling.
Mainly construction of interest rate, FX and volatility curves and use them to value cash flows. Understanding this for linear derivatives is a must.
Proven experience supporting traders and risk managers in financial markets.
End-to-end ownership mindset independent and autonomous in completing tasks, taking responsibilities whenever needed as always striving for consumer value.
Eager to learn and ability to coach others.

title: Operation Project Director
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Operation Project Director is responsible for planning, executing, and managing critical operational projects aimed at improving efficiency, productivity, and overall business performance. This role involves strategic planning, project management, and operational oversight to ensure successful project delivery while aligning with the organization's operational goals.

Key Responsibilities

1. Project Planning and Strategy:
· Define project objectives and scope in alignment with organizational goals.
· Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation.
· Create project strategies to achieve operational improvements and efficiencies.

2. Project Execution and Management:
. Lead project teams, providing clear direction and guidance to team members.
· Monitor project progress and ensure adherence to project plans and timelines.
· Allocate and manage resources effectively to support project goals.

3. Stakeholder Engagement:
· Collaborate with key stakeholders, both internal and external, to gather requirements and ensure project alignment.
· Maintain open communication channels with stakeholders to provide updates and address concerns.

4. Operational Analysis and Improvement:
· Conduct thorough analyses of current operational processes to identify areas for improvement.
· Implement process improvements and operational best practices as part of project initiatives.

5. Risk Management:
· Identify potential risks and obstacles related to project execution and operational impact.
· Develop risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans to address unforeseen issues.

6. Quality Assurance:
· Establish and enforce quality standards and performance metrics.
· Conduct regular quality checks and audits to ensure project and operational excellence.

7. Budget and Resource Management
. Manage project budgets and expenditures, ensuring cost control and efficient resource allocation.
. Monitor and optimize resource allocation to support project objectives.

8. Documentation and Reporting:
· Maintain comprehensive project documentation and operational records.
· Prepare regular project status reports and present updates to senior management.

9. Operational Integration:
. Ensure the seamless integration of project outcomes into daily operations.
. Monitor the impact of project changes on operational processes and make necessary adjustments.

Requirements

· Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., business management, operations management).
· Proven experience in project management and operational management roles.
· Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
· Analytical mindset with the ability to identify operational bottlenecks and propose solutions.
· Proficiency in project management software and tools.
· Knowledge of industry-specific regulations and operational best practices.
· Adaptability to evolving project and operational requirements.
· Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
· Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
· Willingness to travel or work extended hours, as needed, to support project goals.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose and Key Accountabilities:
As a Management Trainee, your main goal will be to learn and master various aspects of the company's operations, including but not limited to operations management, human resources management, team leadership, decision-making, and problem-solving. Through this training program, you will acquire the necessary skills and knowledge to prepare for future senior management positions.
Key Accountabilities:
Continuously learn and understand the specific business operations and management strategies of the company.
Participate in and lead team projects, enhancing teamwork and leadership.
Effectively manage and execute projects in a multitasking and high-pressure environment, with a results-oriented approach.
Solve problems encountered in work, formulate and implement solutions, emphasizing replicable processes.
Embrace change, continuously improve your skills and knowledge, and break through your own capability boundaries.
Main Duties and Responsibilities:
Participate in the company's daily operations and management activities, learning the company's business processes and strategies.
Assume a leadership role in projects, effectively distribute tasks and manage progress, ensuring smooth completion of projects.
Think independently when encountering problems, propose and implement solutions, and conduct a review after problem resolution.
Accept feedback from superiors and colleagues, continuously improve your skills and knowledge, and maintain positive energy with an open mindset to change.
Enhance your professional knowledge and skills by participating in the company's training and learning activities and continuously learning.
Job Specification:
Education: Fresh graduates from NUS/NTU/SMU in Singapore or those with one to two years of work experience. Bachelor's or master's degree in business management, education, psychology, or other related fields.
Skills: Leadership and teamwork abilities, problem-solving and decision-making capabilities, project management skills.
Personal Characteristics: High self-drive, leadership, adaptability, resilience.
Career Goals: Passionate about education and training, looking forward to long-term development in the company, willing to take up a management position after completing the training.
Others: Deep understanding of the education and training market in Singapore, familiar with basic information technology and software applications.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join us at ERA, a rapidly growing real estate agency committed to excellence, innovation, and a people-centric approach.
The Opportunity
We are seeking an experienced Assistant HR Manager to spearhead our HR operations and employee engagement activities. In this role, you will work closely with department leaders to create an inspiring and inclusive work culture, helping to fuel our agency's grow

Responsibilities
HR Operations: Manage end-to-end HR processes including talent acquisition, onboarding, performance evaluations, and compliance with HR policies and legislation.
Employee Engagement: Lead initiatives like all-hands meetings, town halls, and recognition programs to foster a positive work environment.
Talent Acquisition: Manage the full recruitment cycle, from scoping role requirements to facilitating the onboarding and offboarding processes. This includes posting job ads, coordinating interviews, conducting background checks, and extending formal job offers. Act as the company's ambassador at career fairs and other professional networking events.
Collaboration: Work with the marketing team to ensure recruitment materials align with brand guidelines.
Internship Programs: Work closely with internal stakeholders to design and implement internship programs that align with both the company's objectives and the developmental goals of interns. Actively engage with universities and polytechnics to establish partnerships for a continuous pipeline of internship talent.
Employee Relations: Act as the go-to HR contact for staff queries, ensuring compliance with company policies and relevant legislation.
Offboarding: Lead the offboarding process by conducting thorough exit interviews to gather insights on employee experiences and opportunities for organizational improvement. Additionally, maintain stringent data management protocols to ensure the complete accuracy and integrity of all related records throughout the offboarding journey.
Performance & Compensation: Assist in annual performance and compensation reviews, adhering to corporate philosophy.
Pre-requisites
Diploma/Degree in Human Resource Management or a related field.
Minimum 3 years of relevant HR experience working in real estate or FMCG sectors an added advantage
Team-oriented with a hands-on approach to HR operations.
Excellent command of written communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in MS Office and HRIS; advanced MS Excel skills are a must.
Thorough knowledge of Singapore Employment Laws.
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
High energy, self-driven, and a self-starter who is able to work independently.
Bubbly personality with a pleasant disposition.
Creative and analytical, with a problem-solving mindset.

Immediate availability is advantageous.

Career progression and Training /Development opportunities

title: Club Manager
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Customer Service, General Management, Marketing / Public Relations, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
CLUB MANAGER
About the job
Description & Requirements

Who We Are

Anytime Fitness is the fastest-growing gym franchise in the world. We are on a mission to make the world a healthier place by offering our members a fun, inviting, safe, and friendly experience.
We are in the business of creating transformational experiences that support members in being healthier, moving better, and growing meaningful connections in a fun-loving community. We owe our success to our commitment to our people, excellence, and creating incredible connections in every community we're in. As a company, we believe that creating positive change to build a healthier and thriving future for our members starts with creating an equitable, inclusive, growth-focused environment for our people.

Who You Are

You are the type of person who is energized by interacting with people. Your can-do attitude has already helped you overcome a number of challenges in your life. You are ambitious and love making people smile. You value learning over results and love the feeling you get knowing you did a great job at something. Being part of a team means something more to you than just doing your own job. You perfectly navigate between looking out for your team’s well-being and courageously stepping in to help them feel successful.

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Club Manager, you are a leader. You’re accountable and feel responsible for every aspect of the gym operations, all sales, and customer service. You are dedicated to relentlessly ensuring all club areas are engaged, performing, and delivering world-class membership experiences. Club Managers build exceptional teams to drive strategy and achieve key results for the business. In partnership with senior management, you are responsible for the talent acquisition strategy of your club and the ongoing development and growth of your team and your members.

Core Responsibilities of The Job

Leadership and People Management
Create and foster a respectful and inclusive team environment and culture by welcoming and celebrating differences to ensure a supportive and engaging experience for team and club members.
Establish a vision for the club based on key metrics and initiatives. Ensure all team members are connected, engaged, and informed.
Build and foster a strong and psychologically diverse team that includes team members with various personalities, experiences, backgrounds, and skillsets to drive club operations.
Help manage the club’s hiring process, including recruitment, selection, and onboarding, ensuring a focus on DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion).
Support, encourage and oversee all team members' ongoing learning and development consistently and equitably by providing direct feedback, coaching, mentoring, and career path guidance.
Engage in and drive career discussions to support and reinforce team understanding of how working at Anytime Fitness will contribute to career and personal growth by sharing internal opportunities.
Provide team member recognition, gap assessment, and overall performance documentation to support growth. Reinforce your team's career and personal growth and address real-time performance concerns.
Plan and prepare team member schedules according to labour requirements, availability, and budget considerations.
In partnership with HR, address all employee relations issues and conflicts.
Member Experience And Community
Support team members (e.g., leading by example or coaching) to ensure a great member experience, including the relentless application of our P.L.E.A.S.E Service Model.
Lead dynamically by example by being visible on the floor to assess, anticipate, and fulfil the needs of the business, team, and members.
Address members’ concerns and emergency requests with a high sense of urgency.
Increase brand awareness and acceptance in the community by cultivating inclusive relationships with partners and community influencers and seeking to engage with diverse community resources and programs.
Working With Others
Establish supportive and productive relationships with all team members in the club.
Encourage, and collaborate with team members to ensure an optimal member experience and support all club operations.
Collaborate across clubs on related topics of customer service, operations, and sales/marketing.
Operations
Manage whole club performance in accordance with goals (sales, budget, etc.).
Assist in planning and executing high-level quarterly and annual planning for the club with respect to strategy, budget, and labour (including recruiting and training/development).
Manage the club’s business plan and make decisions to drive efficiency and effectiveness of all club operations.
Understand and adhere to people safety policies and procedures to maintain a safe work environment.
Perform work in accordance with applicable policies, procedures, and laws or regulations.
Budget Responsibility

Accountable for controllable budget, labour hours; annual sales plan target.

What We Look For
Inclusion & Diversity: Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences.
Integrity/Honesty: Behaves honestly, fairly, and ethically.
Leadership: Is able and desires to lead, influence, and inspire others; motivates, empowers, develops, and directs people as they work in an inspiring manner.
Decision Making: Uses logic and reasoning to evaluate alternatives and make effective, timely decisions.
Adaptability/Agility: Tolerates uncertainty and ambiguity and can change priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Team Building: Creates and develops teams that maximize accomplishments; encourages unique contributions and celebrate different perspectives.
Strategic Thinking: Sets strategies aligned to the company's vision and values to achieve goals/vision/further the mission; considers the 'big-picture implications of decisions.
Resilience: Remains passionate and persistent; recovers quickly from setbacks.
Change Management Leadership: Leads others through all phases of change processes and uncertainty.
Business Acumen: Is able to quickly understand and address business information (e.g., , budgets and sales forecasts, statistics, business strategy, and approaches)
Job Requirements

Eligibility
Legally eligible to work in the jurisdiction of the club you are assigned to.
Availability
Willing to work a flexible schedule and some weekends
Other Willingness Requirements
Willing to work as part of a team and can also complete work independently or alone.
Willing to move through a club for most of a shift to help members and accomplish work.
Experience
At least 2-years people management experience in any industry is a plus
Fitness Industry Experience is NOT required.
Job Assets (i.e., nice to have; not required)
Education: High School or Secondary school diploma equivalent, or above.
Experience: 2 years in customer service roles such as retail, hotel, or restaurant or sales-specific management experience is a plus.
Beyond The Paycheck (Benefits & Perks)

At Anytime Fitness, we care for and invest in the whole person – body, mind, and spirit. Our total rewards program is designed to support you in achieving your goals and focusing on the things you love. In addition to competitive base pay and a team-based bonus program, we offer paid company health plan, generous employee discounts, fitness/yoga classes, and personal and professional development programs.
Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to your location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.
The Company reserves the right to alter these benefits and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

title: Senior Club Manager
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Customer Service, General Management, Marketing / Public Relations, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
CLUB MANAGER
About the job
Description & Requirements

Who We Are

Anytime Fitness is the fastest-growing gym franchise in the world. We are on a mission to make the world a healthier place by offering our members a fun, inviting, safe, and friendly experience.
We are in the business of creating transformational experiences that support members in being healthier, moving better, and growing meaningful connections in a fun-loving community. We owe our success to our commitment to our people, excellence, and creating incredible connections in every community we're in. As a company, we believe that creating positive change to build a healthier and thriving future for our members starts with creating an equitable, inclusive, growth-focused environment for our people.

Who You Are

You are the type of person who is energized by interacting with people. Your can-do attitude has already helped you overcome a number of challenges in your life. You are ambitious and love making people smile. You value learning over results and love the feeling you get knowing you did a great job at something. Being part of a team means something more to you than just doing your own job. You perfectly navigate between looking out for your team’s well-being and courageously stepping in to help them feel successful.

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Senior Club Manager, you are a leader. You’re accountable and feel responsible for every aspect of the gym operations, all sales, and customer service. You are dedicated to relentlessly ensuring all club/s areas are engaged, performing, and delivering world-class membership experiences. Senior Club Managers build exceptional teams to drive strategy and achieve key results for the business. In partnership with senior management, you are responsible for the talent acquisition strategy of your club/s and the ongoing development and growth of your team and your members.

Core Responsibilities of The Job

Leadership and People Management
Create and foster a respectful and inclusive team environment and culture by welcoming and celebrating differences to ensure a supportive and engaging experience for team and club members.
Establish a vision for the club based on key metrics and initiatives. Ensure all team members are connected, engaged, and informed.
Build and foster a strong and psychologically diverse team that includes team members with various personalities, experiences, backgrounds, and skillsets to drive club operations.
Help manage the club’s hiring process, including recruitment, selection, and onboarding, ensuring a focus on DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion).
Support, encourage and oversee all team members' ongoing learning and development consistently and equitably by providing direct feedback, coaching, mentoring, and career path guidance.
Engage in and drive career discussions to support and reinforce team understanding of how working at Anytime Fitness will contribute to career and personal growth by sharing internal opportunities.
Provide team member recognition, gap assessment, and overall performance documentation to support growth. Reinforce your team's career and personal growth and address real-time performance concerns.
Plan and prepare team member schedules according to labour requirements, availability, and budget considerations.
In partnership with HR, address all employee relations issues and conflicts.
Member Experience And Community
Support team members (e.g., leading by example or coaching) to ensure a great member experience, including the relentless application of our P.L.E.A.S.E Service Model.
Lead dynamically by example by being visible on the floor to assess, anticipate, and fulfil the needs of the business, team, and members.
Address members’ concerns and emergency requests with a high sense of urgency.
Increase brand awareness and acceptance in the community by cultivating inclusive relationships with partners and community influencers and seeking to engage with diverse community resources and programs.
Working With Others
Establish supportive and productive relationships with all team members in the club.
Encourage, and collaborate with team members to ensure an optimal member experience and support all club operations.
Collaborate across clubs on related topics of customer service, operations, and sales/marketing.
Operations
Manage whole club performance in accordance with goals (sales, budget, etc.).
Assist in planning and executing high-level quarterly and annual planning for the club with respect to strategy, budget, and labour (including recruiting and training/development).
Manage the club’s business plan and make decisions to drive efficiency and effectiveness of all club operations.
Understand and adhere to people safety policies and procedures to maintain a safe work environment.
Perform work in accordance with applicable policies, procedures, and laws or regulations.
Budget Responsibility

Accountable for controllable budget, labour hours; annual sales plan target.

What We Look For
Inclusion & Diversity: Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences.
Integrity/Honesty: Behaves honestly, fairly, and ethically.
Leadership: Is able and desires to lead, influence, and inspire others; motivates, empowers, develops, and directs people as they work in an inspiring manner.
Decision Making: Uses logic and reasoning to evaluate alternatives and make effective, timely decisions.
Adaptability/Agility: Tolerates uncertainty and ambiguity and can change priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Team Building: Creates and develops teams that maximize accomplishments; encourages unique contributions and celebrate different perspectives.
Strategic Thinking: Sets strategies aligned to the company's vision and values to achieve goals/vision/further the mission; considers the 'big-picture implications of decisions.
Resilience: Remains passionate and persistent; recovers quickly from setbacks.
Change Management Leadership: Leads others through all phases of change processes and uncertainty.
Business Acumen: Is able to quickly understand and address business information (e.g., , budgets and sales forecasts, statistics, business strategy, and approaches)
Job Requirements

Eligibility
Legally eligible to work in the jurisdiction of the club you are assigned to.
Availability
Willing to work a flexible schedule and some weekends
Other Willingness Requirements
Willing to work as part of a team and can also complete work independently or alone.
Willing to move through a club for most of a shift to help members and accomplish work.
Experience
At least 2-years people management experience in any industry is a plus
Fitness Industry Experience is NOT required.
Job Assets (i.e., nice to have; not required)
Education: High School or Secondary school diploma equivalent, or above.
Experience: 2 years in customer service roles such as retail, hotel, or restaurant or sales-specific management experience is a plus.
Beyond The Paycheck (Benefits & Perks)

At Anytime Fitness, we care for and invest in the whole person – body, mind, and spirit. Our total rewards program is designed to support you in achieving your goals and focusing on the things you love. In addition to competitive base pay and a team-based bonus program, we offer paid company health plan, generous employee discounts, fitness/yoga classes, and personal and professional development programs.
Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to your location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.
The Company reserves the right to alter these benefits and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

title: Business Operations Manager

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Strategic Growth and Business Development
· Take full accountability for headcount growth; Lead Existing & New Business in the Energy Vertical (O&G, Marine-Shipyard, Offshore, Power, and Renewables), and grow Quest Global’s customer and services portfolio to expand in the SEA region.
· Lead overall effort to grow Energy Vertical revenue and profit to emerge as a key strategic partner for all major SEA accounts in the sector.
· Develop and implement in-depth analysis and strategic account planning (StrAP) to identify key focus areas for growth including account headcount, competitive analysis, customer needs per engineering service area, differentiation, SWOT, Quest Global relationship summary and Quest Global capability gaps.
· Responsible for leading the weekly Sales, Operations, Finance, Safety, and Strategic Account Planning meetings and make key business decisions on which services/solutions to pursue and invest in.
· Maintain a laser focus on monthly sales performance, continuously refining strategies to meet forecasts. Identify and lead unsolicited, strategic campaigns & ideas to grow the account. Leverage Quest Global relationships, influence customer decision makers, monitor milestones, track action item progress and lead the campaign proposal effort.
· Collaborate closely with clients to deeply understand their recruitment needs and craft advanced sourcing strategies. Lead and manage all solicited proposal responses for all new business services or customers. Develop plans and proposals to realize the revenue target from the account, quarter on quarter.
· Proactively activate and manage the recruitment pipeline, coordinating action plan meetings with the recruitment team to meet challenging deadlines.
· Expand to New Locations/ Divisions and new Logos. Develop and implement plans to enter new geographies or divisions of key customers and new accounts as per the strategic account plan.

Operations and Customer Account Management:
· Plan and execute a seamless mobilization and logistic support process for employees deployed at customer locations, leaving no room for error.
· Conduct frequent site visits and highly engaging sessions with employees and customer contacts, requiring you to identify and resolve complex issues.
· Identify and capitalize on advanced opportunities to expand business verticals, a task that requires a strategic mindset and a relentless drive. Leverage existing customer relationships with engineering influencers and decision-makers at both executive and mid-level manager levels. Develop and expand relationships with senior and mid-level customers.
· Exercise expert oversight over the timely submission of employees' verification and demonstrate exceptional dispute resolution skills when necessary.
· Assume the role of the primary contact for employees and customers, managing high-stakes concerns, feedback, and dispute resolution.
· Rigorously assess candidate CVs and conduct rigorous internal screening and interviews, ensuring only the best talents are deployed.
· Develop an unparalleled understanding of customer contracts, ensuring complex obligations are meticulously fulfilled.
· Collaborate with various stakeholders to address intricate debt resolution and collection matters.
· Lead and represent Management for the ISO45001 and Bizsafe certification audits and ensure that the certification requirements are maintained at sites.
· Engage with the Leadership Team on (environment, health, and Safety) EHS programs, goals, and objectives and provide active advice and support for the development and provision of annual EHS Training for employees.

Requirements:
· A Bachelor's degree in Engineering or an equivalent qualification.
· A minimum of 4+ years of experience in business development, customer account management, and operation management in the recruitment & Staffing division, within the Oil & Gas, Marine, shipyards, and power sectors is mandatory.
· 5+ years of experience in the Marine - Shipyard industry, with hands-on experience in QAQC and/or commissioning department.
· Strong knowledge of Singapore environmental, occupational safety and health regulations, ISO 45001 Standard - Health and Safety at Work, BizSafe; environment, health and Safety management systems, and the local regulatory requirements and compliance.
· A proven track record of managing projects through complex project life cycles, with experience in conventional and renewable energy is a distinct advantage.
· A willingness to travel extensively to multiple customer locations (Tuas South, Admiralty) often on short notice and on call basis.
· Exceptional communication, negotiation, leadership, and interpersonal skills.
· An innate ability to manage multiple customer accounts with precision and expertise.

company_info: BD is a global medical technology company that is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. BD leads in patient and health care worker safety and the technologies that enable medical research and clinical laboratories. The company provides innovative solutions that help advance medical research and genomics, enhance the diagnosis of infectious disease and cancer, improve medication management, promote infection prevention, equip surgical and interventional procedures and support the management of diabetes. The company partners with organizations around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues. BD has more than 40,000 associates across 50 countries who work in close collaboration with customers and partners to help enhance outcomes, lower health care delivery costs, increase efficiencies, improve health care safety and expand access to health. BD has state-of-the-art facilities around the globe that provide an environment that enables our highly talented workforce to be the best at their professions. We hire associates who have a passion and commitment to advancing the world of health. We are always seeking great people to join our company on its journey to greatness.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are the makers of possible
BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.
Why Join Us?
A career at BD means learning and working alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. You will have the opportunity to help shape the trajectory of BD while leaving a legacy at the same time.
To find purpose in the possibilities, we need people who can see the bigger picture, who understand the human story that underpins everything we do. We welcome people with the imagination and drive to help us reinvent the future of health. At BD, you’ll discover a culture in which you can learn, grow and thrive. And find satisfaction in doing your part to make the world a better place.
Become a maker of possible with us!

Job Description Summary
This Senior Operations Manager role will report into the Plant Director. He/She will be responsible for multiple product lines as assign. This role will a member of the of the Plant Executive Steering committee, in charge of development of Plant's short/long term strategic Devlopment plan and Plant Vision. This role will be accountable for achieving the plant's business and operational goals. Strategic thinking, strong leadership, results orientated, the ability to interact well with internal and external personnel at all levels, excellent written and verbal communication, ability to learn quickly and adjust personally and to manage change within assigned organization to respond to changes in customer requirements.

Responsibilities
Develops and executes vision and strategy for above mentioned department to achieve business and operational goals.
Responsible for the manufacturing operations of the assigned product groups.
Prepare department's yearly operating budget and capital expenses. Contribute to Plant's yearly product cost reduction target.
Drives operational excellence activities for assigned Manufacturing Work Cells or Area. Drive department and Functional excellence.
Accountable for developing respective product group's Manufacturing Cell towards becoming self-sufficient and high-performance entities. Focusing on year over year OEE, Headcount Optimization, and Waster reduction improvements.
Ensures on-going Manufacturing performance in Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost and Development objectives are met.
To be responsible for setting direction, coaching and execution of BD Excellence as assign.
Maintenance of records of all manufacturing processes and inspection are retained per specified requirements.
Ensure all Manufacturing Work Cell's Leaders, engineers & respective manufacturing resources maintain equipment in good condition and performing at expected OEE.
The products are manufactured within the required quality level with consistency.
Ensuring systematic evaluation and Engineering techniques are used to qualify new materials and processes.
All personnel within the department are trained to perform their job function SAFELY. independently and competently. Ensure all training records are current.
Establish strong relationships with relevant business leaders to ensure that all business platform needs are met.
Safety & ISO 14001 Environmental accountability: Ensure a safe, healthy and environmentally-friendly workplace by observing Company’s rules and procedures. Active involvement in prevention, elimination of potential safety hazards and participation in activities which promotes recycling, replacement and reduction of resource materials.
Safety & health accountability: Safety and health are important to BD and we encourage the observance of all safety programs and training assigned to you. Such programs are to be attended in a timely manner to ensure that work tasks carried out are in accordance to our safety guidelines and SOPs.
Strictly accountable for the Safety, Quality, Delivery and Cost performance of the assigned product groups to contribute towards the achievement of Plant objectives.
Ensure that assigned team members are developed individually as well as collectively.
Ensure all Plant-wide initiatives are fulfilled.
Experience in managing non-exempt and exempt staff. Operational and business experience is preferred.
Perform any duty or initiatives as assign by Plant Director.

Knowledge & Experience
BS Degree or Equivalent work experience. MBA preferred.
Minimum 10 years of experience working in a manufacturing environment preferably in the medical device and/or pharmaceutical industry.
Experienced in managing plant audits
Personality Traits
Strategic thinking, strong leadership, results orientated, the ability to interact well with internal and external personnel at all levels, excellent written and verbal communication, ability to learn quickly and adjust personally and to manage change within assigned organization to respond to changes in customer requirements.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Operations
To ensure that all the outlets and banquet is managed efficiently according to the established concept statements and adhere to Company and Hotel Policies & Procedures.
To assist in emphasizing the implementation of a flexible employee base, with the proportionate number of full time and part-time staff based on established business levels for the day.
To assign responsibilities to subordinates and to check their performance periodically.
To represent the Food & Beverage Department on the Hotel's Executive Committee in the absence of Director of Food & Beverage.
To ensure that corrective actions be taken where necessary by Outlet Managers, Banquet Operation Manager and respective Head Chefs upon monitoring the service and food and beverage standards in all outlets and banquets.
To assist and be available and on duty during peak periods and practice hands on management style.
To conduct frequent and thorough kitchen inspections together with the Executive Chef of the Food & Beverage operations.
To handle guest and employee inquiries in a courteous and efficient manner and report guest complaints or problems to supervisors if no immediate solution can be found and assure service recovery with guests. To ensure that these incidents are logged in the GIF forms and kept in file.
Guest Service
To establish good rapport with guests maintaining good customer relationship and handle all guest complaints, requests and enquiries of food, beverage and service.
To personally and frequently verify that guests in the outlets are receiving the best possible service.
To spend time in the outlets (during peak periods) to ensure that the outlet is managed well by the respective outlet team and functions to the fullest expectations.
To be demanding and critical when it comes to service standards.
To ensure that the outlet team projects a warm, professional and welcome image and that the 3 service basics are performed (warm welcome, anticipation of guest’s needs and requests and service with a smile).
Financial
To reinforce with all outlet managers a flexible work force using principles of multi-skilling and multi-tasking to ensure maximization of resource allocation.
To ensure that each Food & Beverage outlet and banquet is managed successfully as an independent profit center.
To analyze daily revenue and monitor upselling strategies and recommend innovative promotions to achieve profit.
To assist in preparing an accurate monthly forecasts on covers, average check, revenue and expenses and schedule resources.
To constantly review operating standards and implementation of new and innovative ideas to optimize revenue and profits.
Administration
To ensure that all departmental operations manual are prepared and updated as assigned.
To ensure that all Food & Beverage forms and reports by the Outlet Managers are forwarded in time to the F&B Office.
To conduct daily operations briefings with Outlet Managers and Food & Beverage Meeting in the absence of Director of Food & Beverage and Executive Assistant Manager.
To ensure that all meetings are well planned, efficient and results oriented.
To ensure that deadlines on all projects are met.
To counsel and discipline subordinates in matter relating to misconduct, on the part of the subordinates, contrary to the terms and conditions of employment, decide on appropriate disciplinary action including termination of employment.

Minimum O levels or equivalent or certificate in Hotel Management of F&B Management from SHATEC or other recognized institutions
WSQ Follow Food & Beverage Safety and Hygiene Policies and Procedures
Other existing and/or new Workforce Skills Qualifications (WSQ)
Minimum 3-4 years’ managerial experience in a in Food & Beverage/Hotel industry
Able to work in a fast pace environment
Able to communicate fluently to execute upselling techniques

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Summary
The Operations Manager will oversee the daily operation and food preparations process to ensure that highest professional food quality & safety standards set by the Management were achieved.

Operations management
• Act as the key point of contact to client for all services, operation & related issues and ensure all cases are addressed and closed in a timely manner.
• Meet targets on sales, COGS, manpower cost, other operating cost & financial objectives set by the Management.
• Control & direct food preparations process, daily operations and coordination with relevant stakeholders to ensure timely execution of daily meals to patients correctly.
• Source & purchase of all necessary culinary & operations supplies.
• Ensure all production & service equipment (including hot holding cabinets for wards) in good condition at all times.
• Ensure kitchen & preparation area align with mandatory & management (SFA, HSE) standards.
• Supervises staff & oversee every meal plating (belting) processes (modified texture, therapeutic needs, menu selection, etc.).
• Safeguard required standards on all food preparation & service by implementing training to increase staff food handling knowledge
• Plan and conduct regular performance reviews with clients to iterate and improve company's effectiveness for clients and get feedback to further strengthen services.
• Participate in monthly or periodic audit activities conducted by HSE or client in achieving required KPIs.

Manpower Management
• Recruit, hire, train all kitchen & operations staff.
• Conduct regular staff meeting/rollcall, administers schedules, employee performance evaluations, coaching & conduct counselling sessions if needed.

Requirements:
• Minimum 1 year working in a healthcare/Ministry/community hospital/central kitchen industry
• Relevant experience in hospital food catering will be advantage
• Able to perform under stress and independently
• Ability to make sound decisions
• Maintain a positive, empathetic & professional attitude towards customers etc.
• Possess sound understanding on IDDSI Framework (including easy chew) and work with the Senior Sous Chef to develop and plan menus that are approved by the Culinary Director.

Interested candidates, do submit your resume in MSWord or contact 62251232

title: F&B Operations / Manager
company: TIAN WAI TIAN FISH HEAD STEAMBOAT (1983) PTE. LTD.
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
We are seeking a dedicated and experienced F&B Supervisor to join our team and oversee the operations of our four outlets. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing day-to-day F&B operations, ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations, and delivering exceptional customer service. Additionally, they will play a crucial role in driving revenue, increasing customer loyalty, and creating a memorable guest experience.
Responsibilities:
1) Manage the daily operations of the F&B department and oversee the operation of 4 outlets.
2) Develop and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) for F&B operations.
3)Ensure SFA and NEA rules and regulations are met and achieve inclusive of cleanliness and work safety in food preparation and service areas.
4)Follows though opening and closing duties. Maintain safety requirements in the restaurant.
5)At the end of the shift, delivers all checks and reports.
6) Participate in weekly schedule planning and daily team floor plans.
7)Trains and provide on-going communication to staff and deliver good service to customers & also to handles customers feedback promptly. Ensuring that all employees are aware of any upcoming events or promotions.
8)To be able to work independently and manage smooth operations and troubleshoot problem areas effectively.
9)Develop and execute marketing strategies to increase sales, customer loyalty, revenue, and attract new customers. This may include social media marketing, email marketing, print advertising, or other marketing initiatives.
10) Develop and execute marketing strategies to increase sales, customer loyalty, and revenue, utilizing various channels such as social media marketing, email marketing, and print advertising.
11)Collaborate with chefs and F&B staff to develop new menu items. To promote restaurant, with festival events like Mother’s Day, CNY reunion dinner etc
12)Develop relationships with suppliers (current main suppliers all remain) only negotiate new contracts if we need extra new items like packaging etc.
13)Co Ordinate with office Marketing department - for online presence, including its website, social media accounts, and online review sites, customer reviews and engage with customers to build a positive online reputation for the restaurant.
14)Monitoring Market Trends: The F&B Manager should stay up-to-date with market trends, including changes in customer preferences, new technologies, and emerging competitors. This can help them to make informed decisions about menu changes, pricing, and promotions.
Qualifications:
· Minimum of 3 years of experience in F&B management, with a proven track record of success in driving revenue and profitability across multiple locations
· Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to motivate and develop a team
· Excellent organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment
· Strong customer service skills, with a passion for delivering exceptional experiences to customers
· Knowledge of health and safety regulations and compliance requirements in the restaurant industry
· Must be able to work on Weekends and PH
· Must be willing to work in Coffee Shop or Food Court environment.
· Have Class 3 vehicle licence will be an advantage
· Must possess Food Safety & Hygiene Certificate.
· No smoking
