title: Management Executive (Operation Assistant)
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
F&B Management Executive, F&B

Calling all talented Individuals who have passion for F&B industry!

We are looking for a reliable and innovative Management Executives who will work closely with the Operations Managers/Director, and is responsible with the daily operations, delivering ultimate guest experience and maintaining customer satisfactions. To achieve breakthroughs, the incumbent should innovate and implement measures to improve profitability and minimise costs, able to take clear directions, proactive in sharing feedback, willingness to share ideas and have a huge thirst for learning and self-improvement. A rich career path awaits those who are willing to devote their time and energy towards creating a rewarding environment for all.

The role requires a candidate with the ability to thrive in a versatile environment that ranges from P&L management, supply-vendor management, inventory accountability to floor operations. We take pride in our brand and recent growth, and so, this candidate will start with our on-the-ground operations team and will be able to move up to managerial type roles (pending performance and capability). The role will touch on customer experience through the use of digital and physical user journey.

Trainee to be involved in:
1. Management of operations of a restaurant
2. Writing and implementing Standard Operating Procedure for restaurant operations
3. Uphold cleanliness, hygiene and food safety regulations from licensing agencies

Competencies to be learned:
1. Restaurant operations and management skills
2. Policy, operation audit and cost control ability
3. Analytical, problem solving and crisis management skill in f&b business setting
4. Compliance and regulatory monitoring and adherence in f&b business setting
5. Learn about people development, management and leadership skills in f&b business setting
Administrative skills in f&b businesses


Job Responsibilities
-Achieves optimal business performance of the restaurant through identifying business opportunities, analysing, planning restaurant sales and profitability.
-Assists in staff management: recruitment, training, evaluation and promotion.
-Maintains an accurate and up-to-date plan of restaurant staffing needs, approving schedule labour hours, and ensures that the restaurant is staffed for all shifts.
-Prepares reports at the end of the week, including staff control, inventory, staff weekly performance report.
-Ensures the strict compliance by all service and kitchen staff to company’s standard operating procedures.
-Maintains a safe working and customer environment is in place to reduce the risk of injuries/accidents and completes incident reports and safety audits promptly.
-Communicate with the Service Crew to ensure efficient seating and table utilisation.
-Prompt food service to be performed during peak periods.
-Undertake any operation related duties as assigned by the Manager.

Job Requirements
-Proficient in spoken and written English.
-Possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Food & -Beverage Services Management, Hospitality/Tourism/Hotel Management or equivalent.
-Minimum one year similar working experience in F&B industry.
-Good analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills.
-Manages work pressure well and loves the prospect of a challenging job that enables personal growth.
-Able to lead, manage and motivate the team.
-Possess enthusiasm in learning and keen to get feedback for improvement; able to learn fast and adapt fast.
-Presentable, outgoing personality, possess exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to maintain good relationship with diverse guests and team members.
-May be required to work on weekends and public holidays, if need be.
-Self-motivated team player who is able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.

Join our Growing Team of Experienced and Enthusiastic Talents
-Competitive Salary
-Performance Incentives
-Career Progression
-Leave, Medical and Dental Benefits
-Staff Discounts
-Annual Leaves

title: BNPL Operation Manager - Global Payment
company_info: Founded in 2019, Global Payment's mission is to be "Payment inclusion, Financial Inclusion, Enrich Life." Global Payments provides End-to-end payments and treasury management in a single solution to Bytedance Group, optimize conversion by offering seamless payments and authentication.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

Team Introduction
In line with the globalization strategy and vision of the company, the Global Payments team builds a platform to provide cross-border payment solutions for all ByteDance's products and services, that are growing rapidly worldwide. This is an exciting opportunity to make an impact on global scale across all ByteDance's business usecases.

Responsibilities
• Own and drive key BNPL business metrics such as user adoption, conversion, approval, losses , OPEX and NPS
• Develop and implement optimization strategy to improve processes, reduce costs and enhance customer experience by collaboration with internal and external partners
• Generate and delivery actionable business insights through monitoring and analyzing business metrics and performance data. Create effective dashboards and reports
• Investigate root causes of metric deviances, customer complaints and operational problems. Lead incident management and develop solutions to prevent recurrences
• Lead and motivate a team of operational staff including those in disbursements, collections,payments, fraud management, customer service and risk management.
• Set KPIs and OKRs for the team based on operational targets. Ensure targets are met through coaching, training and performance management


Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or relevant field.
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in BNPL or consumer finance operations.
• Proven track record of driving operational metric improvement and reducing costs.
• Familiarity with BNPL business model and operations processes. • Strong analytical and root cause analysis skills.Detail and result-oriented approach.
• Excellent communication skills and ability to lead and mentor a team. Soft Skills:
• Focused on continuously enhancing the customer experience through improvements in operations.
• Ability to work cross-functionally and partner with other departments to achieve goals.


ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

We provide one stop recruitment solutions that include: Permanent Placement Contract & Temporary Placement Executive Search Work Pass & Payroll Services Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) Business Processing Outsourcing (BPO), in logistics, customer services and IT related scope (By submitting any application or résumé to us, you will be deemed to have agreed and consented to us collecting, using, retaining and disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration.)
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Benefits Summary:
Freight Forwarding
Basic up to $5000 + AWS + VB
Monday - Friday 8am - 6pm, Half Saturday 8am-1pm
Location: Kaki Bukit
Responsibilities:
Primarily responsible for managing the company’s overall operations, inbound logistics, outbound logistics, last-mile logistics, and general logistics strategy through implementation of systems and policies, and effective logistics vendor management.
Conduct capacity planning initiatives to ensure the company is well prepared to manage the growth of inventory and fulfillment of orders
Collaborate with internal teams and suppliers to identify and maintain resources needed to establish and provide an effective logistics and fulfillment networks.
Devise performance metrics for measurement, comparison, or evaluation of factors affecting operations and supply chain efficiency
Develop and maintain detailed inventories of materials and supplies located in the company, at sites, and in the factory; ensure that all necessary processes and operations setups are in place so that stock counts are accurate and any variances are fully investigated.
Analyze current inventories and procedures; recommend improvements to increase efficiency of supply chain and profitability for the company.
Requirements:

title: Bulk Carrier Operation Executive / Manager
company_info: MMSL Pte. Ltd. is a ship owning arm of Marubeni Corporation, Japn with a fleet of modern bulk carriers, ranging from hadysize to Kamsarmax and post-panamax size and product tankers. The company was founded in 2011 here in Singapore, utilizing more than 30 years ship owing and operating expertise, aiming for further growth in worldwide famous shipping center to prove more safe & higher quality in maritime logistics and services for world-wide reputable clients. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
-Lead daily operation of the vessels as ship-owners and/or bareboat charterers.
-Ensure safe operation of vessels in cooperation with ship-managers in accordance with industry regulations as well as in-house procedures.
-Ensure adequate coverage of insurance and liaise with underwriters and/or claim handlers
-Ensure compliance with charter party requirements and company procedures as well as all relevant operational information between vessels, brokers, Charterers and agents.
-Monitor and record all details of voyage performance including off-hire, stoppages and delays.
-Arrangement of bunkers at designated port.
-Conduct loss prevention proactively.
-Negotiate claims and respond promptly and effectively and take a proactive approach in solving problems.
-Assist and liaise with Chartering team concerning any vessel information, requirements, questionnaires, certification and scheduling as part of all pre and post fixture support.
-Check loading/discharging ports planning and discuss with ship-managers in compliance with loading/discharging port requirements and monitor hold cleanliness requirements.
-Arrange all routine invoicing.
-Handle dispute with Charterers by having assistance of defense club as appropriate.
-Have a sound knowledge of charter party, ship-management contract and other relevant contracts.
-Take care of charter hire payments and final settlement when time-charter is completed.
-Go through ship-managers’ management and accounting reports.
-Carry out briefing of top 4 officers/engineers.
-Choose drydocking place in coordination with ship-managers by taking various factors into consideration such estimated deviation expenses, total drydocking expenses, duration, etc.
-Optimize utilization of resources.
-Propose workflow improvements to improve efficiency.
-Attend meeting, seminars, conferences to represent the company.
-Perform additional duties as assigned by superior.

title: Operating Engineer
company_info: We believe that it is the task of each generation to leave its children a healthier planet. To succeed in this, we create responsible choices, every day – choices that enable people to live a more sustainable life and consume fewer natural resources. There are roughly 5,000 Neste employees in Europe, Asia and North America. We are the world’s largest producer of renewable diesel refined from waste and residues, and we are also bringing renewable solutions to the aviation and plastics industries. We are looking for the best professionals in their respective fields – people who have the will to make the world cleaner.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Are you our next creator of change?
This is for you who wants to have a real impact on creating a healthier planet for our children every day. At Neste, you will be working for the world’s leading producer of sustainable aviation fuel and renewable diesel and a forerunner in developing renewable and circular feedstock solutions for polymers and chemicals. Let’s create transformation for a sustainable future together.

We are looking for you,
Operating Engineer
to our Operations team in Tuas, Singapore.

You will focus on assisting the development, optimizing, troubleshooting of plant process and equipment to achieve high operational utilization, availability, profitability, flexibility, process safety and overall safety. In this job you will work closely with Operations Manager. to operate integrated refinery safe, reliable and efficient.
Together with you and your expertise, we can make an impact today and keep our promises for tomorrow.

Reasons to join
Real impact right now. We work in an inspiring and evolving business environment, where everything we do serves one purpose: to create a healthier planet for our children. To drive a growing impact as a global leader in renewable and circular solutions we live by our values every day; we care, we have courage, we cooperate.
Safety and caring. We value safety always and everywhere. We want our work to feel good and do good. At Neste, we nurture a culture where everyone is welcome and feels safe, respected, and encouraged to be their unique true selves.
Exciting growth. Transformation brings new possibilities and fosters our courage and curiosity. As a global growing company, we support personal development with versatile learning and career opportunities. Collaboration is the key, and we believe in flexible, smart ways of working.

More about the job
Your role in our team / in creating a sustainable future
Responsible for the execution of the S&OP plan of the unit she/ he is in charge of
Responsible for the monitoring of plant efficiency and provides (daily) instructions/ orders to the shift teams
Responsible for the review and update of start-up, shutdown and operating guidelines or instructions and procedures.
Responsible for Initiating and applying multi-disciplinary process design and control strategies in relation to processes and systems
Responsible of finding and resolving different process limitations and optimising production to ensure high utilisation and availability
Responsible for catalyst / absorbent etc. follow up and lead team to i.e. change out absorbent
Responsible to monitor and optimise the day-to-day consumption of chemicals, additives and/ or any other consumables for the assigned units
Responsible for the first line troubleshooting, optimisation and engineering support of the assigned unit
Responsible for correct reporting of several daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly reports like; Utility reporting, KPI reporting etc.
Responsible for optimisation on assigned unit’s contribution to the CPEI, Carbon footprint and energy efficiency of the integrated refinery
Responsible for to facilitate/ participate in safety assessments like i.e. HAZOP, PHA
Investigation lead of Incidents/Near miss investigations
Key member and Responsible to drive the Act to Improve program for the Singapore refinery
Member of the Operational Excellence team
Responsible for correctness, review and improvement of assigned Operations NMS Work Procedures
Responsible for the Operating Manual for the assigned units in charge
Responsible as change manager in small optimisation/ improvement projects
Responsible to review interlock bypass forms
Liaison of Operations to 3rd parties/suppliers
Responsibilities in other processes
Responsible as appointed Operations Engineering representatives at plant investment projects (PIPE)
Responsible to be Operations Engineering representatives for PHA studies
Responsible as Operations Engineering representatives other studies, projects
Responsible for verification of invoicing variable production costs by tracking consumption of utilities/ chemicals of assigned units
Responsible for improving the competency, knowledge retention of the Operations team with respect to the technology or technical aspects of the assigned units etc.
Keys to success in this role
Minimum Bachelor in Chemical Engineering
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in oil refining and petrochemical industries
Strong interpersonal and planning skills
High safety standard and strong influencing skills
Good team player and positive thinking
Let’s get you started
Wondering whether we are a match or not? Take a short test at neste.com/game.


We will do our best to contact you within 2 weeks after the application time has ended. The recruitment process will include interviews and a possible aptitude assessment. (The person selected for the position must pass a health examination including a drug test. A security clearance is obtained with their consent.)

About Neste
Neste creates solutions for combating climate change and accelerating a shift to a circular economy. With over 75 years of refining expertise, we are now the world’s leading producer of sustainable aviation fuel and renewable diesel and a forerunner in developing renewable and circular feedstock solutions for polymers and chemicals. We have set aspirational targets for climate, biodiversity, human rights, as well as our supply chain and raw materials. Our ambition is to make the Porvoo oil refinery in Finland the most sustainable refinery in Europe by 2030. Together with our partners we are aiming at a carbon neutral and nature positive value chain by 2040. Our success is created by 5,400 professionals working in 16 countries. Read more: neste.com. Get inspired by our story.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Sales and Operations Manager to join our team and contribute to the growth and success of our cleaning services business. As the Sales and Operations Manager, you will be responsible for a wide range of sales and operational activities, ensuring customer satisfaction, fostering client relationships, and driving business expansion.

Responsibilities:
Sales Quotations and Customer Engagement:Prepare accurate sales quotations and proposals for potential customers.
Conduct sales calls and on-site visits to engage with customers, understand their needs, and present our services effectively.
Visit potential customers, provide comprehensive quotations, and develop proposals to secure new business opportunities.
Client Relationship Management:Handle client inquiries, address feedback, and resolve any issues promptly and satisfactorily.
- Maintain and nurture relationships with both new and existing clients, ensuring their satisfaction and loyalty.
Leadership and Team Management:Exhibit self-motivation and strong leadership skills to provide direction and lead a team of sales executives.
Drive the achievement of sales targets through effective team coordination, guidance, and motivation.
Presentation and Communication:Possess excellent presentation and explanation skills to effectively showcase our services and benefits to potential clients.
Operations and Inventory Management:Ensure healthy staffing levels and oversee training programs for cleaners to meet operational requirements.
Manage the procurement of materials and implement effective inventory controls for cleaning services.
Strategic Planning and Growth:Develop and execute a growth strategy focused on increasing profitability and customer satisfaction.
Lead the expansion into the residential sector (B2C) by devising strategic plans and overseeing the sales team's efforts in that market.
Problem Resolution:Supervise and ensure the timely mitigation of problems, complaints, and issues in a satisfactory manner, both on-site and in coordination with the relevant teams.
Requirements:
Proven experience in sales, preferably in the cleaning industry, is highly desirable.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to develop and maintain relationships with clients.
Demonstrated leadership abilities and the capability to lead a sales team effectively.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Results-oriented mindset with a focus on achieving sales targets and driving business growth.
Ability to strategize and devise effective plans to penetrate the residential market.
Sound knowledge of operations management and inventory controls.
Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently.
Join our team and be part of our exciting journey as we expand our cleaning services business, providing exceptional service and building lasting customer relationships. Your expertise and strategic leadership will play a vital role in our continued success.

To apply, please submit your resume along with a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and achievements in sales and operations management.

Note: Experience in the cleaning industry will be considered a plus, but we welcome applicants with transferable skills and a proven track record in sales and operations management.

Roles & Responsibilities
Do you enjoy creative problem-solving in a fast-paced environment? Do you love organizing and facilitating efficient workflows and processes? Then this might be the perfect opportunity for you. We are looking for a highly motivated and self-driven Associate Business Operations Lead to assist in various business operational activities, including marketing, business development, supply chain, product launches, and more.

Collaborate with internal and/or external stakeholders to resolve operational issues that arise and ensure timely and effective problem-solving or escalation.
Establish and maintain strong relationships with all third-party agencies as the point of contact for matters relating to business operations..
Support supply chain management activities, such as inventory planning, order management, and vendor coordination.
Stay up-to-date with industry best practices to identify areas for operational improvement and propose solutions to enhance efficiency and minimize errors.
Maintain and ensure accuracy of the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) documentation for business operations.
Participate in special projects with in-function and cross-functional teams, providing leadership and expertise when required.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement strategies, process changes, and deliverables in a timely manner.
Assist in the execution of promotions and campaigns across all sales channels.
Handle other ad-hoc duties as assigned.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in business administration, operations management, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Proven experience in operations or a related field, preferably in a fast-paced environment.
Strong project coordination and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to gather and interpret data to drive decision-making and problem-solving.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality.
Ability to adapt to changing business needs and work well under pressure.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and project management tools.
Experience in supply chain management is a plus.
Nice-to-haves
Self-starter. Have started personal projects and seen them to completion with relative success
Able to give and take feedback well
Passionate about peak performance and actively works on improving their mental and physical performance consistently: Does some form of exercise at least 3 times a week
Remote working experience
Our goal is to raise the overall talent density of our team. We are not just looking to plainly fill a role. The expectation is that you will have the freedom and autonomy to plan and execute on what is necessary to get us results. And that you can do so without the need for someone to oversee your work.

Think you have what it takes? Submit your application and let’s chat!

HYDRAGUN is a Singapore-based, remote-first e-commerce startup that creates simple, premium recovery essentials that help athletes and ordinary people to overcome pain and live their best lives. Our products – including the Hydragun and the Hydragun Atom massage guns, the HeatPulse knee massager, and the HeatPod sauna blanket – are trusted by Olympians and World Champions, and have been featured in international publications like Forbes, Vogue, and Tech Radar.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
If you enjoy working in a fast paced environment with an analytical and logical mindset to understand complex processes, this could be the role for you.

As a Product Specialist, you will be part of Product Team and provide support for various initiatives and any associated business transformation projects. You may be involved in multiple initiatives, working across the whole Product lifecycle, researching new initiatives, business process changes, configuration changes or system modifications. Through strong partnership with Business, Operations counterparts, and as part of a Triad with Design & Research and Technology, you'll work on product deliverables. Primary areas of focus will include Product discovery work and analysis, design and requirements gathering and development in an Agile fashion and by partnering with Scrum Teams on 2 weeks sprints but also process modelling and redesign, user interaction (gathering feedback, providing training and day to day collaboration). As a Product Specialist, you'll critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Additionally, you'll assist in the overall coordination and management of the product, including status, scorecards, and other key product management functions.

Job responsibilities:
• Coordinate with various areas of Operations, Middle Office, Finance and Technology to build business requirements, procedures, and processes. This will include product delivery management, requirements management (elicitation, documentation, prioritization, etc.), process mapping, process design, procedure authoring, org design, capacity sizing, etc.
• Conduct data analysis, data collection, and synthesis to translate into empirical solutions or evidence that can optimize our set of Products.
• Work with the Triad and business partners to design, introduce, or re-engineer existing processes and business applications
• Conduct product management, planning and analysis, including, documenting business requirements via stories, detailing issues and problems, and drafting business and technical work/data flows
• Facilitate or support product management, create materials for presentation, and provide reporting/metrics as required

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:
• Bachelor's degree required
• At least 1 year of Product management / business analysis experience including knowledge and exposure to Agile / Scrum ceremonies
• Good communication and presentations skills with the ability to deal with different stakeholder groups to elicit business requirements, procedures, and processes
• Intermediate experience using Microsoft Office, including Excel, Visio and PowerPoint
• Good organizational and prioritization skills, detail-oriented, and strong interpersonal skills
• Ability to analyze and resolve product-related issues and follow through with set objectives
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, be flexible, follow tight deadlines, organize, and prioritize work

To apply for this position, please use the following URL:
https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=b5794999519bde36ae4ffb7cbb3da2af

title: ICT Executive (Operations, Administration, Data Management & Protection)
company_info: Presbyterian Community Services (PCS) is a social service agency registered with the Commissioner of Charities and a member of the National Council of Social Service. We have 27 centres spanning across the island. PCS is one of the foremost providers of pre-school education and has a wide range of services such as infant care, childcare, special needs, special needs school, residential home for teenage girls, youth-at-risk programme, eldercare services, emergency relief scheme and other services to meet the multi-generational needs of the population. PCS is an appointed partner operator for children services and centre of specialisation in integrated childcare for children with special needs. PCS is also a foundation member of St. Luke’s Hospital. In 2017, PCS, together with Grace Orchard School (GOS), embarked on a pilot project to train girls from GOS to be Teacher Childcare Aides. This project won the MOE-NCSS Innovation Award in 2018. With the positive outcome and good feedback received from this pilot project, PCS went further to plan for a scale up of this training to reach out to the Post-18 group of girls who have left special schools and are employable, to offer them a new training / vocational pathway - Educarer Aide Training (ECAT). PCS believes that with the structured training, the girls will be well-equipped for the early childhood care tasks, enabling them to work and contribute meaningfully at the childcare centres. In July 2019, PCS was awarded the 5th Enabling Employers Award (Innovative Project category) by SG Enable, in view of the potential employment possibilities for girls with mild intellectual disability after the ECAT.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Employer: Grace Orchard School

Job Summary:
The ICT Executive shall assist the VP Admin and HOD (ICT), in planning, procuring and managing ICT, PA and AV solutions that support school operations, administration, data management and protection. He/she shall organise and conduct relevant training for staff in support of AV systems and ICT tools implemented in the school. He/she shall also work closely with ICT Executive (T&L) and be ready to assist in areas of work involving teaching and learning when requested by HOD (ICT). Finally, he/she shall report to the VP Admin for the proper discharge of his/her daily duties & responsibilities in the school.

Duties and Responsibilities:
To co-ordinate and manage ICT-based T&L programmes as tasked by school management and HOD (ICT) and ensure that all school policies, guidelines and standards are adhered to (including documentation, safety checks, etc).
To gather the ICT needs of the school and proactively scan the market for technology trends and new tools that support special education school operations & administration and introduce innovative ICT projects for school’s consideration.
To plan and purchase ICT equipment and resources in support of school daily operations, administration, data management and protection as directed by the VP Admin and HOD (ICT).
To manage the school’s ICT resources (including, servers, networks, PCs, notebooks, SMARTboards, printers, PA & AV equipment, charging carts) in the LAN rooms, office, staffroom, special rooms and classrooms (including maintenance, condemnation, upgrading and inventory check)
To organise and conduct relevant briefings and trainings for staff for all ICT-based operational & administrative systems to be implemented
To provide video taking & editing services to staff as approved by HOD (ICT) and school management in support of major school events
To provide AV support for all school events (including training student PA crew, if need be)
To undertake any other ICT or operational tasks (relating to school operations & administration) as directed by the school management/HOD (ICT)/ Corporate Office/Allied Professionals Office/Vocational Education Department.
To manage and maintain canteen messaging system as overall administrator
To manage and maintain the school website and social media platforms
To manage and maintain all platforms related to Microsoft 365, student management system, HR & Finance management system etc.
To manage and maintain file server and wifi infrastructure in the school.
Requirements:
A Diploma in IT, Computer Science, Engineering or related qualification
Minimum 3 years of relevant working experience of ICT support
Able to work independently as well as an effective team player, possess positive working attitude, energetic and proactive

title: Cafe Manager
company_info: Company Overview We are a fast growing chain-stores retailer of ladies fashion footwear. Established in 2001, PAZZION caters to the modern, sophisticated trend-setter with an uncompromising standard for taste and quality. High-caliber craftsmanship and an unwavering attention to detail mean each pair of shoes is painstakingly designed to bring you the best in style and comfort. PAZZION is available in major retail malls across SINGAPORE with its flagship outlet at Wisma Atria Orchard Road. Internationally, PAZZION’s presence can be found in Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Japan, Mauritius, South Korea, Thailand and Vietnam. Our Mission and Vision PAZZION’s Vision is to establish itself as a recognizable international brand, known for its high-quality products that push the envelope of fashion trends. We aim to offer trendy, fashion-forward footwear and accessories with an emphasis on quality, style and value.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As the Cafe Manager at PAZZION Cafe, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth daily operations of our cafe. You will be responsible for overseeing the cafe staff, managing inventory, upholding our high standards of customer service, and contributing to the overall success of our cafe.

Job Responsibilities

1. Team Leadership:
• Recruit, train, and supervise cafe staff, including baristas and kitchen staff.
• Set performance expectations and provide ongoing coaching and feedback.
• Foster a positive work environment that encourages teamwork, enthusiasm, and excellent customer service.

2. Operational Management:
• Ensure the cafe is well-maintained, clean, and organized at all times.
• Manage inventory, including ordering supplies and monitoring stock levels.
• Oversee the preparation and presentation of food and beverages, ensuring quality and consistency.
• Planning of monthly roster for the team, taking into account peak hours and customer traffic.

3. Customer Service:
• Lead by example in delivering exceptional customer service.
• Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and feedback in a professional and timely manner.
• Implement strategies to enhance the overall customer experience.

4. Financial Management:
• Monitor daily sales and expenses to achieve budgetary goals.
• Implement cost-control measures to maximize profitability.
• Assist in pricing strategies and menu development.

5. Compliance and Safety:
• Ensure compliance with all health and safety regulations.
• Maintain cleanliness and hygiene standards in accordance with food safety guidelines.
• Stay updated on relevant industry regulations and best practices.

Job Requirements
• Minimum 3 years of relevant experience as a café manager
• Able to work under pressure in a fast pace environment
• Passion for good food and beverage
• Commitment to excellent customer service
• Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to manage and motivate a team
• Candidates with barista skills will be an added advantage

Administration Manager job brief
We are looking for an experienced Administration Manager to supervise daily support operations of our company and plan the most efficient administrative procedures. You will lead a team of professionals to complete a range of administrative duties in different departments.
A great administration manager has excellent communication and organizational skills. The ideal candidate will be well-versed in departmental procedures and policies and will be able to actively discover new ways to do the job more efficiently.

Familiarity with financial and facilities management principles

Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Accomplishes human resource objectives by recruiting, selecting, orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees; communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, appraising, and reviewing job contributions; planning and reviewing compensation actions, and enforcing policies and procedures.
Achieves operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; implementing production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; and implementing change.
Meets financial objectives by forecasting requirements, preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances, and initiating corrective actions.
Plans & costs control by reviewing portion control and quantities of preparation; minimizing waste; and ensuring high quality of preparation.
- Avoids legal challenges by conforming to the regulations of the alcoholic beverage commission.
Maximizes bar profitability by ensuring portion control and monitoring the accuracy of charges.
Publicizes the bar by designing and placing advertisements; inviting media to review the bar; contacting local, regional, and national magazines with feature ideas; and encouraging local businesses to hold social events in the bar Maintains a safe, secure, and healthy environment by establishing, following, and enforcing sanitation standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations; securing revenues; developing and implementing disaster plans; maintaining security and sprinkler systems; and maintaining parking lot and walkways.
Maintains ambiance by controlling lighting, background music, linen service, glassware, dinnerware, and utensil quality and placement; and monitoring beverage and food presentation and service.
Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.
Enhances department and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; and exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments
Job Requirement
Bachelor’s degree in operations management or related field.
Experience in management, operations, and leadership.
Understanding of general finance and budgeting, including profit and loss, balance sheet, and cash-flow management.
Ability to build consensus and relationships among managers, partners, and employees.
Excellent communication skills.
Preferably with retail or F&B experience.
Solid understanding of financial management.

title: Manager, Auxiliary Services
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The NTU Office of Commercial and Auxiliary Services (OCAS) oversees the management of estate leases and commercial services (such as leasing of spaces for F&B, amenities & lifestyle services), and auxiliary services (such as car parks and shuttle bus services) for NTU’s main campus, Novena campus and NTU@one-north campus.
OCAS is looking for a dynamic and adept individual to be part of the team to oversee the management of auxiliary services, including transportation services (the campus shuttle bus services and car parks) for the University and administrative support management.
Key Responsibilities:
Management of the campus shuttle bus services to meet the transport connectivity needs of the University community and working closely with vendors to deliver reliable and efficient services.
Management of car park facilities on campus and other transport-related solutions such as electric vehicle (EV) charging, parking app etc.
Ensure good governance and administration of contracts with vendors for bus and car parking services by reviewing and monitoring service delivery and performance standards in adherence to the contract specifications.
Manage relationship with a wide spectrum of stakeholders including the University community (faculty members, staff, students, campus residents), vendors and partners to improve customer satisfaction of the transport services and to create collaborative working relationships with vendors and potential partners.
Manage budget and financial targets for the team.
Oversight on the procurement and administrative matters for the department. Review and enhance the policies and procedures for the team for better efficiency.
Requirements:
About 5 years of relevant working experience in managing shuttle bus services, car parking and operations management. Experience working in a similar function in an Institute of Higher Learning would be advantageous.
Prior experience in managerial/administrative role and able to lead a team effectively.
Ability to build and manage relationships with multiple stakeholders and partners.
An understanding and appreciation of community needs and experience.
Able to multi-task and deliver quality results.
Independent and meticulous worker who is able to work with minimum supervision.
Proficient in MS Office applications.

title: Assistant Manager (Lab Operations), A*SRL
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Logistics / Supply Chain, Sciences / Laboratory / R&D
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This position is responsible for Lab Operations of the workplace (research labs and offices), aligned with A*SRL’s strategic goals.
The job scope encompasses the maintenance of the lab facilities, ensuring an optimal and sustainable environment to facilitate world-class scientific skin research. You will assist and report to the head of General and Lab Operations to implement operation initiatives and achieve key lab operations KPIs.
Key accountabilities:
a) To support the day-to-day lab operations for A*SRL Labs, including procurement of lab-related services and supplies and upkeep of lab systems and inventories.
b) Ensure laboratories are adequately stocked in a timely manner, with an adequate flow of laboratory supplies, e.g. glassware, consumables, dry ice, gas cylinders.
c) To assist in the preparation of lab reports and tasks assigned by Head of Operations.
d) To assist Head of Operations to establish lab management systems including inventory control, spaces allocation and renovation projects, lab budgets etc.
e) To promote green practices and sustainability in operations and maintenance of facilities.
f) To assist Asset Management Officer for asset related matters (eg. Asset sighting exercise, Asset disposal coordination).
g) Engage internal lab stakeholders, A*STAR functional partners (eg. OSFA) and various external parties e.g., Landlord, Contractors, Suppliers in well-keeping of A*STAR lab facilities.
h) To perform the role of Logistics Officer for demand aggregation matters, maintenance of equipment PPMS (Platform Pilot Management System).
i) Implement projects relating to operational processes and system enhancement.
j) To support general operations (eg. Events organisation, issuance of ART kits etc).
k) To assist in business continuity management.
l) Other exigencies of duties as directed by head of General & Lab Operations, and/or Director (Corporate Services) and/or Executive Director of A*SRL.
Job Requirements:
a) Degree in Sciences or equivalent.
b) Relevant work experience in lab settings is an added advantage.
c) A self-driven and meticulous individual who has the strong ability to multi-task.
d) Possess strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication and organization skills.
e) Confident to communicate at all levels and able to think creatively and apply strategic thinking to tasks assigned.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

company_info: About Bosch Group The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing. It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source. The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life. Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. The company is active in all the company’s four business sectors of Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. The Asia Pacific headquarters for its Automotive Aftermarket, Building Technology and Bosch Software Innovations businesses, as well as operations for Corporate Research and Advance Engineering, and Information Technology, are part of Robert Bosch (SEA) Pte Ltd. In Bosch, we are committed through our EVP ensuring all our associates to GROW, ENJOY and INSPIRE during their journey with us.
description:

Company Description
About Bosch Group
The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing. It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source. Bachelor/master’s degree in business administration, industrial or mechanical engineering or information technology (ideally with major in logistics or operations management)

title: Director, Technical Project / Program Management
company: APPLIED MATERIALS SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: Applied Materials, Inc. is a Fortune 500 global growth company and the world's largest supplier of wafer fabrication systems and services to the global semiconductor industry. As the global leader in providing manufacturing solutions for the semiconductor, flat panel display and solar photovoltaic industries, our technologies help make the products that change the world. Applied is focused on delivering technologies that enable customers to solve their high-value problems better, faster and at a lower cost; deliverying the differentiated, valuable and sustainable solutions that provide them with a competitive advantage.
address: APPLIED MATERIALS BUILDING, 8 UPPER CHANGI ROAD NORTH 506906
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
General Profile
As a team leader, helps Applied achieve its medium to long-term strategic objectives for enhancing operations performance. Utilizes highly specialized skills in areas of advanced analytics, information systems, operations management, executive-level communication, and cross functional leadership to scale projects in support of Applied’ s business objectives. This role will be focused on bringing together key SMEs across the organizations and lead the team to scope, develop detailed plan, and execute to the “Operations-Leadership Framework” that comes out of the JOLT Organization. The individual will set up an organization, market, train, institutionalize, and track impact to take the “JOLT Objectives” forward in a sustainable manner
Key responsibilities
The candidate will drive Applied’ s strategic initiatives in following areas:
Be core team member of the Smart Initiative team. Define and develop digital platform for internal operations and suppliers. Leverage advanced analytics and Artificial intelligence to enhance WW manufacturing effectiveness
Predictive Early Warning system
Adaptive iOMS for shortage mitigation
Self-Healing to avoid part failures
Ai Enhanced SPC Chamber Matching
AR/AI QC & Defect Disposition
AI controlled swarmed AMRs in Warehouse
Virtual Manufacturing Assistant and AI based Skill Augmentation to reduce DMRs and NCs
Work with suppliers to strengthen the S&OP process and the process of sharing demand information. Enable Build & Supply Alignment
Develop Enterprise-wide aligned supply planning process
Integrate it with Supply Chain ecosystem (Suppliers, CMs & OSPs)
Strengthen link between Supply Planning & Build Planning
Establish process to align plans with Supply Chain. Align terminology & training. Heat Map Automation
Process Automation: Automate material supply heatmap analysis and constrained parts allocation across BUs
Deploy BIC SP processes, constraint allocation & align with AGS S&OP
Support Operations Capacity planning team
Develop agile capacity planning capability using advanced analytics
Integrate demand forecast with operations capacity planning process
Achieve Factory linearity objective for improved customer trust. Develop strategy and roadmap for changes in factory planning processes and systems to enable a “linear” factory output, while allowing prioritization for critical upside opportunities
Churn Policy Implementation
Slotting Zones: Align zone slotting policy across enterprise
Exception Process: Define approval process for exception activities and align R&R across organizations
Hot Lots and Upsides: Align hot lot and upside definitions
Deploy IT Tools for new milestones & change control
Operational efficiency – Develop improvement roadmap for key business processes to cost-effectively scale to production targets of up to year 2028
Improve productivity of resources and continuously deliver sustainable reduction in Cost Per Tool (CPT)
Efficiency improvement for direct labor, indirect, WH labor, freight
Process efficiency improvement through SmartFactory / SmartOperations
Redesign build process steps (Virtual Build/Feeder Modules/Kaizen), WH storage densification; WH Process Automation using robotics
Lead demand forecasting and planning for SPG
Support senior executives in managing product demand planning objectives by developing demand forecasting models, data analytics infrastructure and executive reports across all business units
Work cross-functionally, gather and analyze industry trends data, historic sales data, and key market share metrics
Integrate industry benchmarks, customer-technology roadmaps, and develop demand plans. Analyze potential bottlenecks and recommend mitigation strategies based on data analysis and insights
Build strong cross-functional engagements across multiple business units with Chief Operating Officers, Field Group, Manufacturing, and Supply Chain Organizations
Analyze data, build demand forecasting models, build analytical frameworks, evaluate trends, and compare with industry benchmarks
Identify and integrate software toolsets for automation, standardization of data collection and analytics, data security, etc. partnering with IT team
Build dashboards for effective executive-level communication across businesses and functions
Core team member for developing Scenario management capability
Collaborate with Operations leadership Team for developing scenario-based decision making for S&OP trade-off. Deploy advanced analytics to scale company’s existing demand forecasting capabilities to incorporate macroeconomic, technology, and customer scenarios
Cyclicality playbook – Manage downturn / upturn
Functional Knowledge
Demonstrates a broad and comprehensive understanding of enterprise information systems, e.g., SAP, Salesforce, Hadoop, etc.
Possesses hands-on expertise of big-data management using advanced analytics tools, e.g., Alteryx, Python, Tableau, and MS Excel.
Is adept with advanced decision and data science techniques of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Possesses cross-functional expertise in strategy, marketing, manufacturing, logistics functions
Business Expertise
Has knowledge of Applied’ s technology footprint, vast product portfolio, and customer base that will enable in developing roadmaps to scale strategic initiatives across the enterprise
Demonstrates a comprehensive knowledge of the Wafer Fab Equipment industry and Applied’ s organization structure in order to contribute to the commercial objectives of the business. This includes enabling the business unit to differentiate itself from the competition
Leadership
Leads key cross-functional project teams and initiatives
Acts as a mentor and role model to others within the organization
Has experience with coaching and mentoring direct reports. Should have created training and development roadmaps for direct reports, carried out periodic performance appraisals, and provided developmental feedback
Interpersonal Skills
Demonstrates sound communication skills to be able to modify the beliefs and opinions of other peers in the business unit.
Creates strong business relationships with key stakeholders to enlist their active support
Education
Bachelor's Degree in mechanical or production engineering. Master’s degree in Business Administration preferred
Experience
15+ Years of multi-national experience with track record of growth and high business impact
Cross-functional experience in management consulting, operations strategy and management, strategic marketing preferred

Maintain safe and healthy work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations

Accomplish operations and organization mission by completing related results as needed
Minimize operations labour budget expectations
Responsible for all Outlet Managers and Supervisors.
Run a safe, injury/accident-free workplace
Establish contracts and pricing and ensuring proper maintenance and serving as primary liaison with the local government agencies, such as fire, police, health, labour and safety agencies
